original: ba lang ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ba lang ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not a non-cow,

original: ba lang nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir ba lang yin no //
analyzed: ba lang nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir ba lang yin no //
translated: because it possesses cowness, it is a cow.

original: de bzhin du dkar po nyid kyis ni dkar po'am dkar po ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du dkar po nyid kyis ni dkar po'am dkar po ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, it is not white or not white because of whiteness,

original: dkar po nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir dkar po yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dkar po nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir dkar po yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: because it possesses whiteness, it is white.

original: des na yon tan la sogs pa tha dad par byed pa cig car ma bzung ba'i phyir gzhan dang gzhan mthong yang gcig nyid kyi blor 'gyur zhing phyis ni yon tan 'ba' zhig mthong ba zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na yon tan la sogs pa tha dad par byed pa cig car ma bzung ba'i phyir gzhan dang gzhan mthong yang gcig nyid kyi blor 'gyur zhing phyis ni yon tan 'ba' zhig mthong ba zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since the differentia of the qualities, etc. are not apprehended simultaneously, even though one sees the other, there is the cognition of unity, and later there is the cognition of the mere quality.

original: ci ste yon tan bzung ba'i phyir na phyis tha dad pa'i blor 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste yon tan bzung ba'i phyir na phyis tha dad pa'i blor 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if the cognition of difference later arises because the quality is apprehended,

original: 'di la brjod pa //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa //
translated: we reply:

original: yon tan la sogs khyad par ni //
analyzed: yon tan la sogs khyad par ni //
translated: If the difference of the quality, etc.

original: gzung phyir du mar rtogs 'gyur na //
analyzed: gzung phyir du mar rtogs 'gyur na //
translated: is apprehended, there is the cognition of multiplicity.

original: 'gyur mod de ltar yin na yang //
analyzed: 'gyur mod de ltar yin na yang //
translated: Although this is so,

original: 'di dag gi 'brel 'chol bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di dag gi 'brel 'chol bar 'gyur //
translated: there is a confusion of their relation.

original: sngar rdzas gcig tu bzung nas phyis khyad par bzung yang tha dad par sbyor ba med pa'i phyir 'chol bar thal lo //
analyzed: sngar rdzas gcig tu bzung nas phyis khyad par bzung yang tha dad par sbyor ba med pa'i phyir 'chol bar thal lo //
translated: Though one previously apprehends them as one substantial entity and later apprehends them as distinct, it is not the case that they are connected as different.

original: 'di ltar gcig nyid du bzung na phyis gcig nyid la khyad par du ma sbyar bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gcig nyid du bzung na phyis gcig nyid la khyad par du ma sbyar bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir na /
translated: Thus, if one apprehends them as one, later one would connect many distinctions to that one.

original: khyad par du ma yang gcig gi yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par du ma yang gcig gi yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would follow that many would belong to one.

original: yul dad pas tha dad par sbyar ba ni gcig tu mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: yul dad pas tha dad par sbyar ba ni gcig tu mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if one connects them as different through faith in the object, they would not be one.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: yul tha dad pa la yang khyad par yin pa'i phyir yul tha dad pa de yang gcig gi yin no zhes bya bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul tha dad pa la yang khyad par yin pa'i phyir yul tha dad pa de yang gcig gi yin no zhes bya bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if the object is different, it is a distinction, and that different object would also belong to one.

original: de'i phyir du ma dus gcig tu 'dzin pa ma yin la phyis gzung ba'i khyad par ni gang gi yin pa mi shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir du ma dus gcig tu 'dzin pa ma yin la phyis gzung ba'i khyad par ni gang gi yin pa mi shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, many are not apprehended at one time, and one does not know to which object the distinction that is apprehended later belongs.

original: khyad par tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa'i phyogs la ni tha dad pa 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir 'brel pa 'chol bar shin tu gsal lo //
analyzed: khyad par tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa'i phyogs la ni tha dad pa 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir 'brel pa 'chol bar shin tu gsal lo //
translated: In particular, in the case of the position that they are different or not different, since there is no difference at all, the connection is clearly very confused.

original: grangs can gyi lta ba la ni /
analyzed: grangs can gyi lta ba la ni /
translated: In the SƒÅ·πÉkhya view,

original: sgra stsogs du ma nyid yin phyir //
analyzed: sgra stsogs du ma nyid yin phyir //
translated: since sound and so on are many,

original: cig car du ma 'dzin par 'grub //üîΩbkod pa can ni ma bzung bar //
analyzed: cig car du ma 'dzin par 'grub // bkod pa can ni ma bzung bar //
translated: it is established that many are apprehended simultaneously.üîΩSince it is not tenable to apprehend

original: bkod pa 'dzin pa mi rung phyir //üîΩbum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad ni de tsam lnga'i gnas pa'i khyad par ram /
analyzed: bkod pa 'dzin pa mi rung phyir // bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad ni de tsam lnga'i gnas pa'i khyad par ram /
translated: an arrangement without apprehending the arranged,

original: yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid yin no //üîΩdes @276a * //
analyzed: yon tan gsum gyi bdag nyid yin no // des @276a * //
translated: all things such as pots are the particular abodes of the five subtle objects or the nature of the three qualities.

original: na sgra la sogs par gzung ba na yon tan gsum gzung ba dang / de tsam gzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: na sgra la sogs par gzung ba na yon tan gsum gzung ba dang / de tsam gzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore when sound and so on are apprehended, the three qualities are apprehended, and the subtle objects are apprehended.

original: de ma bzung bar ni de'i gnas pa 'dzin par mi srid de /
analyzed: de ma bzung bar ni de'i gnas pa 'dzin par mi srid de /
translated: Without apprehending those, it is impossible to apprehend their abode,

original: sor mo ma bzung bar khu chur mi 'dzin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sor mo ma bzung bar khu chur mi 'dzin pa bzhin no //
translated: just as without apprehending the fingers, it is impossible to apprehend the fist.

original: 'bras bu gzhan gcig nyid skyed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu gzhan gcig nyid skyed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Also, it is not that a single other effect is produced.

original: 'bras bu thams cad rgyu las tha mi dad par 'dod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu thams cad rgyu las tha mi dad par 'dod pa'i phyir /
translated: because they maintain that no effect is different from its cause.

original: yongs su gyur pa'i phyogs de dag gis 'dod pa yin gyi 'bras bu'i phyogs ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yongs su gyur pa'i phyogs de dag gis 'dod pa yin gyi 'bras bu'i phyogs ni ma yin no //
translated: The position of transformation is maintained by those who maintain that the effect is not different from the cause.

original: yongs su gyur ba ni de nyid las ma nyams pa'i chos gzhan yongs su gtong ba dang gzhan skye ba yin no //
analyzed: yongs su gyur ba ni de nyid las ma nyams pa'i chos gzhan yongs su gtong ba dang gzhan skye ba yin no //
translated: Transformation is the relinquishing of one thing without the loss of its own nature and the arising of another thing in its place.

original: de la sgra'i yongs su gyur pa ni nam mkha'o //
analyzed: de la sgra'i yongs su gyur pa ni nam mkha'o //
translated: In this regard, space is the transformation of sound.

original: sgra dang rig pa yongs su gyur pa ni rlung ngo //
analyzed: sgra dang rig pa yongs su gyur pa ni rlung ngo //
translated: Wind is the transformation of sound and touch.

original: sgra dang reg pa dang gzugs yongs su gyur pa ni me'o //
analyzed: sgra dang reg pa dang gzugs yongs su gyur pa ni me'o //
translated: Fire is the transformation of sound, touch, and form.

original: sgra dang reg pa dang gzugs dang ro yongs su gyur pa ni chu'o //
analyzed: sgra dang reg pa dang gzugs dang ro yongs su gyur pa ni chu'o //
translated: Water is the transformation of sound, touch, form, and taste.

original: sgra dang reg pa dang ro dang / dri yongs su gyur pa ni sa yin te /
analyzed: sgra dang reg pa dang ro dang / dri yongs su gyur pa ni sa yin te /
translated: Earth is the transformation of sound, touch, taste, and form.

original: de ltar na bum pa la sogs pa dag ni du ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na bum pa la sogs pa dag ni du ma yin te /
translated: Thus, a pot, etc., is multiple.

original: de bzung na du ma bzung ba zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: de bzung na du ma bzung ba zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: If it is grasped, it is established that the multiple is grasped.

original: lan lhag pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lan lhag pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The response is the same as before.

original: de'i phyir cig car du ma bzung ba yang rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir cig car du ma bzung ba yang rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the simultaneous apprehension of many is not conceptual.

original: mngon sum rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid do zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: mngon sum rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid do zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: It is established that perception is non-conceptual.

original: gal te mngon sum rtog pa med pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum rtog pa med pa yin na /
translated: If perception is non-conceptual,

original: 'o na ci ltar chos dang chos can la sogs pa mngon sum gyis 'dzin /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar chos dang chos can la sogs pa mngon sum gyis 'dzin /
translated: how is it that perception apprehends a property-possessor, a property, etc.?

original: chos can mngon sum gyis ma bzung na yang rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos can mngon sum gyis ma bzung na yang rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If a property-possessor is not apprehended by perception, then inference would not occur.

original: chos can yang rjes su dpag pas 'dzin na ni de la yang chos can gzhan dgos pas thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos can yang rjes su dpag pas 'dzin na ni de la yang chos can gzhan dgos pas thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If a property-possessor is apprehended by inference, then since another property-possessor would be required for that, there would be an infinite regress.

original: chos can bzung na ni chos du ma dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid de 'dzin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos can bzung na ni chos du ma dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid de 'dzin pa'i phyir /
translated: If a property-possessor is apprehended, then since it is apprehended as having many properties,

original: ci ltar rnam par rtog pa med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar rnam par rtog pa med pa yin zhe na /
translated: how can it be non-conceptual?

original: 'di la smras pa /
analyzed: 'di la smras pa /
translated: To this we say:

original: chos can du ma'i ngo bo ni //
analyzed: chos can du ma'i ngo bo ni //
translated: The nature of a property-possessor

original: rnam kun dbang po las rtogs min //
analyzed: rnam kun dbang po las rtogs min //
translated: is not cognized by the senses in any way.

original: rang bzhin rig bya bstan min pa'i //
analyzed: rang bzhin rig bya bstan min pa'i //
translated: It is not taught to be an object of intrinsic awareness.

original: ngo bo dbang po'i spyod yul yin //
analyzed: ngo bo dbang po'i spyod yul yin //
translated: The nature of the object is the domain of the senses.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos du ma dang ldan pa'i chos can ni 'ga' yang dbang po'i shes pas 'dzin pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos du ma dang ldan pa'i chos can ni 'ga' yang dbang po'i shes pas 'dzin pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The subject, which is endowed with many qualities such as color, is not apprehended by the sense consciousness.

original: 'on kyang rang nyid kyis rig par bya ba'i rang bzhin dang byed pa pos yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang nyid kyis rig par bya ba'i rang bzhin dang byed pa pos yin no //
translated: However, it is known by the self-awareness, which is the agent.

original: rang bzhin de nyid ni dbang po'i yul yin no //üîΩ'di ltar / gzugs sogs phan tshun dben par ni //
analyzed: rang bzhin de nyid ni dbang po'i yul yin no // 'di ltar / gzugs sogs phan tshun dben par ni //
translated: And that nature is the domain of the senses.üîΩThus:üîΩThe eye, etc., do not apprehend color, etc.,

original: mig la sogs pa dag gis ni //üîΩ'dzin @276b 'gyur de dag gzhi gcig pa //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dag gis ni // 'dzin @276b 'gyur de dag gzhi gcig pa //
translated: as separate from each other,

original: nyid do rtog pa med phyir ro //
analyzed: nyid do rtog pa med phyir ro //
translated: because they are not conceptual.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos can ni //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos can ni //
translated: The subject, such as color,

original: dbang po'i shes pas dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pas dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: is not perceived by the sense consciousness.

original: phan tshun tha dad pa'i gzugs la sogs pa nyid du bzung ba las gzhan pa'i gzhi 'am de la brten pa ni 'dzin pa'i spyod yul du gyur pa med do zhes bya ba 'di ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: phan tshun tha dad pa'i gzugs la sogs pa nyid du bzung ba las gzhan pa'i gzhi 'am de la brten pa ni 'dzin pa'i spyod yul du gyur pa med do zhes bya ba 'di ni bshad zin to //
translated: It has been explained that apart from the apprehension of color, etc., as mutually distinct, there is no other basis or entity that is the domain of the apprehending consciousness.

original: gal te bdag gis mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid reg pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa rtogs pa las gzhi gcig pa nyid dam rtogs pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te bdag gis mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid reg pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa rtogs pa las gzhi gcig pa nyid dam rtogs pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you think that the very same thing that is seen is touched, etc., and that the single basis is cognized by different consciousnesses, that is not so.

original: ngo shes pa ni mngon sum ma yin no zhes bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo shes pa ni mngon sum ma yin no zhes bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has already been demonstrated that recognition is not direct perception.

original: gzugs dang reg pa'i shes pas sad par byas pa'i thog ma med pa'i bag chags las de lta bu'i shes pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang reg pa'i shes pas sad par byas pa'i thog ma med pa'i bag chags las de lta bu'i shes pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a consciousness like that arises from beginningless predispositions activated by the consciousnesses of form and touch.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / mig ni gzugs tsam nyid dang ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / mig ni gzugs tsam nyid dang ni //
translated: The eye is only for seeing form,

original: gzhan ni reg pa tsam nyid dag //
analyzed: gzhan ni reg pa tsam nyid dag //
translated: and the other is only for touching.

original: rig phyir rig pa 'jug pa nyid //
analyzed: rig phyir rig pa 'jug pa nyid //
translated: Because they are aware, consciousnesses engage them,

original: ces bya ba ni mthong ba yin //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni mthong ba yin //
translated: and that is seeing.

original: de dag phan tshun 'dus pa gzhan gyis ni dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag phan tshun 'dus pa gzhan gyis ni dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not perceived by another that is a combination of them.

original: reg pa nyid mthong ba yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: reg pa nyid mthong ba yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you think that touch is seeing, that is not so.

original: reg pa ni gzugs la 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: reg pa ni gzugs la 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because touch does not engage form.

original: gal te don gcig la 'jug par rtogs na de lta na ni gcig tu grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te don gcig la 'jug par rtogs na de lta na ni gcig tu grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you think that the object is the same, then it is established as one.

original: gal te mthong ba'i dkar po nyid reg pas dri ma can du byed pa dang / lag pas bzung bar dmigs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te mthong ba'i dkar po nyid reg pas dri ma can du byed pa dang / lag pas bzung bar dmigs pa ma yin nam /
translated: But is it not the case that the white color that is seen is soiled by contact and is perceived as held by the hand?

original: de ci ltar don gcig la 'jug pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ci ltar don gcig la 'jug pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How can it not be the same object?

original: 'di ni nam mkha'i go skabs su ka sha dbyangs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni nam mkha'i go skabs su ka sha dbyangs pa yin no //
translated: This is a case of the vowel a being placed in the space of the consonant k.

original: gang tshe dngos de reg pa dang // gang gi reg pa yul gyur pa //
analyzed: gang tshe dngos de reg pa dang // gang gi reg pa yul gyur pa //
translated: When the object is in contact, and the contact is the object,

original: de tshe des rtogs med ce na //
analyzed: de tshe des rtogs med ce na //
translated: then it is not cognized by that.

original: rjes su dpag pa sgrub byed min //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa sgrub byed min //
translated: Inference is not a means of valid cognition.

original: phan tshun 'dzin par byed pa'i mngon sum dag 'jug pa med na mngon sum gyi tha dad par yongs su bcad pas rjes su dpag pa stong phrag kyang nus pa'i lam du 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun 'dzin par byed pa'i mngon sum dag 'jug pa med na mngon sum gyi tha dad par yongs su bcad pas rjes su dpag pa stong phrag kyang nus pa'i lam du 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: When there is no engagement of the two direct perceptions that grasp each other, there is no engagement of the path of ability by thousands of inferences, due to the determination of the difference of direct perception.

original: 'on te de nyid la reg go zhes bya ba 'di ni yid kyi mngon sum yin no //
analyzed: 'on te de nyid la reg go zhes bya ba 'di ni yid kyi mngon sum yin no //
translated: But if you say that it is the same when it is touched, this is the direct perception of the mind.

original: dbang po las skyes pa nyid tshad ma yin pa'i phyir tshad ma 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po las skyes pa nyid tshad ma yin pa'i phyir tshad ma 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the valid cognition is engaged because of being produced from the sense faculty.üîΩ

original: dbang po las skyes pa yang don la mi 'khrul pa las tshad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dbang po las skyes pa yang don la mi 'khrul pa las tshad ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that the engagement of valid knowledge is due to being produced from a sense faculty, because that which is produced from a sense faculty is valid knowledge.üîΩIt is due to being nonerroneous with regard to an object that it is valid knowledge.

original: dbang po las skyes pa'i phyir ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po las skyes pa'i phyir ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not due to being produced from a sense faculty.

original: yid las skyes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yang srid pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: yid las skyes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yang srid pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: It is also possible to say that it is produced from the mental faculty.

original: de ni med de 'di ltar /üîΩgang nyid mthong zhes rtogs pa yi //
analyzed: de ni med de 'di ltar / gang nyid mthong zhes rtogs pa yi //
translated: That is not so, because it is like this:

original: rjes dpag med na tshu rol @277a * //
analyzed: rjes dpag med na tshu rol @277a * //
translated: Without inference, which is understood to be seeing itself,

original: ni ; / mthong ba 'ga' yang rtogs ma yin //
analyzed: ni ; / mthong ba 'ga' yang rtogs ma yin //
translated: there is no understanding of any seeing whatsoever of the other side.

original: de la 'ga' zhig sngar mthong ba nyid reg pa yin no zhes khyed kyis ci ltar rtogs zhes /
analyzed: de la 'ga' zhig sngar mthong ba nyid reg pa yin no zhes khyed kyis ci ltar rtogs zhes /
translated: In that regard, how do you understand that it is the very seeing that touches?

original: gal te brgal zhing brtag pa byed na de'i tshe ji skad bya /
analyzed: gal te brgal zhing brtag pa byed na de'i tshe ji skad bya /
translated: If you engage in debate, then what do you say?

original: de lta bu nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'am ci mthong ba gang yin pa ni reg pa'i dus na ma mthong na de ci ltar na de nyid la reg go zhes bya bar rtogs /
analyzed: de lta bu nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'am ci mthong ba gang yin pa ni reg pa'i dus na ma mthong na de ci ltar na de nyid la reg go zhes bya bar rtogs /
translated: If what is seen at the time of contact is not seen at the time of touch, how could it be realized that ‚Äúit is touched‚Äù?

original: gang gis de dri ma can du byas pa de'i phyir de yin par shes so zhes bya ba'i rnges su dpag pa bstan pa de nyid kyang 'dir lan ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis de dri ma can du byas pa de'i phyir de yin par shes so zhes bya ba'i rnges su dpag pa bstan pa de nyid kyang 'dir lan ma yin no //
translated: The inference that you have presented, ‚ÄúIt is known to be that because it is defiled by that,‚Äù is also not a response here.

original: 'o na ci ltar ma reg par nyams par byed ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar ma reg par nyams par byed ce na /
translated: If that is so, then how is it defiled without contact?

original: reg pa nyid na 'o na 'di dkar po'i zhes ci'i phyir mi rtogs /
analyzed: reg pa nyid na 'o na 'di dkar po'i zhes ci'i phyir mi rtogs /
translated: If it is defiled by contact, then why is it not realized that ‚Äúit is white‚Äù?

original: reg pa la dkar po dang cig shos dag mtshungs pa dang mi mtshungs pa'i rang bzhin rang yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: reg pa la dkar po dang cig shos dag mtshungs pa dang mi mtshungs pa'i rang bzhin rang yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the nature of white and the other is the same in contact and not the same in noncontact.

original: lan ni 'di ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: lan ni 'di ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: This response is not good.

original: mtshungs pa dang mi mtshungs pa'i dngos po gcig ces bya ba ni bab chol yin no //
analyzed: mtshungs pa dang mi mtshungs pa'i dngos po gcig ces bya ba ni bab chol yin no //
translated: It is nonsense to say that one thing is the same and not the same.

original: gang gi phyir len pa mtshungs pa dang / gzugs mtshungs pa ma yin pa des na de dag gcig pa nyid du mi rigs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir len pa mtshungs pa dang / gzugs mtshungs pa ma yin pa des na de dag gcig pa nyid du mi rigs te /
translated: Since the appropriator is similar and the form is not similar, it is not reasonable that they are the same.

original: 'gal ba'i chos gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i chos gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are contradictory phenomena.

original: ci ste rtogs so zhe na de la rnam par dpyad par bya ste /üîΩci rnam pa gcig tu rtogs sam /
analyzed: ci ste rtogs so zhe na de la rnam par dpyad par bya ste / ci rnam pa gcig tu rtogs sam /
translated: If you say that they are cognized, then we will analyze this.

original: 'on te rnam pa du mar rtogs /
analyzed: 'on te rnam pa du mar rtogs /
translated: Are they cognized as one or are they cognized as many?

original: rnam pa du mar rtogs na ci ltar gcig yin /
analyzed: rnam pa du mar rtogs na ci ltar gcig yin /
translated: If they are cognized as many, how can they be one?

original: 'on te rnam pa gcig tu'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rnam pa gcig tu'o zhe na /
translated: But if they are cognized as one,

original: de ni mi bden te reg pa rtogs pa na ma rtogs pa'i gzugs rnam pa gcig go zhes ci ltar 'dzin /
analyzed: de ni mi bden te reg pa rtogs pa na ma rtogs pa'i gzugs rnam pa gcig go zhes ci ltar 'dzin /
translated: that is not tenable, because when contact is cognized, how can one apprehend form that is not cognized?

original: rtogs pa dang ma rtogs pa ni bzung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rtogs pa dang ma rtogs pa ni bzung ba ma yin te /
translated: That which is cognized and that which is not cognized are not apprehended,

original: ma rtogs pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that they are not cognized.

original: de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa tha dad pa na yan lag can zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa tha dad pa na yan lag can zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since form and so on are different, there is no such thing as an owner of the parts.

original: de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa ni rang gi ngo bos rig par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa ni rang gi ngo bos rig par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: Therefore form and so on are cognized by their own nature.

original: phan tshun gyi ngo bos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun gyi ngo bos ni ma yin no //
translated: But not by the nature of the other.

original: de bzhin du gzugs ni rang gis rig par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs ni rang gis rig par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: In the same way, form is to be known by itself,

original: gzhan gyis rig par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis rig par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: but not by the other.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan la sgras bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir dbang po'i shes pa'i spyod yul ni brjod du med pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gzhan la sgras bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir dbang po'i shes pa'i spyod yul ni brjod du med pa yin no //
translated: For this very reason, the object of the sense consciousnesses is inexpressible, because it cannot be indicated by words to another.

original: gal te dbang po'i spyod yul sgras bstan par mi nus na /
analyzed: gal te dbang po'i spyod yul sgras bstan par mi nus na /
translated: If the object of the sense consciousnesses cannot be indicated by words,

original: 'on ji ltar bdag gis gang thos pa de nyid mthong ngo zhes rtogs /
analyzed: 'on ji ltar bdag gis gang thos pa de nyid mthong ngo zhes rtogs /
translated: then how can one understand that ‚ÄúI see what I have heard‚Äù?

original: bstan par bya ba ma yin pa ni de ltar rtogs par ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bstan par bya ba ma yin pa ni de ltar rtogs par ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: How can one understand that which cannot be indicated?

original: de'i phyir na bstan par bya ba yin no zhes rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir na bstan par bya ba yin no zhes rtogs so zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it must be indicated.

original: @277b de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: @277b de ni ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.

original: ngo shes pa ni chad ma nyid //
analyzed: ngo shes pa ni chad ma nyid //
translated: Recognition is not the same.

original: ma yin zhes ni bsgrubs zin to //üîΩdes na shes pa de yis ni //
analyzed: ma yin zhes ni bsgrubs zin to // des na shes pa de yis ni //
translated: It has already been established that it is not.üîΩTherefore, how can you claim

original: don 'di rtogs par ci ltar 'dod //
analyzed: don 'di rtogs par ci ltar 'dod //
translated: that this consciousness understands its object?

original: re zhig sgra las rtogs pa'i dus su ni don de snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig sgra las rtogs pa'i dus su ni don de snang ba ma yin te /
translated: At the time of understanding from the word, the meaning does not appear.

original: sgra las na don la the tshom za ba nyid do //
analyzed: sgra las na don la the tshom za ba nyid do //
translated: From the word, there is doubt about the meaning.

original: de lta ma yin na ni mngon sum gyis rtogs pa bzhin du the tshom dang 'brel par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni mngon sum gyis rtogs pa bzhin du the tshom dang 'brel par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then, like understanding by direct perception, there would be no connection with doubt.

original: ci ste sgra las don gyi dngos po dang dngos po med pa thun mong du snang ba yin te /
analyzed: ci ste sgra las don gyi dngos po dang dngos po med pa thun mong du snang ba yin te /
translated: But if it is the case that from the word there is a common appearance of the existence and non-existence of the meaning,

original: des na the tshom za ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na the tshom za ba yin no zhe na /
translated: then there is doubt.

original: mngon sum la yang ci'i phyir de ltar mi 'gyur //üîΩde la rnam pa'i khyad par nye bar mtshon pa nyid kyis mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum la yang ci'i phyir de ltar mi 'gyur // de la rnam pa'i khyad par nye bar mtshon pa nyid kyis mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Why is it not so in the case of direct perception?üîΩIn the case of direct perception, it is not so, because the special aspect is indicated.

original: 'dir yang snang ba'i khyad par 'dzin pa gang gis bzlog ste khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang snang ba'i khyad par 'dzin pa gang gis bzlog ste khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But in this case, what prevents the apprehension of the special appearance? There is no difference.

original: de lta na ni sgra'i shes pa dngos po'i rang bzhin 'dzin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni sgra'i shes pa dngos po'i rang bzhin 'dzin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, the cognition from the word does not apprehend the nature of the thing,

original: mngon sum dang mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum dang mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not in accord with direct perception.

original: gal te rang gi ngo bor rtogs pa yin na ni de mthong ba tshad ma nyid ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rang gi ngo bor rtogs pa yin na ni de mthong ba tshad ma nyid ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: If it is the apprehension of its own nature, then that seeing is not a valid cognition,

original: bzung zin pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzung zin pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it apprehends what has already been apprehended.

original: long ba med bar yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: long ba med bar yang 'gyur te /
translated: And it would be without an object,

original: gzugs kyi rang bzhin ni sgra nyid las rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rang bzhin ni sgra nyid las rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of form is understood from sound alone.

original: ci ste spyi'i rnam par rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste spyi'i rnam par rtogs so zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the apprehension of a universal,

original: de lta na ni /
analyzed: de lta na ni /
translated: then in that case,

original: mig ser gyis nyams pa'i mig gis kyang /
analyzed: mig ser gyis nyams pa'i mig gis kyang /
translated: even the eye consciousness impaired by jaundice

original: dkar po ser po'i rnam par rtogs pa de yang thob par byed pa yin pa'i phyir tshad mar thal lo //
analyzed: dkar po ser po'i rnam par rtogs pa de yang thob par byed pa yin pa'i phyir tshad mar thal lo //
translated: would be a valid cognition, because it is a means of obtaining the apprehension of white as yellow.

original: de yang tshad mar 'gyur la rag go zhe na ma yin te gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang tshad mar 'gyur la rag go zhe na ma yin te gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you say that it is a valid cognition, no, it is not, because it is impaired.

original: ba lang khyer la shog ces bya ba'i shes pa ni gnod pa med pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid do zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: ba lang khyer la shog ces bya ba'i shes pa ni gnod pa med pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid do zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that the cognition ‚ÄúBring the cow‚Äù is a valid cognition because it is not impaired, no, it is not,

original: de la yang gnod pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang gnod pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is impairment in that as well.

original: ba lang khyer la shog ces bya ba gal te yod pa nyid 'phen pa yin na ni res 'ga' med par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba lang khyer la shog ces bya ba gal te yod pa nyid 'phen pa yin na ni res 'ga' med par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If the statement ‚ÄúBring the cow‚Äù implies that the cow exists, then it would sometimes be nonexistent.

original: 'on te mi 'phen na ni /
analyzed: 'on te mi 'phen na ni /
translated: But if it does not imply that,

original: des na khyer te 'ong ba mi srid pa'i phyir na tshad ma ma yin par shin tu gsal lo //
analyzed: des na khyer te 'ong ba mi srid pa'i phyir na tshad ma ma yin par shin tu gsal lo //
translated: then it is quite clear that it is not a valid cognition, because it is impossible to bring it.

original: 'on te gal te yod na khyer la shog cig ces bya ba smra ba po'i bsam pa yin na de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te gal te yod na khyer la shog cig ces bya ba smra ba po'i bsam pa yin na de'i phyir /
translated: But if the speaker‚Äôs intention is ‚ÄúIf it exists, bring it,‚Äù

original: the tshom du khyer te 'ong bar brjod pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: the tshom du khyer te 'ong bar brjod pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: then because it is said that one should bring it with doubt, it is not a valid cognition.

original: the tshom nyid du bskul pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: the tshom nyid du bskul pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is a request to bring it with doubt,

original: the tshom nyid du bzung ba'i phyir the tshom gyi shes pa thams cad tshad mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: the tshom nyid du bzung ba'i phyir the tshom gyi shes pa thams cad tshad mar 'gyur ro //
translated: then because it is said that one should bring it with doubt, all doubting cognitions would be valid cognitions.

original: tshad ma ma yin pas ni dngos po 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pas ni dngos po 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: But a nonvalid cognition does not apprehend an object.

original: 'o na ji ltar khyer nas 'ongs pa la sogs pa la mi 'khrul pa yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar khyer nas 'ongs pa la sogs pa la mi 'khrul pa yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But if it is not a valid cognition, how is it that there is no error in bringing it and so on?

original: 'ga' yang ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ga' yang ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because nothing is done.

original: bskul @278a * //
analyzed: bskul @278a * //
translated: If you say that it is a request to bring it with doubt,üîΩthen because it is said that one should bring it with doubt, all doubting cognitions would be valid cognitions.

original: bas ni gdon mi za bar byed pa ma yin no //üîΩgzhan yang bya ba la sgra ni byed pa po'am /
analyzed: bas ni gdon mi za bar byed pa ma yin no // gzhan yang bya ba la sgra ni byed pa po'am /
translated: but it is not necessarily the case that it is the agent.üîΩMoreover, with regard to the action, is sound the instrument or the cause?

original: 'on te shes byed yin par 'dod //
analyzed: 'on te shes byed yin par 'dod //
translated: Or is it the intimation?

original: byed po yin na mi slu ba //
analyzed: byed po yin na mi slu ba //
translated: If it is the instrument, it is not deceptive,

original: med phyir tshad ma nyid ma yin //
analyzed: med phyir tshad ma nyid ma yin //
translated: but because it does not exist, it is not a valid cognition.

original: byed pa po mi slu ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha snyad ni med do //üîΩthob pa ni byas pa na tshad ma gzhan gyis yin no //
analyzed: byed pa po mi slu ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha snyad ni med do // thob pa ni byas pa na tshad ma gzhan gyis yin no //
translated: There is no convention that the instrument is nondeceptive.üîΩIf it is the cause, it is not a valid cognition because it is not a valid cognition in regard to the object that is to be obtained.

original: shes par byed pa nyid ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo yod pa ma yin pas ni mi srid do //
analyzed: shes par byed pa nyid ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo yod pa ma yin pas ni mi srid do //
translated: As for being the intimation, the action that will occur does not exist inherently, and so it is impossible.

original: med pa'i bya ba ni rang gi ngo bos 'dzin pa ma yin la /
analyzed: med pa'i bya ba ni rang gi ngo bos 'dzin pa ma yin la /
translated: An action that does not exist is not apprehended by virtue of its own nature.

original: rang gi ngo bor yod na ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor yod na ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: If it existed by virtue of its own nature, it would not be something that will occur.

original: spyi'i 'dzin pa'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: spyi'i 'dzin pa'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is apprehended in a general way,

original: de lta na ni spyi de bya ba med kyang yod pa'i phyir ni spyi rtogs pa na bya ba la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni spyi de bya ba med kyang yod pa'i phyir ni spyi rtogs pa na bya ba la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then, since that generality would exist even if the action did not exist, when the generality is apprehended, one would not engage in the action.

original: de'i phyir sgra ni dbang po'i don gyi shes par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra ni dbang po'i don gyi shes par byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, sound is the revealer of the object of the sense faculty.

original: des na dbang po'i spyod yul ni bstan du med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na dbang po'i spyod yul ni bstan du med pa kho na'o //
translated: Thus, the domain of the sense faculty is only imperceptible.

original: 'o na chos can gyi chos du ma nyid du rtogs she na /
analyzed: 'o na chos can gyi chos du ma nyid du rtogs she na /
translated: But how is the multiplicity of the properties of the subject understood?

original: chos can thams cad las ldog ba //
analyzed: chos can thams cad las ldog ba //
translated: The subject is distinguished from all other things.

original: gang dang gang las log de las //
analyzed: gang dang gang las log de las //
translated: That from which it is distinguished is the other.

original: tha dad btags pa'i tha dad can //
analyzed: tha dad btags pa'i tha dad can //
translated: The subject is the possessor of the distinction of the other.

original: de ni du ma'i ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: de ni du ma'i ngo bo nyid //
translated: It is the nature of multiplicity.

original: chos la sogs pa'i tha snyad ni ldog pa'i khyad par btags pa yin no //
analyzed: chos la sogs pa'i tha snyad ni ldog pa'i khyad par btags pa yin no //
translated: The convention of the subject, etc., is the distinction of the exclusion.

original: 'di ltar dang po nyid du gser gyi bum pa snang ba na kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa las tha dad par snang ba'am de dag las tha dad par snang ngam gcig /'on kyang kha dog la sogs pa'i bdag nyid gcig nyid dngos su snang ba'i spyod
analyzed: 'di ltar dang po nyid du gser gyi bum pa snang ba na kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa las tha dad par snang ba'am de dag las tha dad par snang ngam gcig /'on kyang kha dog la sogs pa'i bdag nyid gcig nyid dngos su snang ba'i spyod
translated: Thus, when a golden vase is first seen, it is seen as distinct from color, shape, etc., or as not distinct from them, or as the identity of color, etc., itself.

original: yul yin no //
analyzed: yul yin no //
translated: But it is not the domain of direct perception.

original: de la da ltar ni rnam pa du ma can gyi don tha dad pa gzhan dang / gzhan las log pa ma brten nas /
analyzed: de la da ltar ni rnam pa du ma can gyi don tha dad pa gzhan dang / gzhan las log pa ma brten nas /
translated: Now, without depending on the exclusion of other different things that have many aspects,

original: tha snyad kyi lam la gnas pa 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor lhung ba dag dmigs kyis bsal te /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi lam la gnas pa 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor lhung ba dag dmigs kyis bsal te /
translated: those who abide on the path of convention, who have fallen into the ocean of sa·πÉsƒÅra, are excluded.

original: brtags pas tha dad bar 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: brtags pas tha dad bar 'jog par byed do //
translated: By examination, they are posited as different.

original: gal te kha dog dang dbyibs kyi khyad par dag tha mi dad pa yin na bum pa sngon po ma yin pa las bum pa sngon po tha dad pa nyid du ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te kha dog dang dbyibs kyi khyad par dag tha mi dad pa yin na bum pa sngon po ma yin pa las bum pa sngon po tha dad pa nyid du ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: If the differences of color and shape are not different, how could a blue pot be different from a non-blue pot?

original: gal te kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa tha mi dad pa nyid yin na de'i tshe bum pa sngon po ma yin pa las sngon po ldog par mi 'gyur te ;
analyzed: gal te kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa tha mi dad pa nyid yin na de'i tshe bum pa sngon po ma yin pa las sngon po ldog par mi 'gyur te ;
translated: If color, shape, and so on are not different, then at that time blue would not be excluded from a non-blue pot,

original: de'i dbyibs kyi bdag nyid can sngon po ma yin pa la sngon por 'gyur dgos te /
analyzed: de'i dbyibs kyi bdag nyid can sngon po ma yin pa la sngon por 'gyur dgos te /
translated: because a non-blue that has the nature of its shape would have to be blue.

original: dbyibs ni kha dog sngon po las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbyibs ni kha dog sngon po las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because shape is not different from blue color.

original: dbyibs la sogs pa sngon po ma yin pa yang yod pa yin te /
analyzed: dbyibs la sogs pa sngon po ma yin pa yang yod pa yin te /
translated: But shape and so on are not blue,üîΩtherefore they are different.

original: de'i phyir de dag tha dad do zhes 'jig rten na rtog pa tha dad par snang ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag tha dad do zhes 'jig rten na rtog pa tha dad par snang ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the difference in the way they are conceived in the world is evident.

original: de ltar ni @278b ni tha dad pa don dam par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar ni @278b ni tha dad pa don dam par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that they are ultimately different,

original: rtog pa tsam gyis nye bar bkod pa ni don dam par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa tsam gyis nye bar bkod pa ni don dam par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not reasonable to posit them as ultimately different merely on the basis of their being conceived as different.

original: gal te dkar po nyid la sogs pa de nyid dbyibs kyi bdag nyid ma yin par snang ba yin na ni don dam par tha dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dkar po nyid la sogs pa de nyid dbyibs kyi bdag nyid ma yin par snang ba yin na ni don dam par tha dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If whiteness and so on are not seen as the nature of shape, they would be ultimately different.

original: don gcig la 'du ba ni tha dad pa ma yin par snang ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don gcig la 'du ba ni tha dad pa ma yin par snang ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The reason they are not seen as different is that they are seen to be included in the same object.

original: tha dad kyang tha mi dad par snang ngo zhe na /
analyzed: tha dad kyang tha mi dad par snang ngo zhe na /
translated: Even if they are different, they are seen as the same.

original: gzugs dang ro dag don gcig la 'du ba yin par yang tha dad par snang ba yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gzugs dang ro dag don gcig la 'du ba yin par yang tha dad par snang ba yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But is it not the case that form and taste are seen as different even though they are included in the same object?

original: de la ni dbang po tha dad par gzung bar bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de la ni dbang po tha dad par gzung bar bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: They are apprehended by different sense faculties.

original: gal te 'du bas tha dad pa med par snang bar byed nus pa yin na dbang po tha dad pas gzung ba nyid 'thad par dka'o //
analyzed: gal te 'du bas tha dad pa med par snang bar byed nus pa yin na dbang po tha dad pas gzung ba nyid 'thad par dka'o //
translated: If it is claimed that the difference is not perceived because of the combination, then it is difficult to maintain that the sense faculties are apprehended as different.

original: yul gcig pa'i phyir tha dad pa med par snang ngo zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang ro la sogs pas ma nges so //
analyzed: yul gcig pa'i phyir tha dad pa med par snang ngo zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang ro la sogs pas ma nges so //
translated: The claim that the difference is not perceived because of the single object is not established by form, taste, etc.

original: de bzhin du ba lang nyid la sogs pa las khra bo la sogs pa dang / khra bo nyid la sogs pa las ser skya dang / khu yul sogs pa tha dad pa ni rtogs pas tha dad par rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du ba lang nyid la sogs pa las khra bo la sogs pa dang / khra bo nyid la sogs pa las ser skya dang / khu yul sogs pa tha dad pa ni rtogs pas tha dad par rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Similarly, the difference of the variegated, etc. from cowness, etc. and the difference of the tawny, etc. from variegatedness, etc. is established by the understanding as difference.

original: de la kha cig tu ni chos can gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad par rtog ste /
analyzed: de la kha cig tu ni chos can gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad par rtog ste /
translated: In some cases, the difference is imagined from the substratum, form, etc.

original: dper na bum ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, like a pot.

original: gal te bum pa yan lag can gcig med na ni rim gyis gzugs dang / ro gzung ba na bum par rtogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: gal te bum pa yan lag can gcig med na ni rim gyis gzugs dang / ro gzung ba na bum par rtogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: If the unitary whole, the pot, does not exist, then when form and taste are apprehended successively, the pot is not cognized.

original: kha cig tu ni chos tha dad par rtogs te /
analyzed: kha cig tu ni chos tha dad par rtogs te /
translated: In some cases, the difference is imagined from the property.

original: gal te tha mi dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i ba lang nyid med na ni /
analyzed: gal te tha mi dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i ba lang nyid med na ni /
translated: If there were no difference and no non-difference of the universal cow,

original: khra bo la sogs pa de dang tha mi dad pa rnams la tha dad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khra bo la sogs pa de dang tha mi dad pa rnams la tha dad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then the variegated cow, etc., which are not different from it, would not be different.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang sbyar ro //
translated: The same argument applies to the other cases.

original: de'i phyir ldog pa'i khyad par la brten nas tha dad par btags pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ldog pa'i khyad par la brten nas tha dad par btags pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, difference is imputed on the basis of the difference of the negatee.

original: rjes su dpag pa dang ldan pa'i tha dad pa yang tha dad pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dang ldan pa'i tha dad pa yang tha dad pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But is not difference by way of inference also difference?

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa de mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can yin na ni bden te /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa de mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can yin na ni bden te /
translated: If that inference is preceded by perception, then it is true.

original: dper na mngon sum la snang ba'i me rjes su dpag par rtogs pa ni de lta bu nyid du 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mngon sum la snang ba'i me rjes su dpag par rtogs pa ni de lta bu nyid du 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, the inference of fire, which is perceived, is just like that.

original: chos dang chos can tha dad pa ni nam yang de ltar ma yin no //
analyzed: chos dang chos can tha dad pa ni nam yang de ltar ma yin no //
translated: But the difference of the property and the subject is never like that.

original: gal ta snang na rjes su dpag pas ci bya zhe na /
analyzed: gal ta snang na rjes su dpag pas ci bya zhe na /
translated: If it is perceived, what is the use of inference?

original: 'di ni me la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni me la yang mtshungs so //
translated: The same argument applies to fire.

original: dus gzhan la sogs par rjes su dpog go zhe na /
analyzed: dus gzhan la sogs par rjes su dpog go zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is inferred at other times,

original: 'dir yang de ltar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang de ltar 'gyur ro //
translated: then the same is true here.

original: 'on te 'dir rtag tu rjes su dpog par bya ba nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'dir rtag tu rjes su dpog par bya ba nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is always to be inferred,

original: de yang ma yin te /üîΩrtag tu @279a * //
analyzed: de yang ma yin te / rtag tu @279a * //
translated: then that is not so.

original: rjes su dpag bya la //
analyzed: rjes su dpag bya la //
translated: If it is always to be inferred,

original: dpe de nyid du gang gis grub //
analyzed: dpe de nyid du gang gis grub //
translated: how can it be established by that example?

original: rjes dpag gzhan gyis grub na ni //
analyzed: rjes dpag gzhan gyis grub na ni //
translated: If it is established by another inference,

original: de ni long ba brgyud pa yin //
analyzed: de ni long ba brgyud pa yin //
translated: that is a blind man‚Äôs quest.

original: 'on te bum pa la sogs pa snam bu la sogs pa las tha dad pa ni dpe yin no //
analyzed: 'on te bum pa la sogs pa snam bu la sogs pa las tha dad pa ni dpe yin no //
translated: If you say that a pot, etc. is different from a cloth, etc. and that is the example,

original: 'di ltar gang dang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa de dag ni tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang dang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa de dag ni tha dad pa yin te /
translated: then whatever is concomitant and nonconcomitant with that is different,

original: dper na / snam bu dang shing rta bzhin no //üîΩkha dog dang dbyibs dag kyang de bzhin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na / snam bu dang shing rta bzhin no // kha dog dang dbyibs dag kyang de bzhin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: like a cloth and a chariot.üîΩColor and shape are also like that.

original: rjes su 'gro ba ni der yang mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba ni der yang mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because their concomitance is apprehended by direct perception.

original: der ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las tha dad pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: der ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las tha dad pa yang ma yin no //
translated: In that case, it is not different from concomitance and nonconcomitance.

original: 'o na ji ltar zhe na cig car tha dad par snang ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar zhe na cig car tha dad par snang ba nyid kyis so //
translated: Well then, how? By the simultaneous appearance of difference.

original: 'on te rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med par ni sna tshogs snang ba nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'on te rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med par ni sna tshogs snang ba nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: But if there is no concomitance and no non-concomitance, there is the appearance of variety, but

original: tha dad par ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: tha dad par ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: not difference.

original: de lta na ni 'o na gang las kyang tha dad par snang ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na gang las kyang tha dad par snang ba nyid kyis so //
translated: If that is so, then by the appearance of difference from anything at all.

original: 'on te rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med pa'i phyir gnyis med par thal bas tha dad pa'i grub par byed pa mi 'thad pa shin tu gsal lo //
analyzed: 'on te rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med pa'i phyir gnyis med par thal bas tha dad pa'i grub par byed pa mi 'thad pa shin tu gsal lo //
translated: But if there is no concomitance and no non-concomitance, then the consequence is non-difference. Therefore, the establishment of difference is not tenable.üîΩOr,

original: yang na / ma 'dres par ni snang bas na //
analyzed: yang na / ma 'dres par ni snang bas na //
translated: because of the appearance of the unmixed,

original: bum sogs tha dad gnas pa yin //
analyzed: bum sogs tha dad gnas pa yin //
translated: the pot, etc. exist as different.

original: dbyibs sogs la ni de med nyid //
analyzed: dbyibs sogs la ni de med nyid //
translated: But that does not exist in shape, etc.

original: snam bu sogs dang mtshungs ma yin //üîΩba lang nyid la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba ni mngon sum gyis rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir de tha dad pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: snam bu sogs dang mtshungs ma yin // ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba ni mngon sum gyis rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir de tha dad pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the same as cloth, etc.

original: rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The concomitance of cowness, etc. is not understood by direct perception, therefore it is not different, because there is no concomitance.

original: gcig tu rtogs pa dang ldan pas ni de dag nyid rjes su 'gro bar tha snyad byas pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig tu rtogs pa dang ldan pas ni de dag nyid rjes su 'gro bar tha snyad byas pa yin no //
translated: But when there is the cognition of oneness, then they are called universals.

original: de lta na ni 'o na gcig tu rtogs pa'i yul tha dad pa dag las gzhan pa'i spyi yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na gcig tu rtogs pa'i yul tha dad pa dag las gzhan pa'i spyi yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If that is so, then the object of the cognition of oneness is a universal that is different from the different things.

original: gcig tu rtogs pa'i yul tha dad par snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig tu rtogs pa'i yul tha dad par snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because the different things do not appear as different to the cognition of oneness.

original: tha dad pa dag la gcig tu rtogs pa nyid du ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: tha dad pa dag la gcig tu rtogs pa nyid du ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can there be the cognition of oneness in regard to different things?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, the opponent says:

original: mthong ba mi 'thad pa nyid min //
analyzed: mthong ba mi 'thad pa nyid min //
translated: It is not that seeing is not tenable.

original: ma mthong ba ni 'thad pa min //
analyzed: ma mthong ba ni 'thad pa min //
translated: It is not that not seeing is tenable.

original: mthong dang ma mthong ba dag gis //
analyzed: mthong dang ma mthong ba dag gis //
translated: Through seeing and not seeing,

original: yod dang med par rnam par gnas //
analyzed: yod dang med par rnam par gnas //
translated: one abides in existence and nonexistence.

original: gcig tu 'dzin pa ni mthong ba'i phyir na 'thad pa nyid do ;
analyzed: gcig tu 'dzin pa ni mthong ba'i phyir na 'thad pa nyid do ;
translated: Since the apprehension of oneness is seeing, it is tenable.

original: / de bzhin du ma mthong ba tha dad pa med pa yang 'thad par 'gyur dgos so zhes bya ba 'di ni gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: / de bzhin du ma mthong ba tha dad pa med pa yang 'thad par 'gyur dgos so zhes bya ba 'di ni gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: And likewise, it is not tenable that the nonseeing of difference does not exist.

original: de ni tha dad pa dag la gcig tu 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni tha dad pa dag la gcig tu 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not the case, because the apprehension of oneness is not in regard to different things.

original: rang gi ngo bo tsam du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo tsam du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it exists as just its own nature.

original: gcig tu 'dzin pa'i 'di ni gang du yang gcig la mthong ba med do //
analyzed: gcig tu 'dzin pa'i 'di ni gang du yang gcig la mthong ba med do //
translated: This grasping at unity is not seen anywhere in a unity.

original: dmigs @279b pa la 'gyur ba yin na de yang rim pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: dmigs @279b pa la 'gyur ba yin na de yang rim pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: If it were a transformation of the object, that would also be in a sequence.

original: skad cig re re ni 'dzin par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skad cig re re ni 'dzin par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not able to grasp each moment,

original: so so so sor rig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so so so sor rig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not aware of each individual moment.

original: de'i phyir thams cad gcig tu 'dzin pa ni dngos po du ma nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad gcig tu 'dzin pa ni dngos po du ma nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the grasping at everything as one is not a multiplicity of things.

original: des na chos dang chos can mtha' dag ni rtogs pas byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na chos dang chos can mtha' dag ni rtogs pas byas pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, all phenomena and their properties are created by understanding.

original: de nyid mngon sum gyis gzung ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid mngon sum gyis gzung ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that is grasped by perception,

original: de ni med de /
analyzed: de ni med de /
translated: that is not so.

original: gang gi phyir /üîΩbrtags pa'i rang bzhin tha dad pa //
analyzed: gang gi phyir / brtags pa'i rang bzhin tha dad pa //
translated: Because

original: sna tshogs snang ba de dag ni //üîΩrtog pa med sems sna tshogs min //
analyzed: sna tshogs snang ba de dag ni // rtog pa med sems sna tshogs min //
translated: The various appearances of the imagined natureüîΩAre not the various aspects of the nonconceptual mind.

original: res 'ga' ba yi spyod yul min //
analyzed: res 'ga' ba yi spyod yul min //
translated: They are not the domain of the occasional mind.

original: mngon sum ni mngon du byed pa'i rnam pas 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum ni mngon du byed pa'i rnam pas 'jug pa yin te /
translated: Perception engages through the aspect of making something manifest.

original: btags pa'i yul gyi rnam pa ni de'i yin par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: btags pa'i yul gyi rnam pa ni de'i yin par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not reasonable that the aspect of the object designated be that of the cognition.

original: mngon sum gyi snang ba nyid ni don gyi dngos po la ltos pas res 'ga' ba yin la /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi snang ba nyid ni don gyi dngos po la ltos pas res 'ga' ba yin la /
translated: The appearance of direct perception itself is occasional, since it depends on the thing that is the object.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin gyis snang ba ni res 'ga' ba ma yin pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin gyis snang ba ni res 'ga' ba ma yin pa yin no //
translated: But the appearance that is the nature of conceptual cognition is not occasional.

original: mngon sum gyi rnam pa ni gcig yin la rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa ni du ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi rnam pa ni gcig yin la rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa ni du ma yin no //
translated: The aspect of direct perception is one; the aspect of conceptual cognition is many.

original: des na rnam par rtog pa dang mngon sum dag ni rnam pa tha dad pa dang rgyu tha dad pas kyang tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'o //
analyzed: des na rnam par rtog pa dang mngon sum dag ni rnam pa tha dad pa dang rgyu tha dad pas kyang tha dad pa yin no zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'o //
translated: Therefore, conceptual cognition and direct perception are different in terms of their aspects and their causes. This is the ultimate difference between them.

original: dkar po la sogs pa'i chos kyi khyad par dag rnam par mi rtog pa nyid na yang yod pa ma yin nam de dag ni dbang po'i spyod yul du 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dkar po la sogs pa'i chos kyi khyad par dag rnam par mi rtog pa nyid na yang yod pa ma yin nam de dag ni dbang po'i spyod yul du 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: But aren‚Äôt the specific qualities of phenomena such as white and so on present even in nonconceptual cognition? They are the objects of the senses.

original: 'di yang rtsod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang rtsod pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not a dispute.üîΩFor,

original: 'di ltar / gal te dkar sogs yod gyur kyang //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gal te dkar sogs yod gyur kyang //
translated: Even if white and so on exist,

original: dbang po'i spyod yul ci 'dra ba //
analyzed: dbang po'i spyod yul ci 'dra ba //
translated: And the objects of the senses are like a dream.üîΩ

original: de ni sgra yis spyod min te //
analyzed: de ni sgra yis spyod min te //
translated: The object of the sense faculty is not the object of the word.

original: shes pa'i rang bzhin tha dad phyir //
analyzed: shes pa'i rang bzhin tha dad phyir //
translated: Because the nature of the cognition is different.

original: dkar po ni dbang po las chos sam chos can nyid du 'ga' yang 'dzin pa med la /
analyzed: dkar po ni dbang po las chos sam chos can nyid du 'ga' yang 'dzin pa med la /
translated: There is no one who apprehends the white as a property or as a subject,

original: dbyibs la tha dad par yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dbyibs la tha dad par yang ma yin no //
translated: nor is it different in shape.

original: sgras ni chos can la sogs pa dang / mi gsal ba la sogs pa tha dad du 'dzin pa'i phyir dbang po'i blos ni bstan du med pa'i rang bzhin nyid rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: sgras ni chos can la sogs pa dang / mi gsal ba la sogs pa tha dad du 'dzin pa'i phyir dbang po'i blos ni bstan du med pa'i rang bzhin nyid rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Because the word apprehends the subject, etc., and the indistinct, etc., the sense cognition realizes the nature that is not indicated.

original: des na shes pa'i rnam pa tha dad pa'i phyir sgra'i blo ni dbang po'i gzung ba la 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na shes pa'i rnam pa tha dad pa'i phyir sgra'i blo ni dbang po'i gzung ba la 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because the aspect of cognition is different, the cognition of the word does not engage the sense object.

original: de'i phyir don gcig nyid yin na rang bzhin tha dad par 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir don gcig nyid yin na rang bzhin tha dad par 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, if they are the same object, it is not tenable that they have different natures.

original: 'on te rten tha dad pas rnam pa tha dad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te rten tha dad pas rnam pa tha dad par 'gyur te /
translated: But if they are different because their supports are different,üîΩthen the cognition of the word would not be a cognition of the object.

original: 'di ltar mig ser gyi stobs kyis mig gi nus pa dang bral ba dag rten gyi bye brag gis dkar po la yang ser por mthong la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mig ser gyi stobs kyis mig gi nus pa dang bral ba dag rten gyi bye brag gis dkar po la yang ser por mthong la /
translated: In the same way, those whose eye-faculty is impaired by the force of jaundice see white as yellow because of the particular nature of the support.

original: rab rib can dag gsal ba las gzhan du mthong ba @280a * //
analyzed: rab rib can dag gsal ba las gzhan du mthong ba @280a * //
translated: Those who have cataracts see something other than what is clear.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the same here.üîΩEven if the object is the same, there is no fault in accepting different aspects.

original: don gcig yin yang rnam pa tha dad pas khas len pa la nyes pa med do zhe na de ni med de /üîΩblo rnams don gcig nyid yin yang //
analyzed: don gcig yin yang rnam pa tha dad pas khas len pa la nyes pa med do zhe na de ni med de / blo rnams don gcig nyid yin yang //
translated: But that is not so.üîΩEven if the object is the same,

original: rten sna tshogs pas de 'gyur na //üîΩde ni rna ba la sogs sems //
analyzed: rten sna tshogs pas de 'gyur na // de ni rna ba la sogs sems //
translated: the mind is different because of the variety of supports.

original: tha dad don can de gang las ;
analyzed: tha dad don can de gang las ;
translated: How can the mind that has a different objectüîΩarise from that?

original: / gal te rten tha dad pas rnam pa tha dad par 'gyur srid na /
analyzed: / gal te rten tha dad pas rnam pa tha dad par 'gyur srid na /
translated: If it is possible that the aspects are different because of the difference in the supports,

original: 'o na ni tha dad pa'i rnam par gnas pa 'jig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ni tha dad pa'i rnam par gnas pa 'jig par 'gyur te /
translated: then the established difference in the aspects will be destroyed,

original: rnam pa tha dad pa ni don gcig na srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa tha dad pa ni don gcig na srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the difference in the aspects is possible if there is only one object.

original: sgra la sogs pa yang /
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa yang /
translated: Sound and so on are also

original: rna ba la sogs pa rten tha dad pa nyid kyis rnam pa tha dad pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa rten tha dad pa nyid kyis rnam pa tha dad pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: and the ear, etc., would have different aspects because they have different supports.

original: ser po la sogs par snang ba yang 'khrul pa nyid pas sgra la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang de thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ser po la sogs par snang ba yang 'khrul pa nyid pas sgra la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang de thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: And since the appearance as yellow, etc., is itself erroneous, sound, etc., would also be apprehended by it.

original: nus pa'i khyad par yang 'di nyid kyi gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: nus pa'i khyad par yang 'di nyid kyi gsal ba yin no //
translated: The difference in potentiality is also clarified by this.

original: gang gis tha dad par ram gzhan du don rnam pa gzhan du rtogs par 'gyur ba 'di ni sgra nyid kyi nus pa yin /
analyzed: gang gis tha dad par ram gzhan du don rnam pa gzhan du rtogs par 'gyur ba 'di ni sgra nyid kyi nus pa yin /
translated: It is the potentiality of the word itself that causes the understanding of a different object in a different way or as something else.

original: rnam pa gzhan du rtogs pa na 'khrul par ni dpyad par mi bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du rtogs pa na 'khrul par ni dpyad par mi bya ste /
translated: When there is an understanding in a different way, it is not to be analyzed as to whether it is erroneous.

original: de la sgras rnam pa gzhan du rtogs kyang don bya ba byed pa snang ba yin pas na 'di 'khrul par ci ltar rigs /
analyzed: de la sgras rnam pa gzhan du rtogs kyang don bya ba byed pa snang ba yin pas na 'di 'khrul par ci ltar rigs /
translated: Since the performance of the object‚Äôs function appears when the object is understood in a different way through the word, how can it be known that this is erroneous?

original: 'di ltar kha chu la sogs pa'i sgras don de nyid bstan pa ni don bya ba de nyid byed do zhes gang brjod pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar kha chu la sogs pa'i sgras don de nyid bstan pa ni don bya ba de nyid byed do zhes gang brjod pa /
translated: Thus, when the object itself is indicated by the word ‚Äúspittle,‚Äù etc., it is said that the object‚Äôs function is performed.

original: don bya ba 'di ni don dang 'bral pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don bya ba 'di ni don dang 'bral pa ma yin te /
translated: This performance of the object‚Äôs function is not divorced from the object.

original: 'on kyang goms pa dang 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang goms pa dang 'brel pa yin te /
translated: But it is related to the familiarization with it.

original: dper na du gzhi ba la sogs pa nam mkha' lding bsgom pa dang 'brel pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na du gzhi ba la sogs pa nam mkha' lding bsgom pa dang 'brel pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the familiarization with the garu·∏ça that is related to the basis of the mantra.

original: de'i phyir don gcig nyid dang rten tha dad kyang rnam pa tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir don gcig nyid dang rten tha dad kyang rnam pa tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, even though the object is the same and the basis is different, the aspects are not different.üîΩMoreover:

original: gzhan yang / sems kyi rten ni gzhan dang gzhan //
analyzed: gzhan yang / sems kyi rten ni gzhan dang gzhan //
translated: The basis of the mind is different.

original: skyes bu phyug kyang gcig nyid kyi //üîΩdngos de rang bzhin sna tshogs su //
analyzed: skyes bu phyug kyang gcig nyid kyi // dngos de rang bzhin sna tshogs su //
translated: The one person is rich.üîΩFrom what is that entityüîΩwith various natures

original: snang ba de ni gang las yin //
analyzed: snang ba de ni gang las yin //
translated: seen?

original: rten tha dad pas ni shes pa tha dad pa skyed par byed kyi don ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rten tha dad pas ni shes pa tha dad pa skyed par byed kyi don ni ma yin no //
translated: The different bases produce the different consciousnesses, but not the object.

original: don sngon po la sogs pa gcig nyid yin pas de ni shes pa de la rang bzhin gcig nyid du snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don sngon po la sogs pa gcig nyid yin pas de ni shes pa de la rang bzhin gcig nyid du snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the one object, such as blue, is the same, it appears to that consciousness as the same nature.

original: med pa ni snang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa ni snang ba ma yin no //
translated: What does not exist does not appear.

original: snang ngo zhe na /
analyzed: snang ngo zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it appears,

original: 'o na ni de snang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni de snang ba ma yin no //
translated: then it is not an appearance.

original: gzhan snang ba na gzhan snang ngo zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan snang ba na gzhan snang ngo zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not related to say that when one appears, another appears.

original: ci ste de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de snang ba yin no zhe na de lta na ni rgyu nyid kyi yul yin pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa yul nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de snang ba yin no zhe na de lta na ni rgyu nyid kyi yul yin pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa yul nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if you say that it is an object because it is the cause of the appearance of consciousness, then it follows that the eye, etc. are objects because they are the cause of consciousness.

original: 'gyur mod nyes pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'gyur mod nyes pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is wrong with that?

original: gcig nyid 'gal bar @280b 'gyur te mig kyang yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig nyid 'gal bar @280b 'gyur te mig kyang yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It would contradict the fact that they are one, because the eye, etc. are also objects.

original: yul nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: yul nyid yin na ni /
translated: If they are objects,

original: blo rnams don gcig yin yang zhes bya ba'i dkyus ma nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blo rnams don gcig yin yang zhes bya ba'i dkyus ma nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the statement ‚ÄúAlthough the objects of the cognitions are the same‚Äù is contradicted.

original: yul nyid yin na ni rten gyi dngos po nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: yul nyid yin na ni rten gyi dngos po nyid ma yin no //
translated: If they are objects, they cannot be the basis.

original: des na ngag gi don 'dir 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na ngag gi don 'dir 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the statement is as follows:

original: blo rnams don gcig nyid yin yang //
analyzed: blo rnams don gcig nyid yin yang //
translated: Although the objects of the cognitions are the same,

original: rten sna tshogs pas der 'gyur na zhes phan tshun 'gal bar 'gyur ro //üîΩde'i phyir rang gi ngo bos snang ba nyid yul yin te /
analyzed: rten sna tshogs pas der 'gyur na zhes phan tshun 'gal bar 'gyur ro // de'i phyir rang gi ngo bos snang ba nyid yul yin te /
translated: if they are objects because they are the basis of the cognitions, then they would be mutually contradictory.

original: rnam pa gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan ni med do //
translated: Therefore, the appearance of an object by virtue of its own nature is the object; there is no other kind of object.

original: 'on te sgra rten pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lan yin te /
analyzed: 'on te sgra rten pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lan yin te /
translated: But if you say that the object is the basis of the word, then this is the reply.

original: rtogs pa'i sgra las rang gi ngo bos don rtogs so //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i sgra las rang gi ngo bos don rtogs so //
translated: The word ‚Äúrealizes‚Äù means that the object is realized by its own nature.

original: 'di ni don rtogs pa'i yul yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni don rtogs pa'i yul yang ma yin te /
translated: But the object is not the object of realization,

original: rtogs zin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rtogs zin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it is already realized.

original: de lta na ni don kyang yul du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni don kyang yul du mi 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then the object is not the object,

original: rang gi ngo bos ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not realized by its own nature.

original: 'on te de las kyang thob pa'i phyir yul yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de las kyang thob pa'i phyir yul yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is the object because it is obtained from it,

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: that is not correct.

original: de de las thob po zhes bya ba 'brel pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: de de las thob po zhes bya ba 'brel pa ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the connection between ‚Äúthat‚Äù and ‚Äúit is obtained from it‚Äù?

original: de ni rang gi ngo bos thob par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ci ltar gzhan las thob par brjod /
analyzed: de ni rang gi ngo bos thob par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ci ltar gzhan las thob par brjod /
translated: Since it is to be obtained by its own nature, how can it be said to be obtained from another?

original: de la 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhe na ma rtogs pa la 'jug pa nyid ci ltar zhes bsam par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de la 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhe na ma rtogs pa la 'jug pa nyid ci ltar zhes bsam par bya ba yin no //
translated: If you say that it is because it engages it, then how can it be said that it engages what is not realized?

original: rnam pa de las de thob par mthong ngo zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa de las de thob par mthong ngo zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is seen to be obtained from it in that way,

original: rnam pa de nyid las de rtogs pa des na der 'jug pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa dang ldan pa'i thob par 'gyur gyi sgra dang ldan pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa de nyid las de rtogs pa des na der 'jug pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa dang ldan pa'i thob par 'gyur gyi sgra dang ldan pa ni ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and because it is understood from that very form, it is inferred, and thus it is obtained through inference, not through verbal testimony.

original: des na de ni rjes su dpag pa nyid kyi yul yin gyi sgra'i ni ma yin no zhes bya ba thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de ni rjes su dpag pa nyid kyi yul yin gyi sgra'i ni ma yin no zhes bya ba thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is established that it is the object of inference, not of verbal testimony.

original: des na dbang po'i blo yul ni bstan du med pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: des na dbang po'i blo yul ni bstan du med pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: Thus, the object of the cognition of the sense faculties is of the nature of the imperceptible.

original: 'o na rjes su dpag pa'i yul du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rjes su dpag pa'i yul du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that it is then the object of inference,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: rjes su dpag pa la yang de'i rang bzhin mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la yang de'i rang bzhin mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even for inference, its nature does not appear.

original: 'o na mi snang ba la ji ltar 'dug ce na thams cad du mi snang ba nyid la 'jug pa yin no zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: 'o na mi snang ba la ji ltar 'dug ce na thams cad du mi snang ba nyid la 'jug pa yin no zhes bstan zin to //
translated: If it is asked how it exists if it does not appear, it has been explained that it is engaged in the mere non-appearance of everything.

original: de ngas rtogs pa yin no zhes 'jug pa ni yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de ngas rtogs pa yin no zhes 'jug pa ni yin nam zhe na /
translated: If it is asked whether it is engaged in the thought I understand that,

original: bden na de lta na yang 'di'i don dam pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bden na de lta na yang 'di'i don dam pa ni ma yin no //
translated: it is true, but even so, that is not its ultimate meaning.

original: ma rtogs kyang rtogs par rlom nas thams cad 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di nyid don dam pa yin no //
analyzed: ma rtogs kyang rtogs par rlom nas thams cad 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di nyid don dam pa yin no //
translated: This very assumption is the ultimate.

original: gang du mngon par rlom pa de nyid yul yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang du mngon par rlom pa de nyid yul yin no zhe na /
translated: Wherever there is an assumption, that is the object.

original: dbang po'i shes pa'i don sgra'i yul don dam pa nyid zlog par byed kyang kun rdzob ni ma yin pa'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa'i don sgra'i yul don dam pa nyid zlog par byed kyang kun rdzob ni ma yin pa'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: We reply: There is no fault, because the object of a sense consciousness is the ultimate object of a word, but the conventional is not refuted.

original: gal te gzhan gyi de nyid khas len na ni ded kyi 'dod pa grub po //
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi de nyid khas len na ni ded kyi 'dod pa grub po //
translated: If you accept the reality of the other, then your assertion is established.

original: gal te rang gi ngo bos de nyid rtogs na ni don dam pa'i yul nyid du rtogs par @281a * //
analyzed: gal te rang gi ngo bos de nyid rtogs na ni don dam pa'i yul nyid du rtogs par @281a * //
