translated: If it is reflexive awareness, how could the convention of one not be made?

original: de ltar rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because inference engages in that way.

original: de la ni gzugs dang 'bras bu phyir mthong bas de gcig nyid du rjes su dpog go //
analyzed: de la ni gzugs dang 'bras bu phyir mthong bas de gcig nyid du rjes su dpog go //
translated: In that case, form is seen as the effect, and one infers that it is one.

original: gnyis pa mthong bas ni ma yin pa'i phyir de gcig nyid du tha snyad byed do //
analyzed: gnyis pa mthong bas ni ma yin pa'i phyir de gcig nyid du tha snyad byed do //
translated: Because the second is not seen, one makes the convention of one.

original: 'o na 'dir gnyi ga yang mthong ba'i phyir gcig nyid tha snyad du ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na 'dir gnyi ga yang mthong ba'i phyir gcig nyid tha snyad du ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: But in this case, because both are seen, how could one be made conventionally?

original: 'di la rjes su dpag pa yang med de /
analyzed: 'di la rjes su dpag pa yang med de /
translated: In this case, there is no inference.

original: rang rig pa nyid la yang rjes su dpag pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: rang rig pa nyid la yang rjes su dpag pas ci zhig bya /
translated: What use is inference for reflexive awareness?

original: gal te phan tshun rig pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar gnyis rig / skyes bu gcig yod pa des de gnyis rig go zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te phan tshun rig pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar gnyis rig / skyes bu gcig yod pa des de gnyis rig go zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that the two are known because they are mutually known, no.

original: rang rig pa las tha dad pa'i skyes bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rig pa las tha dad pa'i skyes bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no person separate from self-awareness.

original: de dag gis kyang gnyis rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis kyang gnyis rig pa ma yin no //
translated: And they do not know the two.

original: 'on te gzugs dang ro rig pa bzhin du gnyis rig go zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gzugs dang ro rig pa bzhin du gnyis rig go zhe na /
translated: If you say that the two are known as form and taste are known,

original: rang rig pa nyid na der yang ji ltar zhes bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: rang rig pa nyid na der yang ji ltar zhes bstan pa yin te /
translated: we reply that in that case, how is it that self-awareness is known?

original: gzhan gyi myong ba la yang thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi myong ba la yang thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow, absurdly, that it would be experienced by another.

original: de'i phyir sna tshogs kyi rnam pa'i rang rig pa gcig nyid do zhes 'di ni bstan zin to //
analyzed: de'i phyir sna tshogs kyi rnam pa'i rang rig pa gcig nyid do zhes 'di ni bstan zin to //
translated: Therefore, we have shown that the one self-awareness is the variety of aspects.

original: 'di ni phyi rol gyi don la brten te /
analyzed: 'di ni phyi rol gyi don la brten te /
translated: This is said on the basis of external objects

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa yang khas blangs nas brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa yang khas blangs nas brjod pa yin te /
translated: and on the basis of accepting the subject-object dichotomy.

original: don dam par ni thams cad rig pa tsam yin gyi /
analyzed: don dam par ni thams cad rig pa tsam yin gyi /
translated: In reality, everything is mere awareness.

original: dbang po la sogs pa'i shes pa'i khyad par ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa'i shes pa'i khyad par ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There are no distinctions among the consciousnesses of the sense faculties and so on.

original: dbang po'i byed pa yang dus mtshungs pa nyid du rig pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i byed pa yang dus mtshungs pa nyid du rig pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: because the activity of the sense faculty is known at the same time as the object, as in the case of form, etc.

original: 'on te mig la sogs pa tha dad du rgyu ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mig la sogs pa tha dad du rgyu ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But aren‚Äôt the eye, etc., different?

original: de bzhin du yid dang rang rig pa dang / yid dang dbang po'i shes pa dag tha dad do //
analyzed: de bzhin du yid dang rang rig pa dang / yid dang dbang po'i shes pa dag tha dad do //
translated: In the same way, the mental faculty and self-awareness, and the mental faculty and the sense consciousnesses, are different.

original: 'di la tha snyad med pa yin nam /
analyzed: 'di la tha snyad med pa yin nam /
translated: But is there no conventional expression for them?

original: tha dad pa'i tha snyad med kyang /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i tha snyad med kyang /
translated: Even though there is no conventional expression for their difference,

original: rjes su dpag pa yang tha snyad nyid yin pas skyon med do //üîΩ@286b 'o na bdag la sogs pa la yang rjes su dpag pa'i tha snyad yod pa nyid pas skyon med de /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang tha snyad nyid yin pas skyon med do // @286b 'o na bdag la sogs pa la yang rjes su dpag pa'i tha snyad yod pa nyid pas skyon med de /
translated: since inference is itself a convention, there is no fault.

original: de ltar na bdag la sogs pa la yang rjes su dpag pa'i tha snyad yod pas bdag la sogs pa yang yod par thal ba'i phyir ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na bdag la sogs pa la yang rjes su dpag pa'i tha snyad yod pas bdag la sogs pa yang yod par thal ba'i phyir ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: But since there is conventional expression for inference even in regard to self, etc., the fault arises that self, etc., would exist.

original: de la gnod par byed pa'i tha snyad yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gnod par byed pa'i tha snyad yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not so, because there is conventional expression that refutes them.

original: de'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid khyad par gyi rang bzhin la ni brda nus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di gnas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid khyad par gyi rang bzhin la ni brda nus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di gnas so //
translated: Moreover, some say that nonindicative formüîΩis known by consciousness that depends on something else.üîΩFirst, that which is known by another consciousness does not have reflexive awareness.

original: gzhan yang rig byed min de dag / rang gi ngo bo ci ltar rig / don gzhan la brten rnam shes kyis //
analyzed: gzhan yang rig byed min de dag / rang gi ngo bo ci ltar rig / don gzhan la brten rnam shes kyis //
translated: Is there reflexive awareness of pleasure, etc., which are not known by consciousness?üîΩIf you say that pleasure, etc., have reflexive awareness because they are known,üîΩthen they would not be known by consciousness.üîΩIf you say that they are known by consciousness because they have reflexive awareness,üîΩthen there would be an infinite regress.

original: rig bya yin zhes 'ga' zhig zer //
analyzed: rig bya yin zhes 'ga' zhig zer //
translated: If you say that pleasure, etc., have reflexive awareness because they are known,üîΩthen they would not be known by consciousness.

original: re zhig rnam par shes pa gzhan rig par byed pa gang yin pa de la yang rang rig pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: re zhig rnam par shes pa gzhan rig par byed pa gang yin pa de la yang rang rig pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If you say that they are known by consciousness because they have reflexive awareness,üîΩthen there would be an infinite regress.üîΩIf you say that pleasure, etc., have reflexive awareness because they are known,üîΩthen they would not be known by consciousness.

original: ci shes ldan rig pa ma yin pa'i bde ba la sogs pa la yod dam /
analyzed: ci shes ldan rig pa ma yin pa'i bde ba la sogs pa la yod dam /
translated: If you say that they are known by consciousness because they have reflexive awareness,üîΩthen there would be an infinite regress.üîΩIf you say that pleasure, etc., have reflexive awareness because they are known,üîΩthen they would not be known by consciousness.

original: gal te rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gal te rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir //
translated: If you say that they are known by consciousness because they have reflexive awareness,üîΩthen there would be an infinite regress.

original: bde ba la sogs pa rang rig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa rang rig par 'gyur te /
translated: If you say that pleasure, etc., have reflexive awareness because they are known,üîΩthen they would not be known by consciousness.üîΩIf you say that they are known by consciousness because they have reflexive awareness,

original: de lta ma yin na rig pa nyid med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rig pa nyid med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then there would be an infinite regress.üîΩIf you say that pleasure, etc., have reflexive awareness because they are known,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: then they would not be known by consciousness.üîΩIf you say that they are known by consciousness because they have reflexive awareness,üîΩthen there would be an infinite regress.üîΩIf you say that pleasure, etc., have reflexive awareness because they are known,üîΩthen they would not be known by consciousness.

original: rang rig pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan gyis rig pa yin na /
analyzed: rang rig pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro // gzhan gyis rig pa yin na /
translated: If you say that they are known by consciousness because they have reflexive awareness,üîΩthen there would be an infinite regress.üîΩIf you say that pleasure, etc., have reflexive awareness because they are known,üîΩthen they would not be known by consciousness.

original: bum pa la sogs pa ltar rang rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa ltar rang rig pa ma yin no //
translated: If you say that they are known by consciousness because they have reflexive awareness,üîΩthen there would be an infinite regress.üîΩIf you say that pleasure, etc., have reflexive awareness because they are known,

original: de lta na 'o na thun mong du rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na thun mong du rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: But if that is so, then they would be commonly cognized.

original: don gcig la 'du ba'i shes pas rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gcig la 'du ba'i shes pas rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not commonly cognized because they are cognized by a consciousness that is unified with a single object.

original: bum pa la sogs pa ni don gcig la 'du ba'i shes pas ma yin no //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa ni don gcig la 'du ba'i shes pas ma yin no //
translated: But a pot, etc., is not cognized by a consciousness that is unified with a single object.

original: nges na de dag gzung ba'i rang bzhin yin pas btang snyoms pa nyid du rig pa yin no //üîΩbde ba la sogs pa shes pa las tha mi dad pa nyid du rtogs pa ni rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin lta bur 'dzin pa'i rnam pa nyid ma gtogs par de la zhugs pas rig pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du thal bar mi 'gyur
analyzed: nges na de dag gzung ba'i rang bzhin yin pas btang snyoms pa nyid du rig pa yin no // bde ba la sogs pa shes pa las tha mi dad pa nyid du rtogs pa ni rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin lta bur 'dzin pa'i rnam pa nyid ma gtogs par de la zhugs pas rig pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du thal bar mi 'gyur
translated: If it were, it would be cognized as neutral, since it is the nature of the object to be grasped.üîΩSome say: It is not the case that pleasure, etc., are cognized as being of the nature of consciousness, because they are cognized as engaged with the aspect of grasping them as being different from consciousness.

original: ro zhes kha cig zer ba de dag gi ltar na /üîΩde dang de min rang bzhin dngos //
analyzed: ro zhes kha cig zer ba de dag gi ltar na / de dang de min rang bzhin dngos //
translated: But it is not the case that they are like a pot, etc., because they are cognized as being of the nature of consciousness.üîΩAccording to them,üîΩThe nature of that and that is real.

original: de dang de min dngos rgyus bskyed //
analyzed: de dang de min dngos rgyus bskyed //
translated: That and that are produced by real causes.

original: rnam shes rgyu las gzhan min skyes //
analyzed: rnam shes rgyu las gzhan min skyes //
translated: Consciousness is produced from causes that are not different.

original: bde sogs de ci shes ma yin //
analyzed: bde sogs de ci shes ma yin //
translated: Are pleasure, etc., not consciousness?

original: re zhig khyed kyi 'di mngon sum gyis ni rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: re zhig khyed kyi 'di mngon sum gyis ni rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: First, you do not understand this by direct perception.

original: rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa ni rtags med par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa ni rtags med par mi 'dod do //
translated: We do not accept that inference is without a reason.

original: bde ba la sogs pa ni shes pa las tha dad par rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa ni shes pa las tha dad par rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: Pleasure, etc. are not understood as different from consciousness,

original: don gcig la 'du ba'i 'gal ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gcig la 'du ba'i 'gal ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is a contradiction in the unity of the object.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang rtag med par 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang rtag med par 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: Inference also does not operate without a reason.

original: gal te rgyu tha dad par bstan par nus na ni 'di la rtags su 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te rgyu tha dad par bstan par nus na ni 'di la rtags su 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: If it is possible to demonstrate a difference in cause, then that would be the reason.

original: mngon sum ma yin pa'i rjes su dpag pa @287a * //
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin pa'i rjes su dpag pa @287a * //
translated: Without direct perception, inference

original: med par rtogs par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: med par rtogs par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: cannot be understood.

original: rgyu tha dad pas ni tha dad par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pas ni tha dad par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because difference is seen due to difference in cause.

original: 'bras bu'i tha dad pa ni gnod mi za ba'i phyir tshogs pa tha dad las yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i tha dad pa ni gnod mi za ba'i phyir tshogs pa tha dad las yin no //
translated: The difference in effect is from the difference in assemblage, because it is unavoidable.

original: 'bras bu tha dad pa ni tha dad pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu tha dad pa ni tha dad pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The difference in effect is not the proof of difference,üîΩbecause the difference in effect is not the proof of difference.

original: thal ba dang du ba bzhin du rgyu gcig las kyang 'bras bu tha dad pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thal ba dang du ba bzhin du rgyu gcig las kyang 'bras bu tha dad pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, like ashes and smoke, different effects are seen to arise from a single cause.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i dang shes pa tha dad pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i 'bras bu tha dad pa yang de dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i dang shes pa tha dad pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i 'bras bu tha dad pa yang de dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: The difference in the effect that proves the difference between consciousness and pleasure, etc. is not perceived,

original: de'i phyir rgyu tha dad pa nyid bstan par bya ba yin na de yang med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu tha dad pa nyid bstan par bya ba yin na de yang med do //
translated: so the difference in cause must be demonstrated, but that does not exist.

original: tha mi dad pa'i rgyu can dang tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin dmigs pa na /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i rgyu can dang tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin dmigs pa na /
translated: When a nondifferent cause and a nondifferent nature are perceived,

original: ci'i phyir tha dad ces tha snyad byed de /
analyzed: ci'i phyir tha dad ces tha snyad byed de /
translated: why is a difference imagined?

original: 'di la tshad ma ci zhig yod ces bya ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: 'di la tshad ma ci zhig yod ces bya ba'i tshig go //
translated: What is the evidence for that?

original: yang na gal te bde ba la sogs pa dag las shes pa gzhan yin na bde ba la sogs pa dang rnam par shes pa'i rgyu ci yin /
analyzed: yang na gal te bde ba la sogs pa dag las shes pa gzhan yin na bde ba la sogs pa dang rnam par shes pa'i rgyu ci yin /
translated: Moreover, if consciousness is different from pleasure, etc., what is the cause of pleasure, etc., and consciousness?

original: mig dang gzugs dang yid la byed pa dag go //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs dang yid la byed pa dag go //
translated: The eye, form, and attention.

original: des na rnam par shes pa'i rgyu mig la sogs pa las bde ba la sogs pa skye ba yin no //
analyzed: des na rnam par shes pa'i rgyu mig la sogs pa las bde ba la sogs pa skye ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, pleasure, etc. arise from the cause of consciousness, the eye, etc.

original: de ltar yin dang de ci'i phyir shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yin dang de ci'i phyir shes pa ma yin te /
translated: If that is so, why is it not consciousness?

original: ci'i phyir rnam par shes pas rig pa ma yin /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam par shes pas rig pa ma yin /
translated: Why is it not known by consciousness?

original: med pa nyid do zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa nyid do zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say it does not exist, that is not so,

original: rnam par shes pa'i rgyu nyid las skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rgyu nyid las skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises from the cause of consciousness.

original: 'di ltar rig par mi 'gyur ba nyid yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar rig par mi 'gyur ba nyid yin /
translated: In that case, it would not be known.

original: khyed kyi phyogs la yang ci'i phyir /
analyzed: khyed kyi phyogs la yang ci'i phyir /
translated: Why is it not so in your system?

original: de lta ma yin zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say it is not so, that is not so,

original: bag chags sad pa'i khyad par rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag chags sad pa'i khyad par rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the special activation of the latent propensities is the cause.

original: bag chags sad pa'i rnam par dbye ba'i stobs kyis rnam par shes pa res 'ga' bde ba'i rang bzhin dang sdug bsngal dang rnam pa gzhan du ma yin pa'i phyir mi 'thad pa med do //
analyzed: bag chags sad pa'i rnam par dbye ba'i stobs kyis rnam par shes pa res 'ga' bde ba'i rang bzhin dang sdug bsngal dang rnam pa gzhan du ma yin pa'i phyir mi 'thad pa med do //
translated: There is no inconsistency, because sometimes consciousness has the nature of pleasure, sometimes the nature of pain, and sometimes the nature of neither, due to the power of the special activation of the latent propensities.

original: rgyu mtshungs pa nyid ston pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu mtshungs pa nyid ston pa ni /
translated: The following verse is stated to show the similarity of the cause.

original: don bcas dbang po rung ba dang // bdag nyid ci ltar sems yod na //
analyzed: don bcas dbang po rung ba dang // bdag nyid ci ltar sems yod na //
translated: When the sense faculty and object are fit, and the mind is present,

original: bde ba la sogs skye bar mthong //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs skye bar mthong //
translated: pleasure and so on are seen to arise.

original: yid kyang de dang mtshungs pa yin //
analyzed: yid kyang de dang mtshungs pa yin //
translated: The mental faculty is similar to that.

original: mig med par ni gzugs mthong ba'i bde ba yod pa ma yin la yid 'phrog pa'i gzugs med dam /
analyzed: mig med par ni gzugs mthong ba'i bde ba yod pa ma yin la yid 'phrog pa'i gzugs med dam /
translated: Without eyes, there is no experience of the pleasure of seeing visible form, nor is there the absence of visible form that captivates the mind.

original: mya ngan la sogs pa'i yid nyams na yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan la sogs pa'i yid nyams na yang ma yin no //
translated: And when the mind is afflicted with sorrow, etc., there is no experience of pleasure.

original: rnam par shes pa skye ba'i tshogs pa yang 'di nyid yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skye ba'i tshogs pa yang 'di nyid yin te /
translated: This is the collection of causes for the arising of consciousness.

original: de'i phyir tha dad pa rtogs par byed pa'i rgyu tha dad pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir tha dad pa rtogs par byed pa'i rgyu tha dad pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no separate cause for the apprehension of difference.

original: bdag dang yid phrad pa rgyu yin la /
analyzed: bdag dang yid phrad pa rgyu yin la /
translated: The contact of the self and the mind is the cause.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las skye ba'i bde ba ni mi shes par mi rigs so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las skye ba'i bde ba ni mi shes par mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable that pleasure, etc., which arise from the collection of visible form, etc., are not known.

original: 'on te de'i tshe bde ba la sogs pa ma @287b skyes pa des na /üîΩgdon mi za bar med pa shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te de'i tshe bde ba la sogs pa ma @287b skyes pa des na / gdon mi za bar med pa shes pa ma yin te /
translated: But if at that time pleasure, etc., have not yet arisen,üîΩthen it is not the case that they are definitely known to be nonexistent.

original: med pa ni gzung bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: med pa ni gzung bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the nonexistent cannot be apprehended.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: de dag yod dang med pa na //üîΩ'ga' la bde la sogs dang blo //
analyzed: de dag yod dang med pa na // 'ga' la bde la sogs dang blo //
translated: In regard to their existence or nonexistence,

original: skye dang mi skye mthong de'i phyir //
analyzed: skye dang mi skye mthong de'i phyir //
translated: pleasure, etc., are seen to arise or not arise for some in regard to the mind.

original: de las de skye gzhan las min //
analyzed: de las de skye gzhan las min //
translated: Therefore, they arise from that, not from another.

original: gang gis bde ba la sogs pa rnam par shes pa las rgyu gzhan yin par rtogs pa /
analyzed: gang gis bde ba la sogs pa rnam par shes pa las rgyu gzhan yin par rtogs pa /
translated: But it is not the case that pleasure, etc. arise in dependence on a cause other than consciousness,

original: mig dang / gzugs dang / snang ba dang / yid la byed pa med par bde ba la sogs pa skye ba la brten pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mig dang / gzugs dang / snang ba dang / yid la byed pa med par bde ba la sogs pa skye ba la brten pa ni ma yin no //
translated: because pleasure, etc. do not arise in the absence of eye, form, light, and attention.üîΩTherefore, the cause of consciousness is the cause of pleasure, etc.

original: des na rnam par shes pa'i rgyu nyid bde ba la sogs pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: des na rnam par shes pa'i rgyu nyid bde ba la sogs pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: But if you think that pleasure, etc. have a cause other than consciousness,üîΩthen that is not so, because pleasure, etc. are not seen to arise in the absence of consciousness.

original: 'on te chos la sogs pa dang de ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: 'on te chos la sogs pa dang de ma yin pa'am /
translated: But if you think that pleasure, etc. have a cause other than consciousness,üîΩthen that is not so, because pleasure, etc. are not seen to arise in the absence of consciousness.üîΩBut if you think that pleasure, etc. have a cause other than consciousness,

original: chos la sogs pa de nyid bde ba la sogs pa'i rgyu yin no zhen de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: chos la sogs pa de nyid bde ba la sogs pa'i rgyu yin no zhen de yang ma yin te /
translated: then that is not so, because pleasure, etc. are not seen to arise in the absence of consciousness.

original: 'di ltar gang gi 'bras bu ldog pa las rgyu gzhan rtog pa'i go skabs su 'gyur ba /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi 'bras bu ldog pa las rgyu gzhan rtog pa'i go skabs su 'gyur ba /
translated: But if you think that pleasure, etc. have a cause other than consciousness,

original: mig la sogs pa yod pa na mi skye bar ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa yod pa na mi skye bar ma mthong ngo //
translated: then that is not so, because pleasure, etc. are not seen to arise in the absence of consciousness.üîΩBut if you think that pleasure, etc. have a cause other than consciousness,üîΩthen that is not so, because pleasure, etc. are not seen to arise in the absence of consciousness.üîΩBut if you think that pleasure, etc. have a cause other than consciousness,üîΩthen that is not so, because pleasure, etc. are not seen to arise in the absence of consciousness.üîΩBut if you think that pleasure, etc. have a cause other than consciousness,üîΩthen that is not so, because pleasure, etc. are not seen to arise in the absence of consciousness.üîΩBut if you think that pleasure, etc. have a cause other than consciousness,üîΩthen that is not so, because pleasure, etc. are not seen to arise in the absence of consciousness.

original: 'on te ldog pa med kyang chos la sogs pa rgyu nyid do //üîΩbde ba ni 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: 'on te ldog pa med kyang chos la sogs pa rgyu nyid do // bde ba ni 'dod pa yin la /
translated: But if you think that pleasure, etc. have a cause other than consciousness,üîΩthen that is not so, because pleasure, etc. are not seen to arise in the absence of consciousness.üîΩBut if you think that pleasure, etc. have a cause other than consciousness,üîΩthen that is not so, because pleasure, etc. are not seen to arise in the absence of consciousness.

original: sdug bsngal ni mi 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni mi 'dod pa yin te /
translated: But if you think that pleasure, etc. have a cause other than consciousness,üîΩthen that is not so, because pleasure, etc. are not seen to arise in the absence of consciousness.üîΩBut if you think that pleasure, etc. have a cause other

original: de la chos dang chos ma yin pa dag ni gdon mi za bar rgyu yin no /üîΩ'di ni tshu rol mdzes pa ma gtogs pa'i rab tu smra ba thams cad la rab tu grub pa nyid do zhe na de yang mi bden te /
analyzed: de la chos dang chos ma yin pa dag ni gdon mi za bar rgyu yin no / 'di ni tshu rol mdzes pa ma gtogs pa'i rab tu smra ba thams cad la rab tu grub pa nyid do zhe na de yang mi bden te /
translated: It is certain that virtue and nonvirtue are the causes of pleasure and pain.üîΩThis is established for all the proponents of philosophical systems, except for the CƒÅrvƒÅkas.

original: ldog pa med phyir chos sogs kyi //
analyzed: ldog pa med phyir chos sogs kyi //
translated: But that is not correct, because the capacity of virtue, etc.

original: nus pa grub pa med pa nyid //üîΩbde ba tsam la chos sogs ni //
analyzed: nus pa grub pa med pa nyid // bde ba tsam la chos sogs ni //
translated: is not established, since there is no cessation.üîΩThe capacity of virtue, etc.

original: nus dang 'dod pa grub ma yin //
analyzed: nus dang 'dod pa grub ma yin //
translated: to produce pleasure, etc. is not established.

original: chos la sogs pa ni bde ba la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i tshogs par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: chos la sogs pa ni bde ba la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i tshogs par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Virtue, etc. are the collections of causes that produce pleasure, etc.

original: bde ba la sogs pa nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: but not pleasure, etc. themselves.

original: de lta ma yin na ni de'i sgrub par byed pa med kyang bde ba la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni de'i sgrub par byed pa med kyang bde ba la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, then pleasure, etc. would occur even without their causes.

original: ci ste yang bde ba sgrub par byed pa'i gzugs la sogs pa yod kyang /
analyzed: ci ste yang bde ba sgrub par byed pa'i gzugs la sogs pa yod kyang /
translated: But even if the form, etc. that produce pleasure exist,

original: mya ngan la sogs pas nang gi byad pa'i nus pa nyams na bde ba mi skye ste /
analyzed: mya ngan la sogs pas nang gi byad pa'i nus pa nyams na bde ba mi skye ste /
translated: pleasure is not produced if the capacity of the internal conditions, such as joy, is impaired by grief, etc.

original: des na chos nyid rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: des na chos nyid rgyu yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, you should understand that reality is the cause,

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni ma yin par rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni ma yin par rtogs so zhe na /
translated: but form and so on are not.

original: de ni rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin te 'di ltar /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin te 'di ltar /
translated: That is not logical, because

original: chos min nyid kyis mya ngan la sogs pa'i tshogs pa bsgrub pa na /
analyzed: chos min nyid kyis mya ngan la sogs pa'i tshogs pa bsgrub pa na /
translated: when the collection of things such as sorrow is established by non-Dharma,

original: de las sdug bsngal skye 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: de las sdug bsngal skye 'gyur gyi //
translated: sorrow arises from that.

original: chos min las ni sdug bsngal min //üîΩchos ma yin pas ni mya ngan la sogs pa'i tshogs pa nyid sgrub par byed kyi sdug bsngal ni ma yin te /
analyzed: chos min las ni sdug bsngal min // chos ma yin pas ni mya ngan la sogs pa'i tshogs pa nyid sgrub par byed kyi sdug bsngal ni ma yin te /
translated: Sorrow does not arise from non-Dharma.

original: de yod na sdug bsngal rang nyid skye bar 'gyur ro //üîΩyang @288a * //
analyzed: de yod na sdug bsngal rang nyid skye bar 'gyur ro // yang @288a * //
translated: Sorrow does not arise from non-Dharma, because when the collection of things such as sorrow is established by non-Dharma, sorrow itself arises.

original: na chos ni chos las bde ba nyid dang gzhan las sdug bsngal yin du chug mod /
analyzed: na chos ni chos las bde ba nyid dang gzhan las sdug bsngal yin du chug mod /
translated: Or, you may accept that Dharma is pleasure and non-Dharma is pain.

original: de lta na yang des rig pa las tha dad du bskyed par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ga las yin /
analyzed: de lta na yang des rig pa las tha dad du bskyed par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ga las yin /
translated: But even so, how could it be that pleasure is produced separately from knowledge?

original: chos kyi rig pa las tha mi dad pa'i bde ba skyed kyang khyed la ni cung zad kyang gnod pa byas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyi rig pa las tha mi dad pa'i bde ba skyed kyang khyed la ni cung zad kyang gnod pa byas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Although pleasure is generated that is not different from the awareness of the object, no harm at all is done to you.

original: bde ba la sogs pas khyed la dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pas khyed la dgos pa yin no //
translated: You need pleasure, etc.

original: de ni shes pa las tha dad pa ma yin yang khyed la tsha bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni shes pa las tha dad pa ma yin yang khyed la tsha bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Although it is not different from consciousness, it does not become hot for you.

original: 'on te rgyu tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that they are different because their causes are different,

original: de yang 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang 'dod pa yin te /
translated: we agree with that.

original: gang gi phyir /üîΩrnam shes rkyang pa nyid las ni //
analyzed: gang gi phyir / rnam shes rkyang pa nyid las ni //
translated: For,üîΩthe consciousness of pleasure is different

original: bde ba'i rnam shes tha dad nyid //
analyzed: bde ba'i rnam shes tha dad nyid //
translated: from consciousness alone.

original: gcig tu nges par tha dad gang //
analyzed: gcig tu nges par tha dad gang //
translated: That which is definitely different from one

original: de ni re zhig grub ma yin //
analyzed: de ni re zhig grub ma yin //
translated: is not yet established.

original: chos dang lhan cig pa'i tshogs pa ni de nyid kyi khyad par can gyi 'bras bu skyed par byed kyi /
analyzed: chos dang lhan cig pa'i tshogs pa ni de nyid kyi khyad par can gyi 'bras bu skyed par byed kyi /
translated: The collection that is together with the object produces an effect that is qualified by it,

original: shin tu tha dad pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shin tu tha dad pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: but it is not completely different,

original: phan 'dogs pa lhag pas ni de nyid khyad par du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa lhag pas ni de nyid khyad par du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the special benefit is what qualifies it.

original: bud shing rlan dang bcas pa nyid na du ba thal ba las shin tu tha dad pa ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: bud shing rlan dang bcas pa nyid na du ba thal ba las shin tu tha dad pa ni ma yin no ;
translated: When the fuel is moist, the smoke is not completely different from the ashes.

original: / du ba ni thal ba las shin tu tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: / du ba ni thal ba las shin tu tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: The smoke is not completely different from the ashes,

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i dri ma can du byed pa ni /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i dri ma can du byed pa ni /
translated: because the soiling of blue, etc.,

original: de la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: exists in the ashes.

original: de'i phyir chos la sogs pa la shin tu tha dad par skyed pa'i nus pa ni yod pa ma yin pa'i nges par gzung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos la sogs pa la shin tu tha dad par skyed pa'i nus pa ni yod pa ma yin pa'i nges par gzung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is ascertained that the power to produce completely different things, such as the qualities, does not exist.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: de dag nyid kyi khyad par las //
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi khyad par las //
translated: From the specific characteristics of those,

original: bde sdug la sogs tha dad yin //
analyzed: bde sdug la sogs tha dad yin //
translated: there are differences such as pleasure and pain.

original: dper na blo de nyid kyi ni //
analyzed: dper na blo de nyid kyi ni //
translated: For example, it is like the very same cognition

original: gsal dang mi gsal the tshom bzhin //
analyzed: gsal dang mi gsal the tshom bzhin //
translated: being clear or unclear, or like doubt.

original: gal te shas pa dang bde ba la sogs pa rgyu mtshungs pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te shas pa dang bde ba la sogs pa rgyu mtshungs pa nyid yin na /
translated: If cognition, pleasure, etc., are the same cause,

original: rnam par shes pa rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba de tsam nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba de tsam nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: consciousness would be just that much, and

original: bde ba la sogs pa tha dad par go ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa tha dad par go ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how could the differences of pleasure, etc., be understood?

original: tshogs pa de nyid kyi khyad par las te /
analyzed: tshogs pa de nyid kyi khyad par las te /
translated: from the particular of the collection itself.

original: 'o ma la sogs pas bcus pa'i skyu ru ra'i 'bras bu'i sa bon la sogs pa'i tshogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'o ma la sogs pas bcus pa'i skyu ru ra'i 'bras bu'i sa bon la sogs pa'i tshogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Like the collection of the seed of the myrobalan fruit, etc., moistened by milk, etc.

original: 'o mas bcu ba la sogs pa lhag pa yod kyang skyu ru ra'i sa bon skyu ru ra dang mi mthun pa'i 'bras bu skyed par ni mi byed kyi 'on kyang rang bzhin de las ma 'das pa'i khyad par gzhan gnas par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'o mas bcu ba la sogs pa lhag pa yod kyang skyu ru ra'i sa bon skyu ru ra dang mi mthun pa'i 'bras bu skyed par ni mi byed kyi 'on kyang rang bzhin de las ma 'das pa'i khyad par gzhan gnas par byed pa yin no //
translated: Even though there is the addition of being moistened by milk, etc., the seed of the myrobalan fruit does not produce a fruit that is not of the nature of the myrobalan fruit, but rather it causes the particular that does not go beyond that nature to endure.

original: 'on te tha dad pa yang ci'i phyir mi skyed ce na /
analyzed: 'on te tha dad pa yang ci'i phyir mi skyed ce na /
translated: But if it is different, why does it not produce something different?

original: tha dad pa nyid skyed par byed do zhes de skad ni brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid skyed par byed do zhes de skad ni brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not to be said that it produces something different, that it is different.

original: gal te 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i tshogs pa tha dad pa zhes bya bar grub na /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu skyed par byed pa'i tshogs pa tha dad pa zhes bya bar grub na /
translated: If it is established that the collection that produces the effect is different,

original: de lta na rgyu tha dad par bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na rgyu tha dad par bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: then it is taught that the cause is different.

original: gzhan yang @288b shes rab la sogs pa yang chos la sogs pa las skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang @288b shes rab la sogs pa yang chos la sogs pa las skyes pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, wisdom, etc., are produced from phenomena, etc.

original: des na de dag kyang blo las tha dad par thal lo //
analyzed: des na de dag kyang blo las tha dad par thal lo //
translated: Therefore, it follows that they are also different from mind.

original: 'on te shes rab la sogs pa ni goms pa la sogs pa las yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on te shes rab la sogs pa ni goms pa la sogs pa las yin gyi /
translated: If you say that the faculties of wisdom and so on are due to the practice of wisdom and so on,

original: chos la sogs pa las ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: chos la sogs pa las ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: but not due to the dharmas and so on,

original: de lta yin na bde ba la sogs pa yang 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa la sogs pa goms pa las yin pa'i phyir chos la sogs pa de dag gi rgyu nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na bde ba la sogs pa yang 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa la sogs pa goms pa las yin pa'i phyir chos la sogs pa de dag gi rgyu nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then pleasure and so on would not be the cause of those dharmas and so on, because they are due to the practice of desire and non-desire and so on.

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa nye ba nyid chos las yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa nye ba nyid chos las yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the presence of desire and so on is due to the dharmas,

original: de lta na ni bde ba la sogs pa chos las skyed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni bde ba la sogs pa chos las skyed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: then pleasure and so on would not be produced from the dharmas.

original: 'on kyang nus pa dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa la sogs pa nyid las yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang nus pa dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa la sogs pa nyid las yin no //
translated: Rather, they are due to the attention and so on that possesses the capacity.

original: nus pa ma nyams pa'i yid la byed pa de ni shes pa la yang rgyu yin pa'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa tshogs pa tha dad pas bskyed par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: nus pa ma nyams pa'i yid la byed pa de ni shes pa la yang rgyu yin pa'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa tshogs pa tha dad pas bskyed par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: That attention that possesses undiminished capacity is also the cause of consciousness, so pleasure and so on are not produced by a different collection of causes.

original: ci ste yang shes rab la sogs pa bde ba la sogs pa'i rgyu chos la sogs pa'i rgyu can ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste yang shes rab la sogs pa bde ba la sogs pa'i rgyu chos la sogs pa'i rgyu can ni ma yin te /
translated: But if you say that such things as pleasure are not the effects of such things as virtue,

original: shes rab yod par gyur ba las bde ba gang yin pa de nyid chos la sogs pa'i rgyu can yin no //
analyzed: shes rab yod par gyur ba las bde ba gang yin pa de nyid chos la sogs pa'i rgyu can yin no //
translated: then whatever pleasure exists when wisdom exists is the effect of such things as virtue.

original: des na bde ba la sogs pa rgyu mtshungs pa can du ma grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: des na bde ba la sogs pa rgyu mtshungs pa can du ma grub bo zhe na /
translated: Therefore, pleasure and so on are not established as having the same cause.

original: de yang legs par brjod pa ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar / shes rab la sogs chos sogs las //
analyzed: de yang legs par brjod pa ma yin te / 'di ltar / shes rab la sogs chos sogs las //
translated: But that is not a good response.üîΩFor,

original: ma yin bde sogs de dag ces //
analyzed: ma yin bde sogs de dag ces //
translated: such things as pleasure are not the effects of such things as virtue.

original: tshad ma gang las khyed cag gi / de ni 'grub par 'gyur ba yin ;
analyzed: tshad ma gang las khyed cag gi / de ni 'grub par 'gyur ba yin ;
translated: From what valid cognition do you establish that?

original: / tshad mas ma grub pa'i rang gi lugs kyi spros pa bstan pa tsam ni pha rol po dag dga' bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: / tshad mas ma grub pa'i rang gi lugs kyi spros pa bstan pa tsam ni pha rol po dag dga' bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: It does not please the opponent to merely display the proliferation of your own system, which is not established by valid cognition.

original: shes rab la sogs pa ni chos las gzhan las mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab la sogs pa ni chos las gzhan las mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Such things as wisdom do not arise from anything other than such things as virtue.

original: chos med kyang goms pa las mthong ngo zhe na ma yin te chos med na goms pa de nyid 'bras bu dang bcas par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos med kyang goms pa las mthong ngo zhe na ma yin te chos med na goms pa de nyid 'bras bu dang bcas par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúEven though the object does not exist, it is seen through habituation,‚Äù that is not so, because if the object does not exist, then habituation itself is not tenable as a result.

original: blun pa'i phyir 'bras bu med do zhe na /
analyzed: blun pa'i phyir 'bras bu med do zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIt is fruitless because of delusion,‚Äù

original: 'o na ni bde ba la sogs pa yang rgyun gyi khyad par nyid las skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni bde ba la sogs pa yang rgyun gyi khyad par nyid las skyes pa yin no //
translated: then pleasure, etc., also arise from the special continuum itself.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / ngo bo nyid kyis ma yin la //
analyzed: 'di ltar / ngo bo nyid kyis ma yin la //
translated: It is not by nature,

original: phongs rgyu thams cad yod na yang //üîΩsngon goms las zhugs rgyud kyi ni //
analyzed: phongs rgyu thams cad yod na yang // sngon goms las zhugs rgyud kyi ni //
translated: even though all the causes are present,üîΩbut from the special continuum that enters

original: khyad par nyid las bde ba yin //
analyzed: khyad par nyid las bde ba yin //
translated: through habituation from the past, there is pleasure.

original: bde ba ni ngo bo nyid kyi khyad par gyis goms pa las yin te /
analyzed: bde ba ni ngo bo nyid kyi khyad par gyis goms pa las yin te /
translated: Pleasure is from the special nature that is habituated.

original: dam pa ma yin pa nyes par spyod pa rnams la yang mthong ba'i phyir dang chos yod kyang mnyam pa nyid mthong ba la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam pa ma yin pa nyes par spyod pa rnams la yang mthong ba'i phyir dang chos yod kyang mnyam pa nyid mthong ba la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is seen even in those of bad conduct who are not holy, and because it is not seen in those who see reality even though they have the Dharma.

original: mnyam pa nyid goms pa las phyin ci log dang lhan cig pa'i chos nyid las yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid goms pa las phyin ci log dang lhan cig pa'i chos nyid las yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIt is from the reality that is accompanied by error through habituation to equality,‚Äù

original: de lta na ni @289a * //
analyzed: de lta na ni @289a * //
translated: then in that case,

original: 'o na chos nus pa med do //
analyzed: 'o na chos nus pa med do //
translated: But then, the Dharma is ineffective.

original: goms pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir dang shes rab la sogs pa bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa blo'i rang bzhin nyid yin no //
analyzed: goms pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir dang shes rab la sogs pa bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa blo'i rang bzhin nyid yin no //
translated: Because it is preceded by practice, and because pleasure, etc. are by nature mental states, like discernment, etc.

original: gal te bde ba la sogs pa ni yid la sogs pa las skye ba yin la /
analyzed: gal te bde ba la sogs pa ni yid la sogs pa las skye ba yin la /
translated: But pleasure, etc. are produced from the mind, etc.

original: rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i rgyu can goms pa zhes bya ba'i 'du byed las skyes pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i rgyu can goms pa zhes bya ba'i 'du byed las skyes pa ma yin nam /
translated: And consciousness is produced from the cause of consciousness, i.e., from the formative forces called ‚Äúvolitions.‚Äù

original: des rgyu tha dad do 'di ltar //
analyzed: des rgyu tha dad do 'di ltar //
translated: Therefore, the cause is different.

original: bdag gis mthong ba gang yin te //
analyzed: bdag gis mthong ba gang yin te //
translated: What is seen by me

original: 'di zhes rang bzhin rnam shes ni //
analyzed: 'di zhes rang bzhin rnam shes ni //
translated: is consciousness, which is of the nature of self-illumination.

original: sngon gyi 'du byed las byung phyir //
analyzed: sngon gyi 'du byed las byung phyir //
translated: It arises from previous formative forces.

original: bde sogs la 'di yod dam ci //
analyzed: bde sogs la 'di yod dam ci //
translated: How can pleasure, etc. exist in it?

original: de ni ma yin te /üîΩbde ba la sogs pa la yang 'di rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te / bde ba la sogs pa la yang 'di rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so.üîΩBecause pleasure, etc. are also its cause.

original: 'di ltar bde ba la sogs pa la yang goms pa'i stobs nyid las skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni bstan zin to //
analyzed: 'di ltar bde ba la sogs pa la yang goms pa'i stobs nyid las skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni bstan zin to //
translated: For it has been shown that pleasure, etc. are also produced by the power of practice.

original: ci ste yang yid kyi bde ba la sogs pa nyid 'du byed las 'byung gi dbang po las skyes pa ni ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste yang yid kyi bde ba la sogs pa nyid 'du byed las 'byung gi dbang po las skyes pa ni ma yin no snyam na /
translated: But if you think that mental pleasure, etc. arise from the formative forces and not from the faculties,

original: de lta na ni 'o na yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid 'du byed las yin pa'i phyir 'di mtshungs so //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid 'du byed las yin pa'i phyir 'di mtshungs so //
translated: then, in that case, the mental consciousness is also similar to the formative forces because it arises from the formative forces.

original: 'on te dbang po las skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa la yang gsal ba la sogs pa'i khyad par goms pa las yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te dbang po las skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa la yang gsal ba la sogs pa'i khyad par goms pa las yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you think that the difference in the clarity, etc. of the consciousness that arises from the faculties is due to the repetition of the practice of clarity, etc.

original: 'o na ni bde ba la sogs pa dbang po las skyes pa rnams kyi gsal ba la sogs pa yang de nyid las yin pa'i phyir mtshungs so //
analyzed: 'o na ni bde ba la sogs pa dbang po las skyes pa rnams kyi gsal ba la sogs pa yang de nyid las yin pa'i phyir mtshungs so //
translated: then, in that case, the clarity, etc. of the pleasure, etc. that arise from the faculties is also similar to that of the consciousness because it is due to the repetition of the practice of clarity, etc.

original: gzhan yang bde ba la sogs pa ni thams cad yid nyid yin no zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: gzhan yang bde ba la sogs pa ni thams cad yid nyid yin no zhes bstan zin to //
translated: Moreover, it has already been demonstrated that pleasure, etc. are all mental.

original: gal te dngos po 'ga' zhig gzung ba la yang de nyid la shes pa yang nas yang du skye ba'i mtshan nyid goms pa'i stobs las rnam par shes pa gsal bar rig pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te dngos po 'ga' zhig gzung ba la yang de nyid la shes pa yang nas yang du skye ba'i mtshan nyid goms pa'i stobs las rnam par shes pa gsal bar rig pa yin no //
translated: If you think that the clarity, etc. of the consciousness that apprehends an object is due to the power of repetition, the characteristic of which is the repeated arising of the consciousness in regard to that very object,

original: gal te bde ba la sogs pa rnams kyang shes pa gzhan gyis 'dzin na de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te bde ba la sogs pa rnams kyang shes pa gzhan gyis 'dzin na de'i tshe /
translated: If pleasure and so on are also apprehended by another cognition,

original: de 'dzin pa gsal bar 'gyur ba rig pa yin na /
analyzed: de 'dzin pa gsal bar 'gyur ba rig pa yin na /
translated: then it is reasonable that the apprehension of that is clear.

original: rang rig pa'i phyogs la'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i phyogs la'o //
translated: This is the position of autocognition.

original: goms par byed pa ci 'dra ba zhig yin /
analyzed: goms par byed pa ci 'dra ba zhig yin /
translated: What is the nature of the cultivation of that?üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / gal te rig pa skye na ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gal te rig pa skye na ni //
translated: If cognition arises,üîΩwhat is the cultivation of that?

original: de la bsgom pa ci 'dra zhig / rig pa ma skyes she na yang //
analyzed: de la bsgom pa ci 'dra zhig / rig pa ma skyes she na yang //
translated: If cognition does not arise,üîΩwhat is the cultivation of that?

original: de la bsgom pa ci 'dra zhig / gzhan dang gzhan pa'i bde ba rig pa skye ba'i phyir goms par rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la bsgom pa ci 'dra zhig / gzhan dang gzhan pa'i bde ba rig pa skye ba'i phyir goms par rig pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the arising of cognition is the experience of pleasure and so on, it is not known through cultivation.

original: gal te yang dang yang du de nyid dmigs pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te yang dang yang du de nyid dmigs pa de'i tshe /
translated: If it is said that when that very object is observed again and again,

original: goms par tha snyad byed pa yin no //
analyzed: goms par tha snyad byed pa yin no //
translated: then the convention of cultivation is made.

original: don gcig nyid yin pas de la rnam par shes pa gzhan dang gzhan gyis myong ba na goms par rig pa @289b yin no zhe na gal te bde ba yang ci'i phyir gcig ma yin la /
analyzed: don gcig nyid yin pas de la rnam par shes pa gzhan dang gzhan gyis myong ba na goms par rig pa @289b yin no zhe na gal te bde ba yang ci'i phyir gcig ma yin la /
translated: If it is said that since the object is the same, when it is experienced by another cognition, it is known through cultivation, then if pleasure is also the same, why is it not the same?

original: yang nas yang gi don ci yin //
analyzed: yang nas yang gi don ci yin //
translated: What is the meaning of again and again?

original: don ni gcig yin yang /
analyzed: don ni gcig yin yang /
translated: Although the object is the same,

original: yang nas yang gi don nyams su myong ba 'jug pas byas pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yang nas yang gi don nyams su myong ba 'jug pas byas pa yin no zhe na /
translated: The word again is used because the experience of the object is repeated.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.

original: gal te shes pa tha dad na //
analyzed: gal te shes pa tha dad na //
translated: If the cognitions are different,üîΩhow can one object be cognized?

original: yul gcig yin pa ga la rtog / gal te ngo shes las shen //
analyzed: yul gcig yin pa ga la rtog / gal te ngo shes las shen //
translated: If recognition is from memory,

original: bde sogs la 'di med dam ci //
analyzed: bde sogs la 'di med dam ci //
translated: is there no memory of pleasure, etc.?

original: gal te bde ba gcig ma yin pas de ltar ngo shes par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te bde ba gcig ma yin pas de ltar ngo shes par 'gyur /
translated: If you say that it is not one pleasure, but that it is recognized as such,

original: yul la ni shes pa tha dad kyang de gcig pa'i phyir rig pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yul la ni shes pa tha dad kyang de gcig pa'i phyir rig pa yin no zhe na /
translated: then although the cognitions of the object are different, they are known to be one because the object is one.

original: ngo shes pa ni yul las byung ba can ma yin te /
analyzed: ngo shes pa ni yul las byung ba can ma yin te /
translated: Recognition does not arise from the object,

original: 'on kyang dmigs pa las byung ba can yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang dmigs pa las byung ba can yin no //
translated: but from the object of memory.

original: shes pa tha dad pa la ni gcig pa'i dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa tha dad pa la ni gcig pa'i dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: And the different cognitions do not have the same object.

original: shes pa la yang ngo shes par ci ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: shes pa la yang ngo shes par ci ltar 'gyur //
translated: How can there be recognition of the cognition?

original: de la don dam par ni ngo shes pa med do //
analyzed: de la don dam par ni ngo shes pa med do //
translated: In reality there is no recognition.

original: don gcig pas na de gcig tu sgro btags nas shes pa gcig pa zhes tha snyad du byed do zhe na /
analyzed: don gcig pas na de gcig tu sgro btags nas shes pa gcig pa zhes tha snyad du byed do zhe na /
translated: But because of the identity of the object, one imputes identity of the cognition and conventionally says one cognition.

original: 'dir dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir dpyad par bya ste /
translated: Here we must investigate.

original: ci 'di shes pa rang rig pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs brjod dam /
analyzed: ci 'di shes pa rang rig pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs brjod dam /
translated: Is this position called ‚Äúself-awareness of consciousness‚Äù

original: 'on te shes pa gzhan gyis rig par bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'on te shes pa gzhan gyis rig par bya ba'am /
translated: or is it that which is cognized by another consciousness,

original: 'on te don gyis go bas rig par bya ba yin /
analyzed: 'on te don gyis go bas rig par bya ba yin /
translated: or is it that which is cognized by understanding the meaning?

original: de las cir 'gyur /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur /
translated: What follows from that?

original: gal te rang rig la brten nas //
analyzed: gal te rang rig la brten nas //
translated: If it is based on self-awareness,

original: ci ltar ngo shes 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: ci ltar ngo shes 'gyur ba yin //
translated: how does it become recognition?

original: tha dad mthong la de nyid kyi tshe na gcig tu 'khrul pa ma yin /
analyzed: tha dad mthong la de nyid kyi tshe na gcig tu 'khrul pa ma yin /
translated: When different things are seen, they are not confused as one.

original: rang rig pa'i phyogs yongs su gsal bar tha dad par rig pa la /
analyzed: rang rig pa'i phyogs yongs su gsal bar tha dad par rig pa la /
translated: In the position of self-awareness, it is clearly known as different.

original: ci ltar yul tha dad pa dag kyang de nyid kyi tshe /
analyzed: ci ltar yul tha dad pa dag kyang de nyid kyi tshe /
translated: How is it that different objects are confused as one?

original: des byas pa'i rnam pa 'khrul par 'gyur /
analyzed: des byas pa'i rnam pa 'khrul par 'gyur /
translated: The aspect produced by that becomes confused.

original: shes pa gzhan gyis rig pa la yang 'di mtshungs so //
analyzed: shes pa gzhan gyis rig pa la yang 'di mtshungs so //
translated: This is the same for cognition by another consciousness.

original: don gyis go bas rig pa la ni don dang rjes su mthun par shes pa rtog pa yin te /
analyzed: don gyis go bas rig pa la ni don dang rjes su mthun par shes pa rtog pa yin te /
translated: In cognition by understanding the meaning, the cognition is conceptual in accordance with the meaning.

original: des na shes pa yang tha dad pa med pa nyid du brtag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na shes pa yang tha dad pa med pa nyid du brtag par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, cognition should be investigated as not being different.

original: de lta ma yin na mi 'thad pa'i phyir don gyis go ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mi 'thad pa'i phyir don gyis go ba yin no //
translated: If it were not so, it would be untenable.

original: don gyi rig pa tsam nyid ni //
analyzed: don gyi rig pa tsam nyid ni //
translated: The mere cognition of the object

original: rig pa tsam du 'jog pa yin //
analyzed: rig pa tsam du 'jog pa yin //
translated: is posited as mere cognition.üîΩThe same object is not grasped by many,

original: don gcig nyid ni du ma yis //üîΩgzung ba min phyir gcig tu brtag / dus gzhan dang gzhan du 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa du ma rang gi dus kyi don yongs su gdod pas ni snga ma dang phyi mar 'byung ba'i don gcig yin no zhes rtogs par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don gcig nyid ni du ma yis // gzung ba min phyir gcig tu brtag / dus gzhan dang gzhan du 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa du ma rang gi dus kyi don yongs su gdod pas ni snga ma dang phyi mar 'byung ba'i don gcig yin no zhes rtogs par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: so it is imagined to be one.

original: gcig gis byed pa med pa'i phyir dang / tshogs pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig gis byed pa med pa'i phyir dang / tshogs pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Many consciousnesses arising at different times cannot cognize the same object at their own time, because one cannot perform the function of another, and because there is no collection.

original: bdag gcig de ni mtshams sbyor can //
analyzed: bdag gcig de ni mtshams sbyor can //
translated: That one self is connected

original: de la dran pa yod phyir te /
analyzed: de la dran pa yod phyir te /
translated: because there is memory of it.

original: 'di yi nus pa dran pa dang // @290a * //
analyzed: 'di yi nus pa dran pa dang // @290a * //
translated: The capacity for memory

original: mtshams sbyor ba la'ang yod pa yin //
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba la'ang yod pa yin //
translated: also exists in the connection.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: bdag ni rtog pa'i rang bzhin la /
analyzed: bdag ni rtog pa'i rang bzhin la /
translated: The self has the nature of imagination,

original: 'di ni rigs ldan min par mthong //
analyzed: 'di ni rigs ldan min par mthong //
translated: but this is not seen to be of the same type.

original: gcig bu yi ni rang bzhin 'di //
analyzed: gcig bu yi ni rang bzhin 'di //
translated: This nature of the one

original: zlog pa tshad ldan ci ltar yin //
analyzed: zlog pa tshad ldan ci ltar yin //
translated: How could a valid cognition be reversed?

original: bdag tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i phyogs la skyon 'di med do zhe na /
analyzed: bdag tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i phyogs la skyon 'di med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that this fault does not apply to the position that the self is neither different nor not different,

original: rang bzhin gang gis tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin des ni ngo shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gang gis tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin des ni ngo shes pa ma yin no //
translated: then by whatever intrinsic reality it is not different, by that intrinsic reality it is not recognized.

original: sna tshogs kyi dbye bas tha dad pa'i phyir shes pa tha dad pa ni de dang tha mi dad pa'i tha dad pa nyid do //
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi dbye bas tha dad pa'i phyir shes pa tha dad pa ni de dang tha mi dad pa'i tha dad pa nyid do //
translated: Because of the differentiation of the various aspects, the difference of consciousness is the difference of that which is not different from it.

original: rang bzhin gang gis shes pa las tha dad pa'i rang bzhin des ni gcig nyid yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gang gis shes pa las tha dad pa'i rang bzhin des ni gcig nyid yin te /
translated: By whatever intrinsic reality it is different from consciousness, by that intrinsic reality it is one.

original: des na zlos pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na zlos pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore there is no repetition.

original: 'on te bdag rtogs pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin yin na /
analyzed: 'on te bdag rtogs pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin yin na /
translated: But if the self is not the intrinsic reality of the realization,

original: de'i tshe de shes pas rtogs par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i tshe de shes pas rtogs par byed pa yin la /
translated: then it is realized by the consciousness.

original: de'ang tha dad pa'i phyir ci ltar des tha mi dad pa 'dzin pa yin na /
analyzed: de'ang tha dad pa'i phyir ci ltar des tha mi dad pa 'dzin pa yin na /
translated: And since that is different, how could it be apprehended as not different from it?

original: de'i phyir shes pa tha dad na gcig nyid 'dzin par mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa tha dad na gcig nyid 'dzin par mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because it is not tenable that one is apprehended when consciousness is different,

original: don gyis go bas shes pa gcig nyid du brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: don gyis go bas shes pa gcig nyid du brtag par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the cognition should be investigated as being one.

original: 'o na don gyis go bas shes pa tha dad pa 'dzin pa de lta na yang shes pa gcig tu mi rtogs pa des na ci ltar ngo shes pa yin /üîΩ'on te du ma 'phrigs pa ngo shes pa yin /
analyzed: 'o na don gyis go bas shes pa tha dad pa 'dzin pa de lta na yang shes pa gcig tu mi rtogs pa des na ci ltar ngo shes pa yin / 'on te du ma 'phrigs pa ngo shes pa yin /
translated: But if the cognition is apprehended as different by the cognition of the object, then it is not cognized as one. How then is there recognition?üîΩOr, if the cognition is apprehended as one by the cognition of the object, then how is there recognition of the many?

original: 'on te du ma 'phrigs pa ngo shes pa yin na /
analyzed: 'on te du ma 'phrigs pa ngo shes pa yin na /
translated: If it is the many that is recognized,

original: de lta yin na bde ba la sogs pa yang yin pas de'i phyir gcig nyid kun rdzob tu yod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de lta yin na bde ba la sogs pa yang yin pas de'i phyir gcig nyid kun rdzob tu yod pa'i phyir //
translated: then pleasure, etc., would also be recognized. Therefore, because the one exists conventionally,

original: de nyid la yang nas yang du goms par byed pas bde ba la sogs pa'i gsal ba la sogs pa'i khyad par ni goms pa las 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid la yang nas yang du goms par byed pas bde ba la sogs pa'i gsal ba la sogs pa'i khyad par ni goms pa las 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: the distinctions of pleasure, etc., are due to the development of habit.

original: goms pa las skyes pa'i bde ba la sogs pa yang rtogs pa'i rang bzhin bdag nyid do //
analyzed: goms pa las skyes pa'i bde ba la sogs pa yang rtogs pa'i rang bzhin bdag nyid do //
translated: And the pleasure, etc., that arise from habit are of the nature of the cognition.

original: goms pa las 'gro ba la sogs pa yang bsgyings pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: goms pa las 'gro ba la sogs pa yang bsgyings pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: But is it not the case that going, etc., are transformed into the nature of stretching out the foot, etc., by the development of habit?

original: de dag ni blo'i rang bzhin yang ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de dag ni blo'i rang bzhin yang ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But they are not the nature of cognition.

original: 'di smras pa /
analyzed: 'di smras pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: rtogs min rang bzhin goms pa las //
analyzed: rtogs min rang bzhin goms pa las //
translated: From the cultivation of what is not a realization,

original: rtogs pa ma yin nyid 'byung 'gyur //
analyzed: rtogs pa ma yin nyid 'byung 'gyur //
translated: What is not a realization arises.

original: de bzhin rtogs pa'i rang bzhin ni //
analyzed: de bzhin rtogs pa'i rang bzhin ni //
translated: In the same way, why wouldn‚Äôt the nature of a realization

original: goms pas ci'i phyir rtogs dngos min //
analyzed: goms pas ci'i phyir rtogs dngos min //
translated: Become a nonrealization through cultivation?

original: shes rab la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab la sogs pa yin no //
translated: It would be like wisdom and so on.

original: ci ste yang rtogs pa'i rang bzhin goms pa zhes bya ba ci rang rig goms pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci ste yang rtogs pa'i rang bzhin goms pa zhes bya ba ci rang rig goms pa yin nam /
translated: If you say that the nature of a realization is cultivated, is it the cultivation of reflexive awareness?

original: 'on te rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis bzung ba'i don goms pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis bzung ba'i don goms pa yin /
translated: Or is it the cultivation of the object apprehended by the nature of a realization?

original: gal te rang rig goms pa yin na rang rig de ni ma grub bo //
analyzed: gal te rang rig goms pa yin na rang rig de ni ma grub bo //
translated: If it is the cultivation of reflexive awareness, that reflexive awareness is not established.

original: 'on te phyogs gnyis pa yin na /
analyzed: 'on te phyogs gnyis pa yin na /
translated: If it is the second possibility,

original: de ma nges pa nyid srid pas mi 'thad pa nyid de /
analyzed: de ma nges pa nyid srid pas mi 'thad pa nyid de /
translated: since it is possible that it is not ascertained, it is untenable.

original: rtogs @290b pa'i rang bzhin gyis bzung ba'i 'gro ba la sogs pa goms kyang 'gro ba la sogs pa rtogs pa'i rang bzhi nyid du dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhen /
analyzed: rtogs @290b pa'i rang bzhin gyis bzung ba'i 'gro ba la sogs pa goms kyang 'gro ba la sogs pa rtogs pa'i rang bzhi nyid du dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhen /
translated: Even if one cultivates the object of going and so on that is apprehended by the nature of a realization, since the nature of a realization that apprehends going and so on is not observed, it is not a realization.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gang zhig ci 'dra goms 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang zhig ci 'dra goms 'gyur ba //
translated: Whatever one is habituated to,

original: de ni de bzhin nyid 'gyur te //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin nyid 'gyur te //
translated: that one becomes by practice.

original: bde sogs nang gi myong ba ni //
analyzed: bde sogs nang gi myong ba ni //
translated: The experience of pleasure, etc.

original: goms pa'i 'bras bu de bzhin nyid ;
analyzed: goms pa'i 'bras bu de bzhin nyid ;
translated: is the result of habituation.

original: / bde ba la sogs pa ni nang gi myong ba'i rang bzhin du dmigs so //
analyzed: / bde ba la sogs pa ni nang gi myong ba'i rang bzhin du dmigs so //
translated: The experience of pleasure, etc. is observed to be of the nature of internal experience.

original: bems po'i rang bzhin yin yang don gcig la 'du bas de ltar dmigs so zhes bya ba 'di yang rigs pa la brten pa'i dga' ba thob pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bems po'i rang bzhin yin yang don gcig la 'du bas de ltar dmigs so zhes bya ba 'di yang rigs pa la brten pa'i dga' ba thob pa ma yin no //
translated: Even though the nature of the object is insentient, it is observed to be of the nature of experience because of the convergence of the three. This is not the attainment of pleasure based on reason.

original: des na rang rig pa nyid goms par byad pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: des na rang rig pa nyid goms par byad pa de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because of the practice of self-awareness,

original: goms pa rab tu gyur ba ni de lta bur gyur pa nyid skye'o //
analyzed: goms pa rab tu gyur ba ni de lta bur gyur pa nyid skye'o //
translated: the transformation of habituation is the arising of that very nature.

original: 'o na dang po ni rang rig pa med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na dang po ni rang rig pa med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But then, at first, there would be no self-awareness, one might object.

original: rigs gang ga las zhes bya bas de yang de lta bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs gang ga las zhes bya bas de yang de lta bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But that is so because of the lineage, as stated.

original: de'i bsgoms pa'i stobs las skyes pa ni shes rab la sogs pa bzhin du myong ba'i ngo bo nyid do zhes gnas so //
analyzed: de'i bsgoms pa'i stobs las skyes pa ni shes rab la sogs pa bzhin du myong ba'i ngo bo nyid do zhes gnas so //
translated: What arises from the power of meditation has the nature of experience, like wisdom, etc. This is the established position.

original: 'dis ni / de dang de min rang bzhin dngos //
analyzed: 'dis ni / de dang de min rang bzhin dngos //
translated: This also refutes the following argument:üîΩThe nature of that which is and is not that

original: de dang de min dngos rgyus bskyed //
analyzed: de dang de min dngos rgyus bskyed //
translated: is produced by a cause that is and is not that.

original: rnam shes rgyu las gzhan min skyes //
analyzed: rnam shes rgyu las gzhan min skyes //
translated: Consciousness is produced from a cause that is not other.

original: gzugs sogs de cis shes ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba de yang spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs sogs de cis shes ma yin // zhes bya ba de yang spangs pa yin no //
translated: Why is it not known that form and so on are the same?

original: 'di'i don ni 'di yin te //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni 'di yin te //
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: mig dang yid la byed pa dang // mdun na gnas pa'i shing rta la sogs pa'i tshogs pa mtshungs pa can dag phan tshun lhan cig byed pa nyid kyis skyed pa na thams cad rtogs pa'i rang bzhin nam rtog pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig dang yid la byed pa dang // mdun na gnas pa'i shing rta la sogs pa'i tshogs pa mtshungs pa can dag phan tshun lhan cig byed pa nyid kyis skyed pa na thams cad rtogs pa'i rang bzhin nam rtog pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: When the eye, mental activity, and the collection of chariot parts such as wheels that are present in front are produced by the mutual simultaneity of their activity, all are either by nature cognition or by nature noncognition.

original: de la gtso bo dang cig shos kyi rnam par dbye ba ni 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de la gtso bo dang cig shos kyi rnam par dbye ba ni 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: In that case, there is no distinction whatsoever between the primary and secondary.

original: rtogs pa dang rtogs pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'bras bu la nus pa mthong ba can gyi gzugs la sogs pa'i tshogs pa de ni gzhan du bsgrub par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa dang rtogs pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'bras bu la nus pa mthong ba can gyi gzugs la sogs pa'i tshogs pa de ni gzhan du bsgrub par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: That collection of form and so on, which is seen to have the capacity to produce a result that is either cognition or noncognition, cannot be established as anything else.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de nyid kyis ma nges so zhes na ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de nyid kyis ma nges so zhes na ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not indeterminate.

original: gtan tshigs kyi don gzhan du brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩci ltar bsgom pa 'phel ba las //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don gzhan du brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro // ci ltar bsgom pa 'phel ba las //
translated: Because the meaning of the reason is stated in another way.üîΩJust as the four, wisdom, etc.,

original: skyes pa'i shes rab la sogs bzhin //
analyzed: skyes pa'i shes rab la sogs bzhin //
translated: arise from the increase of meditation,

original: bde ba la sogs rgyu de las //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs rgyu de las //
translated: so, from the cause of pleasure, etc.,

original: de ltar rang rig cis ma yin //
analyzed: de ltar rang rig cis ma yin //
translated: why is there not self-awareness?

original: gang ci ltar goms pa de lta bu nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba tshad ma'i don to //
analyzed: gang ci ltar goms pa de lta bu nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba tshad ma'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúvalid cognition‚Äù is that whatever is cultivated becomes just that.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dag ni rang gi rang bzhin du goms par mi srid do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dag ni rang gi rang bzhin du goms par mi srid do //
translated: It is not possible to cultivate form, etc., as one‚Äôs own nature.

original: re zhig shes rab la sogs pa'i khyad par don gyis go @291a * //
analyzed: re zhig shes rab la sogs pa'i khyad par don gyis go @291a * //
translated: First, the difference in wisdom, etc. is understood by implication.

original: bas rtogs par bya ba yin pa des de bdag dang 'du ba yin no zhes ci ltar rtogs par bya /
analyzed: bas rtogs par bya ba yin pa des de bdag dang 'du ba yin no zhes ci ltar rtogs par bya /
translated: How can it be understood that ‚Äúit is united with the self‚Äù?

original: don gyis go bas ni gang med par gang mi 'thad pa de rtogs pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: don gyis go bas ni gang med par gang mi 'thad pa de rtogs pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: By implication, it is only understood that what is not tenable without something else is understood.

original: bdag dang 'du ba can dang / rtogs pa'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir mi 'thad pa cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: bdag dang 'du ba can dang / rtogs pa'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir mi 'thad pa cung zad kyang med do //
translated: because the self, the possessor of the aggregates, and the nature of the realization are not tenable in the least.

original: 'on kyang gang gi phyir don lkog tu gyur pa ma yin par 'gyur ba gzhan 'ga' zhig kyang yod dgos so zhes bya ba tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang gang gi phyir don lkog tu gyur pa ma yin par 'gyur ba gzhan 'ga' zhig kyang yod dgos so zhes bya ba tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: However, it is only necessary to say that it is not the case that the object is hidden, and that there must be some other [means of knowledge].

original: des na ci ltar bdag dang 'du ba can la sogs par rtogs /
analyzed: des na ci ltar bdag dang 'du ba can la sogs par rtogs /
translated: Therefore, how is it imagined to be the self, the possessor of the aggregates, and so on?

original: de'i phyir gang gis nang nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ba bdag gis 'di ltar rtogs so zhes skye bos rtogs pa nang nyid du goms par byas pa yin no zhes bya ba lan yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gis nang nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ba bdag gis 'di ltar rtogs so zhes skye bos rtogs pa nang nyid du goms par byas pa yin no zhes bya ba lan yin no //
translated: Thus, the response is that the person has cultivated familiarity with the mere internal cognition, thinking, ‚ÄúI realize it in this way.‚Äù

original: gang dag blo blo gzhan gyi mngon sum yin par smra ba de dag gi ltar na yang /
analyzed: gang dag blo blo gzhan gyi mngon sum yin par smra ba de dag gi ltar na yang /
translated: Even for those who say that the mind is the direct perception of another mind,

original: de bdag dang 'du ba can dang rtogs pa'i rang bzhin du snang ngo zhes gdon mi za bar khas blangs te /
analyzed: de bdag dang 'du ba can dang rtogs pa'i rang bzhin du snang ngo zhes gdon mi za bar khas blangs te /
translated: it is undoubtedly accepted that it appears as the self, the possessor of the aggregates, and the nature of the realization.

original: de lta ma yin na don gzhan tsam kho nar 'gyur gyi 'dzin par byed pa nyid du ni mi 'grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na don gzhan tsam kho nar 'gyur gyi 'dzin par byed pa nyid du ni mi 'grub pa kho na'o //
translated: Otherwise, it would be merely another object, and it would not be established as the apprehender.

original: de'i phyir 'di mngon sum gzhan la de la gnas pa 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin du snang ba'i yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di mngon sum gzhan la de la gnas pa 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin du snang ba'i yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is the direct perception of another, which appears as the nature of the apprehension of that.

original: de lta yin dang de la yang don de snang bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de lta yin dang de la yang don de snang bar 'gyur na /
translated: If that were so, then that would also appear as the object.

original: zhig pa ci snang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: zhig pa ci snang bar 'gyur /
translated: But how could the past appear?

original: blo 'ba' zhig snang na 'dzin par byed pa por ci ltar snang /
analyzed: blo 'ba' zhig snang na 'dzin par byed pa por ci ltar snang /
translated: If only the cognition appears, how could it appear as the apprehender?

original: bdag la sogs pa yang de bzhin no zhes bshad ba na /üîΩbdag dang 'du ba nyid dam /
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa yang de bzhin no zhes bshad ba na / bdag dang 'du ba nyid dam /
translated: The self and so on are also like that.üîΩThe response is that the self is superimposed as the appropriator of the aggregates,

original: de'i bdag nyid sgro 'dogs pa thog ma med pa'i dus can skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid sgro 'dogs pa thog ma med pa'i dus can skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lan du 'gyur ro //
translated: or as their nature, and this has been occurring since beginningless time.

original: de lta yin dang dus de lta bu nyid du go mas pa'i stobs las skyes pa'i shes rab la sogs pa'am bde ba la sogs pa'i yang rtogs pa'i rang bzhin kho na'o //
analyzed: de lta yin dang dus de lta bu nyid du go mas pa'i stobs las skyes pa'i shes rab la sogs pa'am bde ba la sogs pa'i yang rtogs pa'i rang bzhin kho na'o //
translated: If that were so, then the cognition of the present time would also be of the nature of memory, or of wisdom born from the power of hearing and so on, or of pleasure and so forth.

original: gal te de lta na'ang gzhan dag blo la sogs pa myong ba'i rang bzhin du khas mi len pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na'ang gzhan dag blo la sogs pa myong ba'i rang bzhin du khas mi len pa ma yin nam zhe na /
