translated: But, in that case, do not others also not accept that the mind, etc. are of the nature of experience?

original: gal te myong ba ma yin na mngon sum nyid dang nang nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: gal te myong ba ma yin na mngon sum nyid dang nang nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan zin to //
translated: If they are not experience, they are not direct perception and not internal.

original: rang rig pa yin na ni de lta bur gyur pa'i bdag nyid dang / don yang gsal bar byed pa'i gsal ba de yong pa yin pas 'di nyid rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: rang rig pa yin na ni de lta bur gyur pa'i bdag nyid dang / don yang gsal bar byed pa'i gsal ba de yong pa yin pas 'di nyid rigs pa yin no //
translated: But if they are self-knowing, then the object is the manifestation of such a nature, and the manifestation is the manifestation of the object. Therefore, this is reasonable.

original: ci ste bde ba la sogs pa goms pa'i stobs las skye ba can yin yang bdag dang 'du ba can kho na yin pas don gcig la 'du ba can gyi rnam par shes pas gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: ci ste bde ba la sogs pa goms pa'i stobs las skye ba can yin yang bdag dang 'du ba can kho na yin pas don gcig la 'du ba can gyi rnam par shes pas gzung ba yin no //
translated: But if pleasure, etc. are born from the power of habit, they are only associated with the self, and the consciousness associated with the same object is grasped.

original: des na @291b rtogs pa dang 'dres pa nyid kyis rtogs pa'i rang bzhin du snang gi rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas ni ma yin no zhes de ltar ci ste mi rtag ce na /
analyzed: des na @291b rtogs pa dang 'dres pa nyid kyis rtogs pa'i rang bzhin du snang gi rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas ni ma yin no zhes de ltar ci ste mi rtag ce na /
translated: Therefore, because it is mixed with the realization, it appears as the nature of realization, but it is not the nature of realization. Why is this not so?

original: 'di la brjod pa /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa /
translated: To this, we reply:

original: thog med goms pa'i ngo bo las //
analyzed: thog med goms pa'i ngo bo las //
translated: The nature of things is what it is,

original: 'di ni de ltar yin zhes gnas //üîΩde las tshul gzhan rnam rtog ni //
analyzed: 'di ni de ltar yin zhes gnas // de las tshul gzhan rnam rtog ni //
translated: because of beginningless habituation.

original: 'jig rten gyis ni nges pa med //üîΩbsgoms pa'i stobs las de ltar skyes so zhes rtogs pa'i gang yin pa de la 'di ni 'di dang 'di lta bu yin no zhes lugs gzhan 'jig rten la skye ba 'di mi thob bo //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyis ni nges pa med // bsgoms pa'i stobs las de ltar skyes so zhes rtogs pa'i gang yin pa de la 'di ni 'di dang 'di lta bu yin no zhes lugs gzhan 'jig rten la skye ba 'di mi thob bo //
translated: The world does not know any other way,üîΩbecause it is not capable of conceiving another.üîΩThe world does not know any other way of seeing things, because it is not capable of conceiving another way of seeing things.

original: 'on kyang 'di ci ltar bsgoms pa'i stobs las mthong ba de ni de kho na ltar yin no zhes tha snyad du byed do //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di ci ltar bsgoms pa'i stobs las mthong ba de ni de kho na ltar yin no zhes tha snyad du byed do //
translated: The world does not know any other way of seeing things, because it is not capable of conceiving another way of seeing things.

original: don gcig la 'du bar brtags pa la dgos pa yang ci zhig yod /
analyzed: don gcig la 'du bar brtags pa la dgos pa yang ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the point of imagining that many things are one?

original: gal te bdag la 'du bar mi 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te bdag la 'du bar mi 'dod na /
translated: If you do not accept that the self is one with the aggregates,

original: 'o na bde ba de su'i yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na bde ba de su'i yin zhe na /
translated: whose is this pleasure?

original: de lta na 'o na gal te de gzhan du 'du bar mi 'dod na bdag de su'i yin /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na gal te de gzhan du 'du bar mi 'dod na bdag de su'i yin /
translated: If you do not accept that the self is one with the aggregates, whose is this pleasure?üîΩThe self is not dependent on another,

original: bdag ni rang dbang rtag pa'i phyir //üîΩgzhan la ci ltar der rag las //
analyzed: bdag ni rang dbang rtag pa'i phyir //üîΩgzhan la ci ltar der rag las //
translated: because it is independent and permanent.

original: bde sogs rnams ni mi rtag pas //
analyzed: bde sogs rnams ni mi rtag pas //
translated: Pleasure, etc. are impermanent,üîΩand it is ascertained that they depend on another.

original: gzhan la rag las yin par rtog / bdag ni rtag pas na rang dbang yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan la rag las yin par rtog / bdag ni rtag pas na rang dbang yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But the self is permanent, and because it is independent,üîΩit is tenable that it does not depend on another.

original: mi brten par 'thad pas de ltar 'thad kyi bde ba la sogs pa ni yon tan dang mi rtag pa yin te /
analyzed: mi brten par 'thad pas de ltar 'thad kyi bde ba la sogs pa ni yon tan dang mi rtag pa yin te /
translated: But pleasure, etc. are qualities and are impermanent.

original: de'i phyir de dag ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ni /
translated: Therefore,üîΩit is definitely necessary that they depend on another.

original: gdon mi za bar brten pa nyid du 'gyur dgos so zhe na de ni mi bzang ste /üîΩ'di ltar / rten yod na ni yon tan yin //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar brten pa nyid du 'gyur dgos so zhe na de ni mi bzang ste / 'di ltar / rten yod na ni yon tan yin //
translated: That is not good, becauseüîΩif there is a basis, it is a quality.

original: yon tan yod na'ang rten gnas te //
analyzed: yon tan yod na'ang rten gnas te //
translated: If there is a quality, the basis exists.

original: de ltar phan tshun brten pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de ltar phan tshun brten pa'i phyir //
translated: Thus, because they mutually depend,

original: gcig kyang rnam bar gnas mi 'gyur //üîΩgal te dang po yon tan nyid //
analyzed: gcig kyang rnam bar gnas mi 'gyur // gal te dang po yon tan nyid //
translated: neither can exist individually.üîΩIf a quality were established

original: grub na de'i tshe yon tan brten pa yin par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i rtog pa 'jug pa zhig na /
analyzed: grub na de'i tshe yon tan brten pa yin par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i rtog pa 'jug pa zhig na /
translated: first, then the thought ‚Äúit depends on a quality‚Äù would occur.

original: de ni ma grub ste /
analyzed: de ni ma grub ste /
translated: But that is not established,

original: grub pa ni gzhan la brten pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grub pa ni gzhan la brten pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which is established depends on another.

original: rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ni 'ga' yang med do zhes 'di ni bstan zin to //
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ni 'ga' yang med do zhes 'di ni bstan zin to //
translated: We have already shown that there is no such thing as a real entity that is a support or something supported.

original: gzhan yang bdag ni rang dbang yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag ni rang dbang yin te /
translated: Moreover, the self is independent,

original: rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is permanent.

original: bde ba la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But pleasure, etc., are not,

original: bzlog pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa /üîΩmi rtag na yang rgyu las ni //
analyzed: bzlog pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa / mi rtag na yang rgyu las ni //
translated: because they are the opposite.üîΩEven if impermanent,

original: skyes pa'i phyir na ltos pa med //
analyzed: skyes pa'i phyir na ltos pa med //
translated: it is not dependent, because it arises from a cause.

original: de la bya rgyu med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de la bya rgyu med pa'i phyir //
translated: Since it has no activity,

original: gzhan la ji ltar rag las 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan la ji ltar rag las 'gyur //
translated: how can it be dependent on another?

original: gal te ma skyes pa nyid yin na de ci ltar gzhan la rag las /
analyzed: gal te ma skyes pa nyid yin na de ci ltar gzhan la rag las /
translated: If it is unarisen, how can it be dependent on another?

original: 'on te rgyu 'ga' zhig las skyes na de lta na yang de gzhan la rag las pa ci yod /üîΩrang gi 'bras bu skyed pa la gzhan la rag las so zhe na de'i rang gi @292a * //
analyzed: 'on te rgyu 'ga' zhig las skyes na de lta na yang de gzhan la rag las pa ci yod / rang gi 'bras bu skyed pa la gzhan la rag las so zhe na de'i rang gi @292a * //
translated: But if it is arisen from some cause, then how can it be dependent on another?

original: 'bras bu bskyed pa ni rang gi rgyu nyid las yin pa'i phyir gzhan la rag las pa nyid du mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'bras bu bskyed pa ni rang gi rgyu nyid las yin pa'i phyir gzhan la rag las pa nyid du mi 'thad de /
translated: If you say that it is dependent on another in order to generate its own effect, that is not tenable, because its own effect is generated from its own cause.

original: spros pas chog go //
analyzed: spros pas chog go //
translated: Enough of this pointless elaboration!

original: de'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa nyid rang dbang yin la rag mod /
analyzed: de'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa nyid rang dbang yin la rag mod /
translated: Therefore, it is indeed the case that pleasure and so on are independent.

original: rten bdag brtags pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: rten bdag brtags pas ci zhig bya /
translated: What purpose is served by positing a self as their basis?

original: bde ba la sogs pa rang rig pa ma yin na /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa rang rig pa ma yin na /
translated: If pleasure and so on are not self-awareness,

original: phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid du yang ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid du yang ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: how could they be beneficial?

original: don gcig la 'du ba can gyi rnam par shes pas myong bar 'gyur ro zhe na 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: don gcig la 'du ba can gyi rnam par shes pas myong bar 'gyur ro zhe na 'dir smras pa /
translated: If you say that they are experienced by consciousness that is associated with a single object, then we reply:

original: ci don gcig la 'du ba can gyi dbang po las skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa rig gam /
analyzed: ci don gcig la 'du ba can gyi dbang po las skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa rig gam /
translated: Is consciousness that is produced from a sense faculty that is associated with a single object a consciousness of that object?

original: 'on te gzhan gyis /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyis /
translated: Or is it another?

original: re zhig dbang po'i rnam par shes pas ni ma yin te ;
analyzed: re zhig dbang po'i rnam par shes pas ni ma yin te ;
translated: First, it is not a sense consciousness.üîΩIn this way:

original: 'di ltar / don gang nye bas blo dang ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / don gang nye bas blo dang ni //
translated: The mind that is generated

original: bde sogs de dag skyes gyur pa //üîΩde bor nas ni bde sogs nyid //
analyzed: bde sogs de dag skyes gyur pa // de bor nas ni bde sogs nyid //
translated: by the object such as pleasure and so onüîΩis generated in dependence on that object.üîΩHow could it cognize pleasure and so on

original: des ni ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: des ni ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: after it has abandoned that object?

original: mig la sogs pas gzugs la sogs pa la sbyar ba /
analyzed: mig la sogs pas gzugs la sogs pa la sbyar ba /
translated: The eye and so on are applied to form and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par phyogs pa dbang po'i blo gang yin pa de nyid ci ltar bde ba la sogs pa kho nar rtogs pa yin /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la mngon par phyogs pa dbang po'i blo gang yin pa de nyid ci ltar bde ba la sogs pa kho nar rtogs pa yin /
translated: The cognition of the eye faculty, which is directed toward form, etc., is itself understood as pleasure, etc.

original: bdag gi mig bde ba la zhugs so snyam pa'i blo ni med do //
analyzed: bdag gi mig bde ba la zhugs so snyam pa'i blo ni med do //
translated: There is no cognition that thinks, ‚ÄúMy eye is engaged in pleasure.‚ÄùüîΩBut if the consciousness that apprehends pleasure is engaged in form, etc.,üîΩthen it would follow, absurdly, thatüîΩit would also be engaged in the eye, etc., that are the basis of that consciousness.

original: 'on te bde ba 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa gzugs nyid la zhugs pas 'jug par 'gyur na /üîΩde lta yin na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te bde ba 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa gzugs nyid la zhugs pas 'jug par 'gyur na / de lta yin na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin te /
translated: If you accept the original premise,üîΩthen it would follow, absurdly, that the eye, etc., would be the object of the eye, etc.üîΩIf you accept the original premise,üîΩthen it would follow, absurdly, that the eye, etc., would be the object of the eye, etc.üîΩIf you accept the original premise,üîΩthen it would follow, absurdly, that the eye, etc., would be the object of the eye, etc.üîΩIf you accept the original premise,üîΩthen it would follow, absurdly, that the eye, etc., would be the object of the eye, etc.üîΩIf you accept the original premise,üîΩthen it would follow, absurdly, that the eye, etc., would be the object of the eye, etc.üîΩIf you accept the original premise,üîΩthen it would follow, absurdly, that the eye, etc., would be the object of the eye, etc.üîΩIf you accept the original premise,

original: rjes su dpag pa yang mig la brten pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang mig la brten pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would follow, absurdly, that the eye, etc., would be the object of the eye, etc.üîΩIf you accept the original premise,üîΩthen it would follow, absurdly, that the eye, etc., would be the object of the eye, etc.üîΩIf you accept the original premise,

original: 'on te dbang po'i rnam par shes pa las 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam pa gzhan ma dmigs pa des na de nyid kyis yin par brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te dbang po'i rnam par shes pa las 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam pa gzhan ma dmigs pa des na de nyid kyis yin par brjod do zhe na /
translated: then it would follow, absurdly, that the eye, etc., would be the object of the eye, etc.üîΩIf you accept the original premise,üîΩthen it would follow, absurdly, that the eye, etc., would be the object of the eye, etc.üîΩIf you accept the original premise,üîΩthen it would follow, absurdly, that the eye, etc., would be the object of the eye, etc.üîΩIf you accept the original premise,

original: 'o na rnam par brtag par bya ba yang dus mtshungs pa'i dbang po'i shes pas gzung ba yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na rnam par brtag par bya ba yang dus mtshungs pa'i dbang po'i shes pas gzung ba yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would follow, absurdly, that the eye, etc., would be the object of the eye, etc.üîΩIf you accept the original premise,üîΩthen it would follow, absurdly, that the eye, etc., would be the object of the eye

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba la yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes kyang brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba la yang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes kyang brjod pa yin te /
translated: It is also said that it is an inference,

original: der 'dzin pa'i rnam pa gzhan dmigs pa ni med do //
analyzed: der 'dzin pa'i rnam pa gzhan dmigs pa ni med do //
translated: but there is no other aspect that apprehends it that is observed.

original: 'on te gzung ba'i rnam pa las de lta bu'i 'dzin pa rtog pa yin na rnam par brtag par bya ba'i sgra la yang 'di mtshungs so //
analyzed: 'on te gzung ba'i rnam pa las de lta bu'i 'dzin pa rtog pa yin na rnam par brtag par bya ba'i sgra la yang 'di mtshungs so //
translated: But if the thought is that the apprehender is like that because of the aspect of the object, then this is similar to the sound that is to be analyzed.

original: bde ba la sogs pa la yang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa ci ste mi rtag ce na /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa la yang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa ci ste mi rtag ce na /
translated: Why is there no thought of the apprehender in relation to pleasure, etc.?

original: gzung bar bya ba nyid du myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba nyid du myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not experienced as objects.

original: don gcig la 'du ba can yin yang 'dzin par byed pa gzhan gyis gzung ba'i phyir gzung ba nyid med pa yin no zhes brjod par ni mi nus so //
analyzed: don gcig la 'du ba can yin yang 'dzin par byed pa gzhan gyis gzung ba'i phyir gzung ba nyid med pa yin no zhes brjod par ni mi nus so //
translated: It cannot be said that they are not objects because they are apprehended by another apprehender, even though they are included in the same object.

original: gcig tu 'dres pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gcig tu 'dres pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because they are realized as mixed together as one.

original: 'o na ni de bdag gam /
analyzed: 'o na ni de bdag gam /
translated: But then they are not the self,üîΩpleasure,

original: @292b bde ba'am /üîΩblo 'ga' yang ma yin te /
analyzed: @292b bde ba'am / blo 'ga' yang ma yin te /
translated: or cognition,

original: gcig gi yang rang gi ngo bo ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig gi yang rang gi ngo bo ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of each is not apprehended.

original: bde ba'i rnam pa nyid 'ba' zhig myong ba yin no //
analyzed: bde ba'i rnam pa nyid 'ba' zhig myong ba yin no //
translated: It is only the aspect of pleasure that is experienced.

original: myong ba ma yin pa'i bde ba gzhan yang yod do zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: myong ba ma yin pa'i bde ba gzhan yang yod do zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that there is another pleasure that is not experienced, that is not so.

original: nye bar 'jog pa gzhan ma dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nye bar 'jog pa gzhan ma dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because another placement is not perceived.

original: shing la gong bu'i rnam par rtog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: shing la gong bu'i rnam par rtog pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the conception of a ball.

original: 'on te nye bar 'jog pa gzhan rjes su dpag pas bsgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te nye bar 'jog pa gzhan rjes su dpag pas bsgrub pa yin te /
translated: If you say that another placement is established by inference,

original: gang zhig rtogs pa de ni gzhan gyis nye bar gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig rtogs pa de ni gzhan gyis nye bar gzhag pa yin te /
translated: that which is understood is placed by another,

original: gong bu bzhin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gong bu bzhin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: like a ball. That is not so.

original: phyi rol gyi don med par thal pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don med par thal pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it would follow that external objects do not exist.

original: nye bar 'jog pa bag chags srid ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar 'jog pa bag chags srid ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because placement is possible as a latent impression.

original: de'i phyir gang zhig ci ltar rtogs pa de ni de kho na ltar khong du chud par bya ba yin gyi de rjes su dpag pas gzhan du gzhag par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zhig ci ltar rtogs pa de ni de kho na ltar khong du chud par bya ba yin gyi de rjes su dpag pas gzhan du gzhag par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that which is understood in a certain way should be understood in just that way. It should not be placed as something else by inference.

original: des na phyi rol gyi don rang gi ngo bos gzung bar bya ba nyid du rtogs pa ni de bzhin du rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: des na phyi rol gyi don rang gi ngo bos gzung bar bya ba nyid du rtogs pa ni de bzhin du rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the understanding that external objects are to be apprehended by their own entities is posited in the same way.

original: rnam par 'jog pa ni rtogs pa tsam la rag las pa yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: rnam par 'jog pa ni rtogs pa tsam la rag las pa yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: For positing is dependent on mere understanding.

original: / bde ba la sogs pa ni gzung bar bya ba nyid du ma dmigs te /
analyzed: / bde ba la sogs pa ni gzung bar bya ba nyid du ma dmigs te /
translated: Pleasure and so on are not observed to be apprehended as objects,

original: des na rang rig pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rang rig pa yin no //
translated: therefore they are self-knowing.

original: 'on te bdag dang yid 'brel pa tsam las skyes pa'i shes pa bde ba la sogs pa'i 'dzin par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on te bdag dang yid 'brel pa tsam las skyes pa'i shes pa bde ba la sogs pa'i 'dzin par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: But if it is said that consciousness arises merely in connection with the self and the mind, and it apprehends pleasure and so on,

original: dbang po las skyes pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po las skyes pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: it does not arise from the sense faculties.

original: de lta yin na shes pa dus gcig tu mi skye ba'i phyir rim gyis 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na shes pa dus gcig tu mi skye ba'i phyir rim gyis 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, because consciousness would not arise simultaneously, it would apprehend in sequence.

original: de'i phyir / rim gyis 'dzin na de myong ba //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rim gyis 'dzin na de myong ba //
translated: Therefore: If it apprehends in sequence, it would not

original: rnam chad med par snang mi 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam chad med par snang mi 'gyur //
translated: appear without interruption.

original: rim gyis 'dzin par khas len na bde ba la sogs pa'i blo rnam par chad pa med par snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rim gyis 'dzin par khas len na bde ba la sogs pa'i blo rnam par chad pa med par snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is accepted that it apprehends in sequence, the cognition of pleasure and so on would not appear without interruption.

original: rim pa ni 'di nyid de lhan cig 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rim pa ni 'di nyid de lhan cig 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The order is as follows: the order of the arising of the five consciousnesses is not simultaneous.üîΩThe grasping of pleasure, etc. is perceived together with the grasping of visible form, etc.üîΩThe grasping of pleasure, etc. is perceived together with the grasping of visible form, etc.

original: bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa ni gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin pa dang lhan cig tu dmigs so //üîΩde la lhan cig tu 'dzin pa dang / lhan cig tu mi 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni 'gal lo //üîΩ'gal ba dag ni gcig la srid pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa ni gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin pa dang lhan cig tu dmigs so // de la lhan cig tu 'dzin pa dang / lhan cig tu mi 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni 'gal lo // 'gal ba dag ni gcig la srid pa yang ma yin no //
translated: The grasping of pleasure, etc. is perceived together with the grasping of visible form, etc.

original: mgyogs phyir zhe na de mtshungs phyir //üîΩmyong ba med pa cis ma yin //
analyzed: mgyogs phyir zhe na de mtshungs phyir // myong ba med pa cis ma yin //
translated: The grasping of pleasure, etc. is perceived together with the grasping of visible form, etc.

analyzed: gal te bde ba 'dzin pa mgyogs par 'jug pa'i phyir rnam par ma chad par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: The grasping of pleasure, etc. is perceived together with the grasping of visible form, etc.üîΩThe grasping of pleasure, etc. is perceived together with the grasping of visible form, etc.üîΩThe grasping of pleasure, etc. is perceived together with the grasping of visible form, etc.üîΩThe grasping of pleasure, etc. is perceived together with the grasping of visible form, etc.üîΩThe grasping of pleasure, etc. is perceived together with the grasping of visible form, etc.üîΩThe grasping of pleasure, etc. is perceived together with the grasping of visible form, etc.üîΩThe grasping of pleasure, etc. is perceived together with the grasping of visible form, etc.üîΩThe grasping of pleasure, etc. is perceived together with the grasping of visible form, etc.üîΩThe grasping of pleasure, etc. is perceived together with the grasping of visible form, etc.üîΩThe grasping of pleasure, etc. is perceived together with the grasping of visible form, etc.üîΩThe grasping of pleasure, etc. is perceived together with the grasping of visible form, etc.üîΩThe grasping of pleasure, etc. is perceived together with the grasping of visible form, etc.üîΩThe grasping of pleasure, etc. is perceived together with the grasping of visible form, etc.üîΩThe grasping of pleasure, etc. is perceived together with the grasping of visible form, etc.üîΩThe grasping of pleasure, etc. is perceived together with the grasping of visible form, etc.üîΩThe grasping of pleasure, etc. is perceived together with the grasping of visible form, etc.üîΩThe grasping of pleasure, etc. is perceived together with the grasping of visible form, etc.üîΩThe grasping of pleasure, etc. is perceived together with the grasping of visible form, etc.üîΩThe grasping of pleasure, etc. is perceived together with the grasping of visible form, etc.

original: rtogs pa kho na ste bar ma gtogs pa yin no zhe na myur ba de ni bde ba la sogs pa mi 'dzin pa la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa dang gzugs mi 'dzin pa nyid rnam par @293a * //üîΩma chad par thal lo //
analyzed: rtogs pa kho na ste bar ma gtogs pa yin no zhe na myur ba de ni bde ba la sogs pa mi 'dzin pa la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa dang gzugs mi 'dzin pa nyid rnam par @293a * //üîΩma chad par thal lo //
translated: The grasping of pleasure, etc. is perceived together with the grasping of visible form, etc.üîΩThe grasping of pleasure, etc. is perceived together with

original: 'on te mi 'dzin pa yang rnam par ma chad par snang ba nyid de /
analyzed: 'on te mi 'dzin pa yang rnam par ma chad par snang ba nyid de /
translated: But if it does not apprehend, it would appear as not terminated.

original: 'di ltar bde ba mi 'dzin pa nyid ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar bde ba mi 'dzin pa nyid ni /
translated: In this way, the nonapprehension of pleasure

original: gzugs 'dzin pa las gzhan ma yin /
analyzed: gzugs 'dzin pa las gzhan ma yin /
translated: is not different from the apprehension of form.

original: gzugs mi 'dzin pa'ang bde ba 'dzin pa las gzhan yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gzugs mi 'dzin pa'ang bde ba 'dzin pa las gzhan yod pa ma yin na /
translated: And the nonapprehension of form is not different from the apprehension of pleasure.

original: des na bde ba mi 'dzin pa rnam par chad pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don 'dir 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na bde ba mi 'dzin pa rnam par chad pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don 'dir 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the nonapprehension of pleasure would not be terminated.

original: gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin pa rnam par ma chad bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin na de ni yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin pa rnam par ma chad bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin na de ni yin pa nyid do //
translated: This is the meaning of this argument. If the apprehension of form and so on were not terminated, that would be so.

original: de bzhin du bzlog pa la yang brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du bzlog pa la yang brjod do //
translated: But that is not the case. The opposite is also stated in the same way.

original: de'i phyir 'dzin pa med pa rnam par ma chad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dzin pa med pa rnam par ma chad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, this argument that the nonapprehension of pleasure would not be terminated is an argument that proves what is already established.

original: 'dir brjod pa /
analyzed: 'dir brjod pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gcig gi dngos po gang yin ba //
analyzed: gcig gi dngos po gang yin ba //
translated: Whatever is the entity of one

original: gzhan dag med pa yin par brjod //üîΩde ni de yis dben pas na //
analyzed: gzhan dag med pa yin par brjod // de ni de yis dben pas na //
translated: is said to be the nonexistence of others.üîΩBecause it is devoid of that,

original: de med par ni rig phyir ro //
analyzed: de med par ni rig phyir ro //
translated: it is known as the nonexistence of that.

original: 'di rang gi ngo bos ni gang yang med pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di rang gi ngo bos ni gang yang med pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that it does not exist at all by way of its own entity.

original: 'on kyang des dben pas yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang des dben pas yin no //
translated: However, it is empty of that.

original: des na gzugs 'dzin pa bde ba 'dzin pas dben par dmigs pa yin no zhes khas len pa na des dben par 'dzin pa de myur ba yin pa'i phyir de rnam par ma chad par yod pas ji ltar bde ba rig pa yin /üîΩbde ba 'dzin pa la yang tshul 'di nyid yin pa'i phyir gnyi ga mi 'dzin pas na /
analyzed: des na gzugs 'dzin pa bde ba 'dzin pas dben par dmigs pa yin no zhes khas len pa na des dben par 'dzin pa de myur ba yin pa'i phyir de rnam par ma chad par yod pas ji ltar bde ba rig pa yin / bde ba 'dzin pa la yang tshul 'di nyid yin pa'i phyir gnyi ga mi 'dzin pas na /
translated: Therefore, when you accept that the apprehension of form is observed to be empty of the apprehension of pleasure, since the apprehension of its emptiness is swift, how can it be that it exists without being interrupted, and how can it cognize pleasure?üîΩThe same method applies to the apprehension of pleasure. Therefore, since neither is apprehended, why is it not the case that there is no apprehension?

original: 'dzin pa med pa nyid du ci ste ma yin zhes bya ba legs par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dzin pa med pa nyid du ci ste ma yin zhes bya ba legs par brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is a good question.

original: gzhan du gzhan dmigs na yang de sa dben pa 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du gzhan dmigs na yang de sa dben pa 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: Even if something else is observed, it is not the apprehension of the emptiness of that.

original: de'i rang bzhin der zhugs pa'i phyir ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin der zhugs pa'i phyir ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: Because its nature is engaged in that.

original: phan tshun rang bzhin rjes su zhugs pa 'dzin na /
analyzed: phan tshun rang bzhin rjes su zhugs pa 'dzin na /
translated: If the apprehension of one nature is engaged in another nature,

original: rim gyis 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rim gyis 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: then it is not an apprehension of the other in sequence.

original: dus gzhan mnyam par 'dzin pa la yang yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dus gzhan mnyam par 'dzin pa la yang yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is because it exists in the apprehension of the other at the same time.

original: yan lag dang yan lag can dag dus mtshungs par 'dzin par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag dang yan lag can dag dus mtshungs par 'dzin par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because you accept that the part and the whole are apprehended simultaneously.

original: gal te thag ring po nas bar dang bcas pa'i sgra du ma 'dzin pa na bar 'dzin pa med kyang sgra'i rang bzhin gzung ba nyid do //
analyzed: gal te thag ring po nas bar dang bcas pa'i sgra du ma 'dzin pa na bar 'dzin pa med kyang sgra'i rang bzhin gzung ba nyid do //
translated: If you apprehend many sounds with intervening space when they are far away, you apprehend the nature of sound even though you do not apprehend the intervening space.

original: de la ci ltar sgra'i rang bzhin bar med par 'dzin pas de'i phyir mi 'dzin pa la gnod kyi /
analyzed: de la ci ltar sgra'i rang bzhin bar med par 'dzin pas de'i phyir mi 'dzin pa la gnod kyi /
translated: In that case, why does the apprehension of the nature of sound without intervening space invalidate the nonapprehension of the intervening space?üîΩIn the same way, the nonapprehension of intervening space does not invalidate the apprehension of sound. In the same way, here the nonapprehension of the intervening space does not invalidate it.

original: de bzhin du bar 'dzin pa med pas ni sgra 'dzin pa la mi gnod pa de bzhin du 'dir yang bar mi 'dzin pa'i gnod par byed pa ma yin no zhe na 'dir brjod pa /üîΩde la bar chad 'dzin pa ni //
analyzed: de bzhin du bar 'dzin pa med pas ni sgra 'dzin pa la mi gnod pa de bzhin du 'dir yang bar mi 'dzin pa'i gnod par byed pa ma yin no zhe na 'dir brjod pa / de la bar chad 'dzin pa ni //
translated: Here we say:üîΩHow can the nonapprehension of intervening space

original: yod min ci ltar gnod byed yin //
analyzed: yod min ci ltar gnod byed yin //
translated: invalidate it?üîΩThe nonapprehension of nonexistence

original: med par gnod par bya min la //
analyzed: med par gnod par bya min la //
translated: cannot invalidate it.

original: 'dod @293b min 'jig rten 'dod par zad //
analyzed: 'dod @293b min 'jig rten 'dod par zad //
translated: The world does not accept it, but it is accepted by the world.

original: ci'i phyir bar chad 'dzin pa med ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bar chad 'dzin pa med ce na /
translated: Why is the apprehension of intervening space not possible?

original: 'di ni dngos po rnams kyi nus pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni dngos po rnams kyi nus pa yin te /
translated: This is the power of things.

original: ci zhig brgal zhing brtag / des na bar chad 'dzin pa ma skyes pa ni gnod par byed pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: ci zhig brgal zhing brtag / des na bar chad 'dzin pa ma skyes pa ni gnod par byed pa ma yin zhing /
translated: Therefore, the nonarising of the apprehension of obstacles is not a fault, nor is it something to be faulted.

original: gnod par bya ba yang ma yin gyi 'on kyang 'di ni rnam pa ci zhig ltar 'jig rten gyi grags pa las 'ongs pa'i tha snyad tsam du zad do //
analyzed: gnod par bya ba yang ma yin gyi 'on kyang 'di ni rnam pa ci zhig ltar 'jig rten gyi grags pa las 'ongs pa'i tha snyad tsam du zad do //
translated: However, this is merely a convention that comes from the way things are renowned in the world.

original: der ni bde ba dang gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i ma skyes ba ma yin pa'i phyir mi 'thad pa cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: der ni bde ba dang gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i ma skyes ba ma yin pa'i phyir mi 'thad pa cung zad kyang med do //
translated: In that case, there is not the slightest fault, because the nonarising of the apprehension of pleasure, form, and so on is not being denied.

original: de lta yin na rim gyis 'dzin pa mi srid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na rim gyis 'dzin pa mi srid par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were the case, it would be impossible for apprehension to occur in sequence.

original: 'dzin pa ni yod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni yod pa kho na ste /
translated: Apprehension does exist.üîΩIn that case, it is said that the nonarising of another apprehension is the fault.

original: de la 'dzin pa gzhan ma skyes pa yin no zhe na de ni med de /üîΩ'dzin la 'dzin byed gzhan yod min //
analyzed: de la 'dzin pa gzhan ma skyes pa yin no zhe na de ni med de / 'dzin la 'dzin byed gzhan yod min //
translated: That is not so.üîΩApprehension does not have another apprehender.

original: 'dzin pa po la 'dzin po gzhan //
analyzed: 'dzin pa po la 'dzin po gzhan //
translated: The apprehender does not have another apprehender.

original: de ltar gzhan gyis kyang 'dod bya //
analyzed: de ltar gzhan gyis kyang 'dod bya //
translated: Others assert it in that way.

original: de lta min na cal col nyid //
analyzed: de lta min na cal col nyid //
translated: If it were not so, it would be mere babbling.

original: 'dzin par byed pa ni rang gsal ba'i bdag nyid du 'gyur dgos la /
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa ni rang gsal ba'i bdag nyid du 'gyur dgos la /
translated: The apprehender must be by the nature of its own clarity.

original: 'dzin par byed pa po byed pa'i bdag nyid dam /
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa po byed pa'i bdag nyid dam /
translated: Or else, the self that is the agent would be the apprehender.

original: byed pa po la ni 'dzin par byed pa gzhan 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: byed pa po la ni 'dzin par byed pa gzhan 'dod pa yin no //
translated: But it is not accepted that the agent is a different apprehender.

original: 'dzin par byed pa gsal ba ma yin pa ni don thams cad mi gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa gsal ba ma yin pa ni don thams cad mi gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the apprehender is not manifest, then all objects would be unmanifest.

original: gal te dbang po'am gzhan las 'dzin par byed pa rang gsal ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te dbang po'am gzhan las 'dzin par byed pa rang gsal ba yin na /
translated: If the sense faculty or something else is the manifest apprehender,

original: da ni 'dzin pa po gzhan gyis ci bya zhe na /
analyzed: da ni 'dzin pa po gzhan gyis ci bya zhe na /
translated: then what is the use of another apprehender?

original: skyon gzhan 'di ni yod pa nyid na rang nyid gsal ba med par 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni med do //üîΩde gzhan gyis gsal bar yin no zhe na /
analyzed: skyon gzhan 'di ni yod pa nyid na rang nyid gsal ba med par 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni med do // de gzhan gyis gsal bar yin no zhe na /
translated: This fault would exist: If it is not manifest to itself, then there would be no such thing as an apprehender.üîΩIf it is manifest to something else,üîΩthen the manifestor would be something else.

original: gsal bar byed pa gzhan yang lkog tu gyur pa nyid pas de gzhan gyis yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa gzhan yang lkog tu gyur pa nyid pas de gzhan gyis yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since that would be hidden, it would be manifest to something else.

original: 'gro ba mtha' dag long ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba mtha' dag long ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the entire world would be blind.

original: phan tshun dus tha dad par skyes pa snang bar 'gyur ba de dag ci ltar phan tshun gnod par byed pa ma yin te de'i phyir 'di ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: phan tshun dus tha dad par skyes pa snang bar 'gyur ba de dag ci ltar phan tshun gnod par byed pa ma yin te de'i phyir 'di ni gyi na'o //
translated: How can they not be mutually exclusive? Therefore, this is mere prattle.

original: 'on te bde ba 'dzin pa la ni gnod par 'gyur ba nyid de /
analyzed: 'on te bde ba 'dzin pa la ni gnod par 'gyur ba nyid de /
translated: But if it is maintained that pleasure is experienced, then it is contradicted.

original: res 'ga' gzugs la sogs pa 'ba' zhig 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: res 'ga' gzugs la sogs pa 'ba' zhig 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because sometimes only form, etc. is experienced.

original: 'di ltar res 'ga' yid 'phrog pa'i gzugs mthong yang bde ba myong ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar res 'ga' yid 'phrog pa'i gzugs mthong yang bde ba myong ba med pa yin no //
translated: Thus, sometimes one sees a captivating form, but does not experience pleasure.

original: des na skra'i 'dzin pa ltar bde ba 'dzin pa yang ma skyes pa'i phyir gnod par rnam par gzhag go zhe na 'di yang bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: des na skra'i 'dzin pa ltar bde ba 'dzin pa yang ma skyes pa'i phyir gnod par rnam par gzhag go zhe na 'di yang bzang po ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, just as the experience of the hairs, etc. is not produced, the experience of pleasure is also not produced. Thus, it is established that it is contradicted. This is not good,üîΩbecause:

original: 'di ltar / ci ltar skra'i bar 'dzin pa ltar //üîΩkun tshe ci phyir gnod ma gyur //
analyzed: 'di ltar / ci ltar skra'i bar 'dzin pa ltar // kun tshe ci phyir gnod ma gyur //
translated: Just as the experience of the hairs, etc.üîΩis not always experienced,

original: de tshe bde ba la sogs pa //
analyzed: de tshe bde ba la sogs pa //
translated: why is the experience of pleasure, etc.

original: bar du skye bar 'jig rten @294a * //
analyzed: bar du skye bar 'jig rten @294a * //
translated: not sometimes experienced in the world?

original: 'dod ; / ci ltar skra 'dzin pas bar 'dzin par thams cad kyi tshe /
analyzed: 'dod ; / ci ltar skra 'dzin pas bar 'dzin par thams cad kyi tshe /
translated: Just as the experience of the hairs, etc. is not always experienced,üîΩwhy is the experience of pleasure, etc. not sometimes experienced in the world?

original: gnod pa de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin pas kyang bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa la 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod pa de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin pas kyang bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa la 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the apprehension of form, etc. would be the apprehension of pleasure, etc.

original: don dam par na ni de skra 'dzin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par na ni de skra 'dzin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But in the ultimate sense, it is not the apprehension of hair,

original: skra'i rang bzhin rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skra'i rang bzhin rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not apprehend the nature of hair.

original: gang gi tshe bde ba ma rtogs par gzugs la sogs pa 'ba' zhig 'dzin pa de'i tshe ni bde ba ma skyes pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bde ba ma rtogs par gzugs la sogs pa 'ba' zhig 'dzin pa de'i tshe ni bde ba ma skyes pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: When one apprehends only form, etc. without apprehending pleasure, then pleasure is not born.

original: skyes pa ma bzung bas 'ba' zhig ba zhes rnam par 'jog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes pa ma bzung bas 'ba' zhig ba zhes rnam par 'jog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not posited as ‚Äúonly‚Äù because it is not apprehended when born.

original: ma dmigs pa'i phyir ma skyes par tha snyad byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ma dmigs pa'i phyir ma skyes par tha snyad byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is conventionally expressed as ‚Äúunborn‚Äù because it is not perceived,

original: da ni skyes ba lam skyes bar tha snyad du 'gyur te /
analyzed: da ni skyes ba lam skyes bar tha snyad du 'gyur te /
translated: then it would be conventionally expressed as ‚Äúborn‚Äù when it is born.

original: des na ma dmigs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: des na ma dmigs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that it is not perceived.

original: des na gang gi tshe bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i skyes pa de nyid kyi tshe bde ba la sogs pa skyes pa yin pas de'i tshe ni gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin pas zil gyis non pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na gang gi tshe bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i skyes pa de nyid kyi tshe bde ba la sogs pa skyes pa yin pas de'i tshe ni gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin pas zil gyis non pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, when the mind apprehending pleasure and so on arises, pleasure and so on have already arisen. Thus, at that time, the mind apprehending form and so on is not overwhelmed.

original: khyed kyi gzhung ltar na ni skra'i bar 'dzin pa ltar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: khyed kyi gzhung ltar na ni skra'i bar 'dzin pa ltar 'gyur ro ;
translated: But according to your texts, it would be as if one apprehends the space between hairs.

original: /'on te dbang po'i blo gcig nyid don dang bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa la 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: /'on te dbang po'i blo gcig nyid don dang bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa la 'jug pa yin te /
translated: But if the mind of the sense faculty itself engages in apprehending objects, pleasure, and so on,

original: des na rim gyis 'dzin pa'i nyes pa ni mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: des na rim gyis 'dzin pa'i nyes pa ni mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then the error of gradual apprehension does not occur.

original: de ni mi rung ngo zhes 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: de ni mi rung ngo zhes 'chad pa ni /
translated: The response that this is illogical is stated in the lines:

original: gcig gis gnyis shes ma yin te //
analyzed: gcig gis gnyis shes ma yin te //
translated: One does not know two,

original: dbang po'i sems ni des phyir dang // bde sogs med kyang don dag las //
analyzed: dbang po'i sems ni des phyir dang // bde sogs med kyang don dag las //
translated: because the mind of the sense faculty is external, and pleasure and so on arise from objects,

original: skyes phyir de nus grub min phyir //
analyzed: skyes phyir de nus grub min phyir //
translated: because it is not established that it has the capacity to do so.

original: gal te dbang po'i blo gcig nyid kyis don dang bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin na rigs pa zhig na /
analyzed: gal te dbang po'i blo gcig nyid kyis don dang bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin na rigs pa zhig na /
translated: If the mind of the sense faculty itself apprehends objects, pleasure, and so on, that would be logical.

original: de ltar yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no /
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no /
translated: But that is not the case. This is the explanation.

original: bde ba la sogs pa ni bdag dang yid 'brel pa tsam las skyes pa dbang po las skyes pa ma yin pa'i shes bas 'dzin par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa ni bdag dang yid 'brel pa tsam las skyes pa dbang po las skyes pa ma yin pa'i shes bas 'dzin par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because you accept that pleasure and so on are apprehended by a consciousness that arises merely in dependence on the self and the mental faculty, and not from a sense faculty.

original: 'on te 'ga' zhig de ltar khas mi len no zhe na de yang nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te 'ga' zhig de ltar khas mi len no zhe na de yang nus pa ma yin te /
translated: But if you do not accept that, then that is also not possible.

original: dbang po'i blo ni bde ba la sogs pa med kyang don 'ba' zhig nyid las skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dbang po'i blo ni bde ba la sogs pa med kyang don 'ba' zhig nyid las skye ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the sense consciousnesses arise from just the object, even when pleasure and so on do not exist.

analyzed: mi 'byung ba de ni de'i rgyu nyid du nges par 'dzin pa yin no //

analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na bde ba dang gzugs su snang ba yang gzugs 'ba' zhig las ma yin pas rigs pa mtshungs so zhe na /

analyzed: tshogs la'ang nus grub de la ni //

analyzed: rang gi rgyu las mngon phyogs pas //

original: dmigs pa'i yul du mi 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i yul du mi 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that there is no object of observation that has not been previously thought or experienced.

original: de la yang bar du gcod pa'i goms pa yod pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang bar du gcod pa'i goms pa yod pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: Even in that case, there is the cultivation of the obstruction.

original: 'di la tshad ma ci yod /üîΩgzhan yang don gyi rnam pa goms pa med par ni shes pa goms par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di la tshad ma ci yod / gzhan yang don gyi rnam pa goms pa med par ni shes pa goms par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: What is the authority for that?

original: 'ba' zhig goms par bya ba mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig goms par bya ba mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, without the cultivation of the aspect of the object, the cognition is not cultivated, because it is not possible to cultivate the mere cognition.

original: gal te shes pa goms pa'i stobs kyis skye ba yin na don la sogs pa la ltos pa ni yod /
analyzed: gal te shes pa goms pa'i stobs kyis skye ba yin na don la sogs pa la ltos pa ni yod /
translated: If it arises by the power of the cultivation of cognition, then it would be dependent on the object, etc.

original: 'on te don dang lhan cig pa'i goms pa las yin no //
analyzed: 'on te don dang lhan cig pa'i goms pa las yin no //
translated: Or, it is from the cultivation together with the object.

original: de lta yin na don gyi rnam pa yang goms pa'i stobs nyid las skyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na don gyi rnam pa yang goms pa'i stobs nyid las skyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is the case, then the aspect of the object would also arise by the power of cultivation.

original: de ltar gyur na rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du shes pa don dang bral ba nyid du 'gyur bas bde ba la sogs pa rnam par shes pa las phyi rol par bsgrub tu chas pa don yang phyi rol gyi rang bzhin ma yin par bsgrub pa'i phyir
analyzed: de ltar gyur na rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du shes pa don dang bral ba nyid du 'gyur bas bde ba la sogs pa rnam par shes pa las phyi rol par bsgrub tu chas pa don yang phyi rol gyi rang bzhin ma yin par bsgrub pa'i phyir
translated: If that were so, then like dreams and so on, consciousness would be devoid of objects. Therefore, in order to establish that pleasure and so on are external to consciousness, and in order to establish that objects are not external by nature,

original: / gzhan dag gzhan sun 'byin pa la cher gzo'o //
analyzed: / gzhan dag gzhan sun 'byin pa la cher gzo'o //
translated: others are very skilled in refuting others.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal cig car 'byung ba ma yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal cig car 'byung ba ma yin par 'dod de /
translated: They assert that pleasure and pain do not occur simultaneously.

original: 'di ltar / nang gi nyer len shes pa yang //
analyzed: 'di ltar / nang gi nyer len shes pa yang //
translated: Thus, if the internal appropriating consciousness exists,

original: yod na sdug bsngal la sogs 'byung //üîΩgcig po de ni 'gal ba yi //
analyzed: yod na sdug bsngal la sogs 'byung // gcig po de ni 'gal ba yi //
translated: pain and so on would occur.üîΩThat one is asserted to be the nonappropriating consciousness

original: nyer len min par 'dod ce na //
analyzed: nyer len min par 'dod ce na //
translated: that is incompatible with the appropriating consciousness.

original: gang gis rnam par shes pa ni //
analyzed: gang gis rnam par shes pa ni //
translated: By what means is the appropriating consciousness

original: mi shes pa yi nyer lan rgyu //
analyzed: mi shes pa yi nyer lan rgyu //
translated: the cause of unknowing consciousness?

original: bdag po nyid du 'gyur yin na //
analyzed: bdag po nyid du 'gyur yin na //
translated: If it were the dominant condition,

original: de ni 'gal bdag la'ang mthong //
analyzed: de ni 'gal bdag la'ang mthong //
translated: that would be seen to be incompatible with the self.

original: dper na sna gcig mtshan rgyu dang // de las gzhan pa'i dbang po dag / gzugs mthong ba dang mi mthun dang // mthun pa cig car byed pa bzhin //
analyzed: dper na sna gcig mtshan rgyu dang // de las gzhan pa'i dbang po dag / gzugs mthong ba dang mi mthun dang // mthun pa cig car byed pa bzhin //
translated: For example, the nose faculty and the other faculties, which are not suitable to see visible form, are simultaneous with the eye faculty, which is suitable to see visible form.

original: gal te bde ba la sogs pa shes pa snga ma'i nye bar len pa la ltos nas byung ba yin na de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te bde ba la sogs pa shes pa snga ma'i nye bar len pa la ltos nas byung ba yin na de'i tshe /
translated: If pleasure and so on arise in dependence on the appropriation of prior cognition,

original: 'gal ba gnyis kyi nye bar len pa gcig yin par mi rigs pa zhig na //
analyzed: 'gal ba gnyis kyi nye bar len pa gcig yin par mi rigs pa zhig na //
translated: then it is not logical that the appropriation of two incompatible states would be the same.

original: 'on kyang de nyid rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang de nyid rigs pa yin te /
translated: However, that is logical.

original: bde ba la sogs pa 'gal ba la yang shes pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa 'gal ba la yang shes pa mthong ngo //
translated: We see that pleasure and so on are incompatible with cognition.

original: 'on te 'gal ba'i nye bar len pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'gal ba'i nye bar len pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if they are not incompatible with appropriation,

original: de ltar yin na rnam par shes pa rnam par shes pa ma yin pa'i nye bar len par ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar yin na rnam par shes pa rnam par shes pa ma yin pa'i nye bar len par ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: then how could consciousness be the appropriation of something that is not consciousness?

original: nye bar len pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not called the appropriated thing.

original: rgyu rnams la 'bras bu'i bdag bo nyid yin pa 'ba' zhig tu zad la de ni 'gal ba la yang yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu rnams la 'bras bu'i bdag bo nyid yin pa 'ba' zhig tu zad la de ni 'gal ba la yang yod pa nyid do //
translated: The cause is the mere nature of the effect, and that exists even in incompatible states.

original: dper na snang bag chags gcig las 'ug pa dang gzhan dag gi mig la gnod pa dang / cig shos su 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na snang bag chags gcig las 'ug pa dang gzhan dag gi mig la gnod pa dang / cig shos su 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, the same visual impression is harmful to the eyes of owls and beneficial to the eyes of others.

original: de'i phyir bde @296b sogs rang nyid la //
analyzed: de'i phyir bde @296b sogs rang nyid la //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of ‚Äútransference‚Äù in the statement ‚Äúpleasure, etc.,

original: 'phos pa'i don ni snang ba dang // rang bdag rig byed 'di dag gi / don las skyes pa tsam du zad //
analyzed: 'phos pa'i don ni snang ba dang // rang bdag rig byed 'di dag gi / don las skyes pa tsam du zad //
translated: are transferred to the self‚Äù is that they are merely born from the objects of the visual consciousness, etc.

original: gal te bde ba la sogs pa'i rtogs pa'i bdag nyid ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te bde ba la sogs pa'i rtogs pa'i bdag nyid ma yin na /
translated: If pleasure, etc., are not of the nature of self-awareness,

original: gzugs la sogs pa las rnam par shes pa dang dus mtshungs par skye ba yin na /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa las rnam par shes pa dang dus mtshungs par skye ba yin na /
translated: and they are born simultaneously with consciousness of form, etc.,

original: de'i tshe rtag tu 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i yul mngon du gyur pas bde ba dang sdug bsngal cig car rig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe rtag tu 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i yul mngon du gyur pas bde ba dang sdug bsngal cig car rig par 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time, since desirable and undesirable objects are always present, pleasure and pain would be cognized simultaneously.

original: khyed kyi ltar na yang ci ste de ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /üîΩma yin te /
analyzed: khyed kyi ltar na yang ci ste de ltar mi 'gyur zhe na / ma yin te /
translated: But according to your theory, why doesn‚Äôt this happen?

original: bag chags sad pa de dang 'dra ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag chags sad pa de dang 'dra ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It does not happen because the awakening of the latent impressions is not similar to that.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhin te /
translated: It is like the conceptualization of form, etc.

original: 'ga' zhig gi tshe nyid 'ga' zhig bag chags sad pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi tshe nyid 'ga' zhig bag chags sad pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: In some cases, the mere existence of something is the cause for the awakening of a latent impression.

original: nged la yang de ltar yin no zhe na ma yin te 'di ltar /
analyzed: nged la yang de ltar yin no zhe na ma yin te 'di ltar /
translated: If you say that this is the case for us, then that is not so, because:

original: bag chags stobs las byung na ni //
analyzed: bag chags stobs las byung na ni //
translated: If it arises from the power of a latent impression,

original: rtog pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur //üîΩbag chags dran dang ngo shes pa //
analyzed: rtog pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur // bag chags dran dang ngo shes pa //
translated: then it follows that it is a conceptualization.üîΩWe see that memory and recognition

original: nyid kyi rgyu ni yin par mthong //
analyzed: nyid kyi rgyu ni yin par mthong //
translated: are the cause of latent impressions.

original: gal te dran pa la sogs pa yang rang gi ngo bos rig pa med pa nyid ma yin nam ;
analyzed: gal te dran pa la sogs pa yang rang gi ngo bos rig pa med pa nyid ma yin nam ;
translated: If you say that memory and so on are not themselves devoid of awareness,

original: de la yang don nyid snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang don nyid snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because an object appears to them,

original: de la ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid don gyi rang bzhin nyid snang gi / der yang shes pa'i rang bzhin gzhan ni rig pa'i yul du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de la ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid don gyi rang bzhin nyid snang gi / der yang shes pa'i rang bzhin gzhan ni rig pa'i yul du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: then in that case, the nature of the object, which is the nature of color and shape, appears to them, but the nature of consciousness does not appear as an object of awareness.

original: de'i phyir blo mtha' dag ni lkog tu gyur pa 'ba' zhig go zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir blo mtha' dag ni lkog tu gyur pa 'ba' zhig go zhe na /
translated: Therefore, all cognitions are only about hidden objects.

original: gal te der ni yod pa yi //
analyzed: gal te der ni yod pa yi //
translated: If the object that exists there

original: don nyid snang ba'i spyod yul na //
analyzed: don nyid snang ba'i spyod yul na //
translated: is the domain of what appears as an object,

original: don de mngon sum bzhin du ni //
analyzed: don de mngon sum bzhin du ni //
translated: then that object is like a direct perception.

original: 'dzin pa dang ni 'brel par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang ni 'brel par 'gyur //
translated: and it is related to the apprehension of the object.

original: rang gi ngo bos snang ba'i don ni mngon sum ma yin par 'os pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos snang ba'i don ni mngon sum ma yin par 'os pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not proper to say that the object which appears by virtue of its own nature is not perception,

original: rang gi ngo bos snang ba nyid mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos snang ba nyid mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the appearance by virtue of its own nature is perception.

original: mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no other characteristic of perception.

original: de ltar gyur na mngon sum dang dran pa dag khyad par med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na mngon sum dang dran pa dag khyad par med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, there would be no difference between perception and memory.

original: 'on te snga ma nyid dang lkog tu gyur pa nyid du snang ba des na nyen pa 'di med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te snga ma nyid dang lkog tu gyur pa nyid du snang ba des na nyen pa 'di med do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the former is not a case of the object appearing by virtue of its own nature, and that the latter is a case of the object appearing by virtue of its own nature, then there is no fault.

original: lkog tu gyur pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / de mngon sum gyis ni dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / de mngon sum gyis ni dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: What is this so-called ‚Äúnot appearing by virtue of its own nature‚Äù? It is not perceived by perception.

original: mngon sum gyis ni dmigs 'gyur ba //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni dmigs 'gyur ba //
translated: The object that is perceived by perception

original: dran pa nyid la 'jug pa yin /üîΩgzhan pa sngar med rang bzhin ni //
analyzed: dran pa nyid la 'jug pa yin / gzhan pa sngar med rang bzhin ni //
translated: is the object of memory.üîΩIf the object of memory is the object of perception,

original: 'dzin na ji ltar dran pa yin //
analyzed: 'dzin na ji ltar dran pa yin //
translated: how can it be the object of memory?

original: dran pa ni mngon sum gyis dmigs pa la 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: dran pa ni mngon sum gyis dmigs pa la 'jug pa yin te /
translated: Memory engages the object that is perceived by perception.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If that were not so,üîΩthen memory would not be a valid cognition.

original: snga na med pa gzung ba yin na ci ltar dran pa yin /
analyzed: snga na med pa gzung ba yin na ci ltar dran pa yin /
translated: If it is a non-existent object that is apprehended, how can it be memory?

original: sngon med pa'i yul can ni dran pa ma yin no //üîΩ'on te gzung ba'i don nyid la lkog tu gyur par 'dzin @297a * //
analyzed: sngon med pa'i yul can ni dran pa ma yin no // 'on te gzung ba'i don nyid la lkog tu gyur par 'dzin @297a * //
translated: A non-existent object is not memory.

original: ba'i phyir de dran pa yin par 'dod na de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: ba'i phyir de dran pa yin par 'dod na de yang mi rung ste /
translated: But if you maintain that it is memory because it apprehends the object that is to be remembered, even that is not possible.

original: lkog nyid don gyi ngo bo'am ci //
analyzed: lkog nyid don gyi ngo bo'am ci //
translated: What is the nature of the object that is hidden?

original: ci ga shes pa'i ngo bo yin //
analyzed: ci ga shes pa'i ngo bo yin //
translated: Is it the nature of consciousness?

original: don gyi rang bzhin nyid ce na //
analyzed: don gyi rang bzhin nyid ce na //
translated: If it is the nature of the object,

original: mngon sum la ni de snang 'gyur //
analyzed: mngon sum la ni de snang 'gyur //
translated: it would appear to perception.

original: don gyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni mngon sum la snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: don gyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni mngon sum la snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: Whatever is the nature of the object would appear to perception,

original: dper na sngon po nyid la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sngon po nyid la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: just like blue and so on.

original: gal te nus pa nges pa'i phyir dran pa nyid la snang ba yin te /
analyzed: gal te nus pa nges pa'i phyir dran pa nyid la snang ba yin te /
translated: But if you maintain that it appears to memory because of the determination of its potentiality,üîΩthat is not so.

original: dper na dngos po yod pa dang med pa'i bdag nyid la yod pa'i rang bzhin ni mngon sum 'dzin cing dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin ni rang bzhin gzhan gyi dngos po med pa'i tshad ma'i spyod yul du 'gyur pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na dngos po yod pa dang med pa'i bdag nyid la yod pa'i rang bzhin ni mngon sum 'dzin cing dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin ni rang bzhin gzhan gyi dngos po med pa'i tshad ma'i spyod yul du 'gyur pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: For example, the nature of existence in the nature of existence and non-existence is the domain of direct perception, and the nature of non-existence in the nature of non-existence of another nature is the domain of valid knowledge.

original: de yang rang gi phyogs su ltung ba yin te 'di /
analyzed: de yang rang gi phyogs su ltung ba yin te 'di /
translated: This is also a falling into one‚Äôs own position.

original: dngos med dngos po yin na ni //
analyzed: dngos med dngos po yin na ni //
translated: If non-entity is an entity,

original: ci ltar mngon sum gyis mi 'dzin //
analyzed: ci ltar mngon sum gyis mi 'dzin //
translated: how is it not apprehended by direct perception?

original: de las de ni tha dad na //
analyzed: de las de ni tha dad na //
translated: If it is different from that,

original: dngos po gnyi gar ci ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: dngos po gnyi gar ci ltar 'gyur //
translated: how could it be both an entity and a non-entity?

original: dngos po tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the characteristic of a different entity is a different aspect.

original: rnam pa tha dad kyang tha dad pa med pa yin na ni /
analyzed: rnam pa tha dad kyang tha dad pa med pa yin na ni /
translated: If, although the aspects are different, they are not different,

original: ril rang bzhin gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ril rang bzhin gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: everything would have the same nature.

original: 'on te dngos po dag gi rnam pa tha dad pas du mar 'gyur gyi dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te dngos po dag gi rnam pa tha dad pas du mar 'gyur gyi dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ni ma yin no //
translated: But if the aspects of entities are different, they become many, but not entities and non-entities.

original: dngos po dag ni dngos po med pa las tha dad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dngos po dag ni dngos po med pa las tha dad pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because things are different from nonthings.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag la ni dngos po med pa gzhan med do //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag la ni dngos po med pa gzhan med do //
translated: But nonthings do not exist apart from things.

original: de lta ma yin na ni thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhe na /üîΩgal te dngos med dngos po las //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhe na / gal te dngos med dngos po las //
translated: If they did, there would be an infinite regress.üîΩIf a nonthing is not different

original: gzhan min gzhan 'dzin ci ltar yin //
analyzed: gzhan min gzhan 'dzin ci ltar yin //
translated: from a thing, how can it be apprehended as different?

original: tshad ma tha dad phyir zhe na //
analyzed: tshad ma tha dad phyir zhe na //
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúBecause there are different valid cognitions,‚Äù

original: tha dad med par ga las 'dzin //
analyzed: tha dad med par ga las 'dzin //
translated: how can it be apprehended as nondifferent?

original: gal te dngos po'i cha ni mngon sum gyis 'dzin la /
analyzed: gal te dngos po'i cha ni mngon sum gyis 'dzin la /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúThe aspect of a thing is apprehended by direct perception,

original: dngos po med pa'i cha ni tshad ma gzhan gyis yin na /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i cha ni tshad ma gzhan gyis yin na /
translated: and the aspect of a nonthing is apprehended by another valid cognition,‚Äù

original: de lta yin na phan tshun ma 'dres par rtogs pa'i phyir ci ltar dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid gcig yin zhes bya bar rtogs /
analyzed: de lta yin na phan tshun ma 'dres par rtogs pa'i phyir ci ltar dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid gcig yin zhes bya bar rtogs /
translated: then, because they are understood as mutually exclusive, how can it be understood that they are the same entity?

original: gal te mig gi rnam shes kyis gzugs rtogs la /
analyzed: gal te mig gi rnam shes kyis gzugs rtogs la /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúThe eye consciousness understands form,üîΩand the mental consciousness understands nonthings,‚Äù

original: gzhan gyis sgra la sogs pa yin na bdag nyid kyis gnyi ga rtogs so zhes byed pa po gcig nyid du ci ltar rtogs she na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis sgra la sogs pa yin na bdag nyid kyis gnyi ga rtogs so zhes byed pa po gcig nyid du ci ltar rtogs she na /
translated: If others say that sound and so on are different, then how do you understand that the one agent is both?

original: 'di thog ma med pa'i bag chags las rtogs pa yin gyi de kho na nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di thog ma med pa'i bag chags las rtogs pa yin gyi de kho na nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: We understand this from beginningless latent potentialities, but not from reality.

original: 'di la klan ka ci yod /
analyzed: 'di la klan ka ci yod /
translated: What is the fault here?

original: 'dir yang de bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir yang de bzhin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the same here,

original: gal te de ltar thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi stobs nyid las dngos po med pa'i tha dad par rtogs pa yang yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi stobs nyid las dngos po med pa'i tha dad par rtogs pa yang yin par 'gyur na /
translated: then if it were the case that the understanding of difference in the absence of an entity arises from the power of beginningless latent potentialities,

original: don gzhan @297b brtags pas ci bya /
analyzed: don gzhan @297b brtags pas ci bya /
translated: then what is the use of postulating a different object?

original: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba ni tshad ma de yang bag chags kyi stobs las byung ba yin gyi don dam pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba ni tshad ma de yang bag chags kyi stobs las byung ba yin gyi don dam pa ni ma yin no //
translated: What is called ‚Äúnonentity‚Äù is a valid cognition that arises from the power of latent potentialities, but it is not ultimate.

original: des na mi 'dra ba nyid kyis de las ldog pas na /
analyzed: des na mi 'dra ba nyid kyis de las ldog pas na /
translated: Therefore, because of its dissimilarity, it is the opposite of that.

original: dngos po med pas ci bya mi 'dra ba yang mngon sum nyid la snang ba yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pas ci bya mi 'dra ba yang mngon sum nyid la snang ba yin no //
translated: What is the use of nonentity? Dissimilarity also appears in direct perception itself.

original: des na 'di na med do zhes bya ba'i dus su phyis 'byung ba can de'i stobs las byung ba ni /
analyzed: des na 'di na med do zhes bya ba'i dus su phyis 'byung ba can de'i stobs las byung ba ni /
translated: Therefore, when it is said, ‚ÄúIt does not exist here,‚Äù it is due to the power of that later arising.üîΩ

original: gzung ba 'dzin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba 'dzin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, when one says, ‚ÄúIt does not exist here,‚Äù the subsequent non-apprehension that occurs on the basis of that [prior non-apprehension] is not a valid cognition, because it apprehends what has already been apprehended.

original: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba'i tshad ma gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba'i tshad ma gzhan ni med do //
translated: There is no other valid cognition called ‚Äúnon-existence.‚Äù

original: dngos po med pa'i tshad mas bdag gis dngos po med par rtogs so zhes bya ba 'di ni so so rang gi tha snyad yin gyi /üîΩ'jig rten ni gang gi phyir bltar rung ba bdag gis ma dmigs pa des na 'di ni med do zhe 'am /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i tshad mas bdag gis dngos po med par rtogs so zhes bya ba 'di ni so so rang gi tha snyad yin gyi / 'jig rten ni gang gi phyir bltar rung ba bdag gis ma dmigs pa des na 'di ni med do zhe 'am /
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúI understand non-existence by means of the valid cognition of non-existence,‚Äù is a conventional expression of one‚Äôs own mind.üîΩThe world, however, makes conventional expressions of meaning in the same way, saying, ‚ÄúIt does not exist here,‚Äù because of not seeing what is visible.

original: de 'dir dngos po yod pa ma yin no zhes mtshungs par don gyi tha snyad byed do //
analyzed: de 'dir dngos po yod pa ma yin no zhes mtshungs par don gyi tha snyad byed do //
translated: Or, ‚ÄúIt is not present here.‚Äù

original: ma dmigs pa de yang mngon sum kho na yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //üîΩdon dam par ni dngos po med pa zhes bya ba tshad ma ma yin la /
analyzed: ma dmigs pa de yang mngon sum kho na yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro // don dam par ni dngos po med pa zhes bya ba tshad ma ma yin la /
translated: We will explain that this non-apprehension is a direct perception.

original: gzhal bya yang ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhal bya yang ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: In the ultimate sense, however, non-existence is neither a valid cognition nor an object of comprehension.

original: de'i bdag nyid can yin yang nus pa nges pa'i dpe ma grub bo //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid can yin yang nus pa nges pa'i dpe ma grub bo //
translated: Even if it is of the nature of that, the example is not established as having a determined capacity.

original: gzhan yang / ci ste dngos po med pa tshad ma gzhan yin no de bzhin du dran pa yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang / ci ste dngos po med pa tshad ma gzhan yin no de bzhin du dran pa yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if a non-entity is another valid cognition, then memory would be like that.

original: lkog tu gyur pa nyid la dran pa tshad ma kho na'o zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa nyid la dran pa tshad ma kho na'o zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If it is said that memory alone is a valid cognition in regard to the obscure, that is not so.

original: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it possesses the characteristics of a valid cognition.

original: lkog gyur nyid ni bzung na yang //
analyzed: lkog gyur nyid ni bzung na yang //
translated: Even if the obscure is apprehended,

original: don ni ci zhig 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: don ni ci zhig 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: what object is accomplished?

original: rjes dpag chos can 'brel pa dag / gzung ba las ni 'jug pa nyid //
analyzed: rjes dpag chos can 'brel pa dag / gzung ba las ni 'jug pa nyid //
translated: Inference engages only through the apprehension of the property possessor and the relation.

original: 'di snyam du lkog tu gyur pa nyid shes par gyur na 'di la da ltar mngon sum du mi 'jug go zhes rtog pa dang ldan pa rjes su dpag pa 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: 'di snyam du lkog tu gyur pa nyid shes par gyur na 'di la da ltar mngon sum du mi 'jug go zhes rtog pa dang ldan pa rjes su dpag pa 'jug par byed do //
translated: One who thinks like this, having the idea that if the obscure were known, it would not engage in perception now, makes inference engage.

original: des na 'di lkog tu gyur pa nyid du rig pa'i dgos pa yin pas na /
analyzed: des na 'di lkog tu gyur pa nyid du rig pa'i dgos pa yin pas na /
translated: Therefore, since the purpose of knowing the obscure is this,

original: dran pa tshad ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dran pa tshad ma yin no zhe na /
translated: memory is a valid cognition.

original: de ltar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin no //
translated: That is not so.

original: 'di ltar 'brel pa bzung ba dang phyogs kyi chos la brten pa 'di las rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'brel pa bzung ba dang phyogs kyi chos la brten pa 'di las rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because inference proceeds from the perception of the relation and the presence of the reason in the subject.

original: du ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu mthong ba'i de ma thag tu skye ba'i rjes su dpag pas me 'dzin pa na de'i sngar lkog tu gyur pa dag nyid nges par 'dzin par byed pa ni su yang med do //
analyzed: du ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu mthong ba'i de ma thag tu skye ba'i rjes su dpag pas me 'dzin pa na de'i sngar lkog tu gyur pa dag nyid nges par 'dzin par byed pa ni su yang med do //
translated: When one infers fire from the perception of smoke, one does not apprehend the previously unknown fire and smoke as being related to each other, nor does one apprehend the previously unknown fire as being related to the reason, smoke.

original: nges par 'dzin pa na yang dgos pa med do //
analyzed: nges par 'dzin pa na yang dgos pa med do //
translated: And when one apprehends them, there is no need for the relation.

original: 'o na res 'ga' zhig nges par 'dzin par byed pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na res 'ga' zhig nges par 'dzin par byed pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: But sometimes one does apprehend the relation.

original: de la yang 'ol med do //üîΩ'di ltar / sbyor bar byed pa'i cha 'ga' zhig / res 'ga' bar ni @298a * //
analyzed: de la yang 'ol med do // 'di ltar / sbyor bar byed pa'i cha 'ga' zhig / res 'ga' bar ni @298a * //
translated: But there is no need for that either.üîΩFor,üîΩIs any part of the relation ever seen

original: mthong ngam ci //
analyzed: mthong ngam ci //
translated: apart from the two relata?

original: cig sbyor bar byed pa'i don //
analyzed: cig sbyor bar byed pa'i don //
translated: And if the relation is the cause of the cognition of the object,

original: rgyu nyid las ni ldog 'gyur ram //
analyzed: rgyu nyid las ni ldog 'gyur ram //
translated: then the cause would be excluded.

original: sbyor bar byed pa ni rgyu kho na'o //
analyzed: sbyor bar byed pa ni rgyu kho na'o //
translated: The relation is the cause of the cognition of the object.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa las 'das pa ni rgyu nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa las 'das pa ni rgyu nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: But if it is excluded from the object, it is not the cause.

original: rgyu nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni de tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni de tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the definition of cause is exhausted in just that.

original: gzhan yang / dran pas lkog gyur nyid du ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang / dran pas lkog gyur nyid du ni //
translated: Moreover,

original: dngos po gang zhig shes par 'gyur //
analyzed: dngos po gang zhig shes par 'gyur //
translated: How would one know an objectüîΩthat is hidden by memory?

original: rjes su dpag pas rtog pa gang //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas rtog pa gang //
translated: That which is imagined by inference

original: de ni dran pa'i spyod yul min //
analyzed: de ni dran pa'i spyod yul min //
translated: is not the domain of memory.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul du gyur pa'i don gang yin pa de ni dran pa'i yul ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul du gyur pa'i don gang yin pa de ni dran pa'i yul ma yin te /
translated: Whatever object is the domain of inference is not the domain of memory.

original: de lta yin na shugs kyis rjes su dpag pa don med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin na shugs kyis rjes su dpag pa don med par 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, it would be pointless to infer by implication,

original: lkog tu gyur pa nyid ni dran pa nyid kyis bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa nyid ni dran pa nyid kyis bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which is hidden would be apprehended by memory itself.

original: dran pas ni de lkog tu gyur pa nyid du rtogs kyi de'i tshe yod pa nyid du ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dran pas ni de lkog tu gyur pa nyid du rtogs kyi de'i tshe yod pa nyid du ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that memory understands that which is hidden, but not that it exists at that time,

original: 'o na lkog tu gyur pa nyid du rtogs pa de gang zhig yin /
analyzed: 'o na lkog tu gyur pa nyid du rtogs pa de gang zhig yin /
translated: then what is that which is understood to be hidden?

original: sngon mthong ba'o zhen 'o na dus de'i mthar thug pa'i dngos po nyid dran pas lkog tu gyur pa nyid du rig pa yin gyi /
analyzed: sngon mthong ba'o zhen 'o na dus de'i mthar thug pa'i dngos po nyid dran pas lkog tu gyur pa nyid du rig pa yin gyi /
translated: If you say that it is what was seen before, then at that time memory understands the hiddenness of the thing that is the limit of time.

original: gzhan ni ma yin pas na dran pa don med pa nyid do //üîΩdran nas lkog tu gyur pa la 'jug pa des na dran pa tshad ma yin gyi rjes su dpag pa 'jug par byed pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhe na /
