analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin pas na dran pa don med pa nyid do // dran nas lkog tu gyur pa la 'jug pa des na dran pa tshad ma yin gyi rjes su dpag pa 'jug par byed pa'i phyir ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, memory is useless.üîΩIf you say that memory engages the object that is hidden from view, and therefore memory is a means of valid cognition, not inference,

original: dran nas 'jug go zhes bya ba 'dis ni rnam par dpyad par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dran nas 'jug go zhes bya ba 'dis ni rnam par dpyad par bya ba yin no //
translated: then we reply that it is necessary to analyze the statement ‚Äúmemory engages the object that is hidden from view.‚Äù

original: ci de'i dus la 'jug par byed dam /
analyzed: ci de'i dus la 'jug par byed dam /
translated: Does memory engage the object at the time of the object‚Äôs existence?

original: 'on te de lta ma yin /
analyzed: 'on te de lta ma yin /
translated: Or does it not?

original: gal te de yi dus la ni //
analyzed: gal te de yi dus la ni //
translated: If it engages the object at the time of the object‚Äôs existence,

original: 'jug na de'i thob mi nus so //
analyzed: 'jug na de'i thob mi nus so //
translated: then it cannot obtain the object.

original: rtog ldan thob bya'i don la ni //
analyzed: rtog ldan thob bya'i don la ni //
translated: A conceptual cognition engages the object that is to be obtained,

original: 'jug par 'gyur gyi gzhan du min //
analyzed: 'jug par 'gyur gyi gzhan du min //
translated: but not otherwise.

original: da ltar ba'i dus la ni dran par rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: da ltar ba'i dus la ni dran par rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: Memory does not cognize the object at the time of the object‚Äôs existence.

original: des na ci ltar tshad ma yin //
analyzed: des na ci ltar tshad ma yin //
translated: Therefore, how can it be a means of valid cognition?

original: sngar ni dus kyi don la lkog tu gyur pa nyid du rtogs pa yin na de ni thob par mi nus so //
analyzed: sngar ni dus kyi don la lkog tu gyur pa nyid du rtogs pa yin na de ni thob par mi nus so //
translated: If memory cognizes the object at the time of the object‚Äôs existence, then it cannot obtain the object.

original: yang na lkog tu gyur pa nyid ni mngon sum nyid kyis 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na lkog tu gyur pa nyid ni mngon sum nyid kyis 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: Or, if the object is hidden from view, then it is apprehended by perception.

original: mngon sum gyis de'i dus kyi mthar thug par gzung ba gang yin pa de nyid dus phyis la ltos te /üîΩlkog tu gyur pa nyid do /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis de'i dus kyi mthar thug par gzung ba gang yin pa de nyid dus phyis la ltos te / lkog tu gyur pa nyid do /
translated: That which is apprehended by direct perception as the ultimate at that time is the same thing that is considered to be hidden from view at a later time.

original: de'i rnam pa nyid ni bag chags kyi stobs las dran pa 'di'i bdag nyid du gyur pa kho na'o //üîΩde ni de lta bur gyur pa'i //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa nyid ni bag chags kyi stobs las dran pa 'di'i bdag nyid du gyur pa kho na'o // de ni de lta bur gyur pa'i //
translated: Its aspect is only the nature of memory, which comes about through the power of the latent impressions.

original: don nyid ce na don mos med //
analyzed: don nyid ce na don mos med //
translated: It is not the case that the nature of that which is to be known by means of reflexive awareness is determined as being either a real object or not a real object.

original: mos pa yi ni dbang nyid las //
analyzed: mos pa yi ni dbang nyid las //
translated: It is determined by the subsequent belief.

original: de nyid de nyid min par gnas //üîΩrang rig pas rtogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid ni don ce 'am /
analyzed: de nyid de nyid min par gnas // rang rig pas rtogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid ni don ce 'am /
translated: It abides as being that and not being that,üîΩdue to the power of belief.

original: don ma yin no zhes rnam par gnas par 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: don ma yin no zhes rnam par gnas par 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
translated: The nature of that which is to be known by means of reflexive awareness is not determined as being either a real object or not a real object.

original: de'i 'og tu byung ba'i mos pas rnam par 'jog @298b pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu byung ba'i mos pas rnam par 'jog @298b pa yin no //
translated: It is determined by the subsequent belief.

original: dran pa'i rnam pa la ni de yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dran pa'i rnam pa la ni de yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The aspect of memory does not have that.

original: 'di ltar rtogs pa dang ldan pa dag don gang yin pa de ni sngon mthong ba yin la rnam pa 'di ni de ltar goms pa'i stobs las skye ba can yin no zhes rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar rtogs pa dang ldan pa dag don gang yin pa de ni sngon mthong ba yin la rnam pa 'di ni de ltar goms pa'i stobs las skye ba can yin no zhes rtogs par byed do //
translated: Thus, those who have this understanding realize that the object is what was seen before, and that this aspect is born from the power of habituation.

original: de'i phyir bde sog rang nyid la //
analyzed: de'i phyir bde sog rang nyid la //
translated: Therefore, the self is not the experiencer of pleasure and so on.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äútransference‚Äù is that these

original: 'phos pa'i don ni snang ba dang // rang bdag rig byed 'di dag ni //
analyzed: 'phos pa'i don ni snang ba dang // rang bdag rig byed 'di dag ni //
translated: appearances and self-awareness

original: don las skye ba tsam du zad //
analyzed: don las skye ba tsam du zad //
translated: are born from the object alone.

original: ci ltar myong ba'i 'du byed las skyes pa'i dran pa rang la 'phos pa'i don gyi rnam pa rig par byed pa yin pa de bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa yang yin te /
analyzed: ci ltar myong ba'i 'du byed las skyes pa'i dran pa rang la 'phos pa'i don gyi rnam pa rig par byed pa yin pa de bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa yang yin te /
translated: Just as memory born from the formative force of experience causes one to be aware of the aspect of the object that has been transferred to it, so it is with pleasure and so on.

original: 'di ltar de dag kyang goms pa'i 'du byed las byung ba nang gi rig pa'i khyad par bdag nyid du gyur pa kho na'i rig par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag kyang goms pa'i 'du byed las byung ba nang gi rig pa'i khyad par bdag nyid du gyur pa kho na'i rig par byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, these are born from the formative force of habituation, and they cause one to be aware of the special inner awareness that has become the self alone.

original: 'o na ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i don la ltos she na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i don la ltos she na /
translated: Well, how do they depend on objects such as form?

original: de'i sgo nas de dang rjes su mthun pa'i bag chags sang pa'i phyir ro //üîΩreg pa 'brel pa las byung ba'i //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas de dang rjes su mthun pa'i bag chags sang pa'i phyir ro // reg pa 'brel pa las byung ba'i //
translated: because the latent impressions that correspond to that are awakened by that.

original: bde ba'i rnam par myong ba las //
analyzed: bde ba'i rnam par myong ba las //
translated: From the experience of pleasureüîΩthat arises from contact,

original: skye bar gyur pa'i 'du byed de //
analyzed: skye bar gyur pa'i 'du byed de //
translated: the formative forces arise.

original: de mthong ba las sad par 'gyur //
analyzed: de mthong ba las sad par 'gyur //
translated: One awakens from that by seeing.

original: 'khyud pa'i bde ba myong ba las shin tu brten par skyes pa'i bag chags ni phyis de 'dra ba'i gzugs mthong bas sad par gyur pa na de lta bur gyur pa nyid kyis nang gi rig pa'i bde ba skyed par byed do //
analyzed: 'khyud pa'i bde ba myong ba las shin tu brten par skyes pa'i bag chags ni phyis de 'dra ba'i gzugs mthong bas sad par gyur pa na de lta bur gyur pa nyid kyis nang gi rig pa'i bde ba skyed par byed do //
translated: The latent impressions that are produced by the experience of the pleasure of embracing are awakened by the later seeing of a similar form. Then, by becoming just like that, the pleasure of inner knowledge arises.

original: 'di nyid ston par byed pa ni //üîΩdon gyi bdag nyid de dag gi //
analyzed: 'di nyid ston par byed pa ni // don gyi bdag nyid de dag gi //
translated: This is what is being taught:üîΩThe experience of those

original: rang gi bdag gyur des myong yin //
analyzed: rang gi bdag gyur des myong yin //
translated: that have the nature of objects is due to their own nature.

original: des na don snang ba bshad de //
analyzed: des na don snang ba bshad de //
translated: Therefore, the appearance of objects is explained.

original: dmigs pa nyid ni der snang ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa nyid ni der snang ba'o //
translated: The object itself appears as that.

original: nang gi rig pa'i khyad par rung gi bdag nyid du gyur pa nyid bde ba la sogs pas myong ba yin no //
analyzed: nang gi rig pa'i khyad par rung gi bdag nyid du gyur pa nyid bde ba la sogs pas myong ba yin no //
translated: The experience of pleasure, etc. is due to the very nature of the special inner knowledge.

original: de nyid kyi phyir don myong bar brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir don myong bar brjod pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the object is experienced.

original: de lta ma yin te gzhan du gyur pa myong ba yin na nges zhes 'brel par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩ'di ltar / gang phyir ngo bo'i rgyu las ni //
analyzed: de lta ma yin te gzhan du gyur pa myong ba yin na nges zhes 'brel par mi 'gyur ro // 'di ltar / gang phyir ngo bo'i rgyu las ni //
translated: If it were otherwise, if the object were not experienced, then the statement ‚Äúit is known‚Äù would not be tenable.üîΩThus:üîΩIt is reasonable that one‚Äôs own nature is experienced,

original: rang gi ngo bo myong bar rigs //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo myong bar rigs //
translated: because the cause of that nature is one‚Äôs own nature.

original: gzhan gyi ngo bo myong ba ni //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bo myong ba ni //
translated: But how can the nature of another be experienced,

original: ci ltar de yi tha dad phyir //
analyzed: ci ltar de yi tha dad phyir //
translated: because it is different from it?

original: gzhan ni gzhan gyi ngo bo min //
analyzed: gzhan ni gzhan gyi ngo bo min //
translated: Another is not the nature of another,

original: ci ltar de las gzhan gsal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ci ltar de las gzhan gsal bar 'gyur //
translated: so how can it be manifested by that?

original: sgron ma las ni bum pa la //
analyzed: sgron ma las ni bum pa la //
translated: A lamp manifests a pot,

original: de 'dra'i gsal ba skye ba yin //üîΩgsal ba'i rnam par shes pa las //
analyzed: de 'dra'i gsal ba skye ba yin // gsal ba'i rnam par shes pa las //
translated: but it does not manifest itself.

original: don gsal ba ni skye min gyi //üîΩ'bras nyid yin na shes pa des //
analyzed: don gsal ba ni skye min gyi // 'bras nyid yin na shes pa des //
translated: The manifestation of an object does not arise from a consciousness that is a manifestation,

original: de ni ci ltar rtog par 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni ci ltar rtog par 'gyur //
translated: but if it is the effect, how can that consciousness know it?

original: gang zhig gi 'bras bu gang yin pa'i rgyu des ni rtogs pa ma yin no zhes 'thad do //
analyzed: gang zhig gi 'bras bu gang yin pa'i rgyu des ni rtogs pa ma yin no zhes 'thad do //
translated: It is reasonable that a cause of something does not know that thing, whose effect it is.

original: de lta ma yin na blo las skyes pa'i lus kyi bya ba des rig @299a * //üîΩpar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na blo las skyes pa'i lus kyi bya ba des rig @299a * //üîΩpar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were otherwise, then the bodily action that arises from the mind would know it.

original: de'i phyir rang gi ngo bo nyid rig par 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi ngo bo nyid rig par 'thad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is tenable that it is reflexive awareness.

original: 'on te mngon du phyogs par 'gyur bas rig pa yin gyi rang rig pas ni ma yin no zhe na de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'on te mngon du phyogs par 'gyur bas rig pa yin gyi rang rig pas ni ma yin no zhe na de ni mi rigs te /
translated: But if you say that it is awareness because it is directed toward itself, not because of reflexive awareness, that is illogical.

original: rang bzhin mngon du phyogs gyur pas //
analyzed: rang bzhin mngon du phyogs gyur pas //
translated: Because it is directed toward its own nature,

original: gal te rang rgyu las skye na //
analyzed: gal te rang rgyu las skye na //
translated: If it arises from its own cause,

original: gang gis de ni rig 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang gis de ni rig 'gyur ba //
translated: By what is it made aware?

original: 'dir ni don la ci zhig yod //
analyzed: 'dir ni don la ci zhig yod //
translated: What is the meaning here?

original: 'on te de ni don las kyang //
analyzed: 'on te de ni don las kyang //
translated: But if it is directed toward its object,

original: mngon phyogs yin pas de skad brjod //
analyzed: mngon phyogs yin pas de skad brjod //
translated: It is said to be directed toward itself.

original: mig las kyang ni mngon phyogs 'gyur //
analyzed: mig las kyang ni mngon phyogs 'gyur //
translated: But it is also directed toward the eye.

original: de ni ci ltar de rig min //
analyzed: de ni ci ltar de rig min //
translated: How is it not aware of that?

original: dbang po don la phyogs she na //
analyzed: dbang po don la phyogs she na //
translated: If you say that the sense faculty is directed toward the object,

original: don la zhes byar ci ltar 'dod //
analyzed: don la zhes byar ci ltar 'dod //
translated: How do you assert that it is directed toward the object?

original: gal te don ni rig na 'di //
analyzed: gal te don ni rig na 'di //
translated: If the object is aware,

original: don la phyogs par rig par 'gyur //
analyzed: don la phyogs par rig par 'gyur //
translated: It would be aware of being directed toward the object.

original: don rang gi ngo bos ma rtogs par ni de la mngon du phyogs pa nyid rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don rang gi ngo bos ma rtogs par ni de la mngon du phyogs pa nyid rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Without realizing the object by its own nature, it is not a realization that is directed toward it.

original: gal te don rang nyid rig go zhe na /
analyzed: gal te don rang nyid rig go zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the object itself is aware,

original: da ni rig pa mngon sum du phyogs pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: da ni rig pa mngon sum du phyogs pas ci zhig bya /
translated: Now, what is the use of directing awareness to the object?

original: grub par nye bar gnas pa la ni de nye par mkho ba ma yin no //
analyzed: grub par nye bar gnas pa la ni de nye par mkho ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not necessary for one who is about to attain the object to direct awareness to it.

original: de med par don snang bar mi rtogs so zhe na 'o na de dang lhan cig pa nyid du rig par 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu zad de de las gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de med par don snang bar mi rtogs so zhe na 'o na de dang lhan cig pa nyid du rig par 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu zad de de las gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: If you say that the object is not cognized without awareness, then it is only awareness that is cognized simultaneously with itself, and not the object.

original: des na de 'dzin to zhes bya ba 'di ni g-yar po'i rgyan no //
analyzed: des na de 'dzin to zhes bya ba 'di ni g-yar po'i rgyan no //
translated: Therefore, the statement ‚ÄúIt apprehends itself‚Äù is a mere boast.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / 'ga' zhig bde sogs phyi rol na //
analyzed: gzhan yang / 'ga' zhig bde sogs phyi rol na //
translated: Some say that pleasure and so on

original: gnas nyid dang ni sems med dang // gzung bar smra ste de yi yang //
analyzed: gnas nyid dang ni sems med dang // gzung bar smra ste de yi yang //
translated: are external, nonmental, and apprehended.

original: cig car gnyis 'dzin mi rigs so //
analyzed: cig car gnyis 'dzin mi rigs so //
translated: But it is not reasonable that two thingsüîΩare apprehended simultaneously.

original: nges par 'dzin zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: nges par 'dzin zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúapprehends‚Äù is left incomplete.

original: sngon po la sogs pa bzhin du rang dbang du dmigs pa yin na nges par sngon po la sogs pa gzhan dang lhan cig 'dzin te zhes bya ba'i rgyu ni med do //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa bzhin du rang dbang du dmigs pa yin na nges par sngon po la sogs pa gzhan dang lhan cig 'dzin te zhes bya ba'i rgyu ni med do //
translated: If pleasure and so on are perceived independently, like blue and so on, there is no reason to say that they are apprehended together with something else, such as blue.

original: 'on te bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'di dag ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gtso bo'i yongs su gyur pa yin te 'di ltar /
analyzed: 'on te bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'di dag ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gtso bo'i yongs su gyur pa yin te 'di ltar /
translated: Or, are these such things as pleasure and pain the transformation of the primal matter that has the nature of pleasure and pain?

original: gzhung lugs ni gtso bo las ni chen po /
analyzed: gzhung lugs ni gtso bo las ni chen po /
translated: The philosophical system of the Samkhya is as follows: From the primal matter, the great one arises.

original: chen po las nga rgyal /
analyzed: chen po las nga rgyal /
translated: From the great one, the I-principle arises.

original: nga rgyal las de tsam lnga dang / blo'i dbang po lnga dang / las kyi dbang po lnga dang / yid do //
analyzed: nga rgyal las de tsam lnga dang / blo'i dbang po lnga dang / las kyi dbang po lnga dang / yid do //
translated: From the I-principle, the five subtle objects, the five sense faculties, the five action faculties, and the mind arise.

original: de tsam lnga las ni 'byung ba chen po lnga ste /
analyzed: de tsam lnga las ni 'byung ba chen po lnga ste /
translated: From the five subtle objects, the five great elements arise.

original: de ltar rnam par 'gyur ba'i rigs mtha' dag ni 'di tsam du zad do //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par 'gyur ba'i rigs mtha' dag ni 'di tsam du zad do //
translated: Thus, all the various types of transformations are just these.

original: rnam par 'gyur ba yang rang bzhin gyi rjes su 'gro ba can yin te /
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba yang rang bzhin gyi rjes su 'gro ba can yin te /
translated: Moreover, the transformations follow the nature of the primal matter.

original: dper na 'jim pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dper na 'jim pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: For example, it is like the transformations of clay, such as pots.

original: 'dir brjod pa /
analyzed: 'dir brjod pa /
translated: Here we say:üîΩIf blue and so on are of the nature of pleasure and so on,

original: sngo sogs rang bzhin bde sogs dang // gcig phyir @299b cig car 'dzin ce na //
analyzed: sngo sogs rang bzhin bde sogs dang // gcig phyir @299b cig car 'dzin ce na //
translated: then they are apprehended simultaneously.

original: tha dad snang can sems kyis ni //
analyzed: tha dad snang can sems kyis ni //
translated: But the mind that perceives them as different

original: gzung de ji ltar tha mi dad //
analyzed: gzung de ji ltar tha mi dad //
translated: How can the object be nondifferent from that?

original: bde ba la sogs pa ni bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gtso bo'i yongs su gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las yin /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa ni bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gtso bo'i yongs su gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las yin /
translated: How do you know that pleasure, etc., are transformations of the primal matter, which is of the nature of pleasure, etc.?

original: de'i rang bzhin rjes su 'gro bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin rjes su 'gro bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because we see that the nature of the effect is the same as that of the cause.

original: 'di ltar 'dzin pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba ni de'i rjes su 'gro ba can du mthong ngo zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dzin pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba ni de'i rjes su 'gro ba can du mthong ngo zhe na /
translated: We see that the transformation of the apprehender is of the same nature as that of the object.

original: 'di ltar ma nges ba nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'di ltar ma nges ba nyid ma yin nam /
translated: But this is not certain.

original: sgra rnga bo che dang dbyig pa'i sbyor ba las skyes pa yin yang rnga bo che dang dbyig pa'i rjes su 'gro ba can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra rnga bo che dang dbyig pa'i sbyor ba las skyes pa yin yang rnga bo che dang dbyig pa'i rjes su 'gro ba can ni ma yin no //
translated: Even though sound is produced by the conjunction of the drum and the stick, it is not of the nature of the drum and the stick.

original: gal te yang rlung ngam sgra'i rdul phra rab sgra nyid du gyur par 'dod pa /
analyzed: gal te yang rlung ngam sgra'i rdul phra rab sgra nyid du gyur par 'dod pa /
translated: If you maintain that the subtle particles of wind or sound are sound,

original: de lta na yang de grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang de grub pa ma yin no //
translated: then that is not established.

original: 'on te 'jim pa'i 'gyur ba bzhin du 'dir yang rigs mtshungs pa'i rgyu brtag pa yin na /
analyzed: 'on te 'jim pa'i 'gyur ba bzhin du 'dir yang rigs mtshungs pa'i rgyu brtag pa yin na /
translated: If you imagine that the cause is of the same kind as the clay pot,üîΩthen that is not so.

original: de lta na ni 'o na de'i rang bzhin can gyi 'bras bu gang ci snyed pa de thams cad rigs mi mthun pa las yin te /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na de'i rang bzhin can gyi 'bras bu gang ci snyed pa de thams cad rigs mi mthun pa las yin te /
translated: If that is so, then all effects that have that nature arise from dissimilar types,

original: dper na sgra la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sgra la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like sound and so on.

original: bum pa la sogs pa yang 'bras bu yin pas /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa yang 'bras bu yin pas /
translated: Also, a pot and so on is an effect,

original: de yang rigs mi mthun pa nyid las yin no //
analyzed: de yang rigs mi mthun pa nyid las yin no //
translated: and it too arises from dissimilar types.

original: rdza mkhan la sogs pa ni rigs mi mthun pa yin te /üîΩdes na thams cad mthun pa las skye ba yin no zhes bya ba'i khyab pa med pa'am /
analyzed: rdza mkhan la sogs pa ni rigs mi mthun pa yin te / des na thams cad mthun pa las skye ba yin no zhes bya ba'i khyab pa med pa'am /
translated: Potters and so on are dissimilar types,üîΩand therefore all arise from similar types.

original: rigs mi mthun pa las skye ba yin pa'i phyir bzlog pa grub bo /
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa las skye ba yin pa'i phyir bzlog pa grub bo /
translated: There is no pervasion, or the opposite is established because of arising from dissimilar types.

original: lhan cig pa ma yin pa'i rigs mthun pa'i rgyu ni 'gar yang mthong ba med do //
analyzed: lhan cig pa ma yin pa'i rigs mthun pa'i rgyu ni 'gar yang mthong ba med do //
translated: A cause of a similar type that is not coexistent is never seen.

original: 'on te thams cad bde ba la sogs pa rjes su 'gro ba can du mthong ba nges na bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid rgyu yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te thams cad bde ba la sogs pa rjes su 'gro ba can du mthong ba nges na bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid rgyu yin par 'gyur te /
translated: But if it is ascertained that all are pervaded by pleasure and so on, then the nature of pleasure and so on would be the cause.

original: 'ji ba'i rnam par 'gyur ba rnams kyi sa 'jim gong bzhin no zhen 'di la bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'ji ba'i rnam par 'gyur ba rnams kyi sa 'jim gong bzhin no zhen 'di la bshad zin to //
translated: This has already been explained.

original: lhan cig pa gzhan yang rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: lhan cig pa gzhan yang rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Because other things that exist simultaneously are also causes.

original: des na rigs mthun pa dang mi mthun pa rgyu yin par thal bas gtso bo mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: des na rigs mthun pa dang mi mthun pa rgyu yin par thal bas gtso bo mi 'grub bo //
translated: Therefore, since it follows that homogeneous and heterogeneous causes are causes, the primal substance is not established.

original: gzhan yang bde ba la sogs pa yang gzung ba nyid la sogs pa rjes su 'gro bas bzung ba'i gtso bo gzhan 'grub bo //
analyzed: gzhan yang bde ba la sogs pa yang gzung ba nyid la sogs pa rjes su 'gro bas bzung ba'i gtso bo gzhan 'grub bo //
translated: Moreover, since pleasure and so on are concomitant with apprehended objects and so forth, another primal substance that is the apprehended object is established.

original: des na mthar bzung ba nyid dang dngos po nyid la sogs pa rgyu yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na mthar bzung ba nyid dang dngos po nyid la sogs pa rgyu yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, in the end, the apprehended object, entity, and so on would be the cause.

original: 'on te de yang bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can yin te /
analyzed: 'on te de yang bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can yin te /
translated: But if you say that is also the nature of pleasure and so on,

original: dngos po nyid la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba can ni bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po nyid la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba can ni bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because that which is concomitant with entity and so on is the nature of pleasure and so on,

original: de lta na ni 'o na bde ba las sogs pa bum pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na bde ba las sogs pa bum pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir na /
translated: then in that case, since pleasure and so on is the nature of a pot and so on,

original: gtso bo bum pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can @300a * //
analyzed: gtso bo bum pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can @300a * //
translated: and the principal nature of the pot, etc.

original: du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: would follow.

original: 'on te de ni thams cad kyi bdag nyid can du 'dod pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de ni thams cad kyi bdag nyid can du 'dod pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: But if you maintain that it is the nature of everything,

original: gal te rnam par 'gyur ba'i tshogs mtha' dag gtso bo'i bdag nyid la rang bzhin de nyid kyis phan tshun ldog par yod pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par 'gyur ba'i tshogs mtha' dag gtso bo'i bdag nyid la rang bzhin de nyid kyis phan tshun ldog par yod pa yin na /
translated: if the entire collection of modifications exists in the principal nature as a mutual exclusion by virtue of its own nature,

original: 'di la rang bzhin dang rnam par 'gyur ba'i dngos bo ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'di la rang bzhin dang rnam par 'gyur ba'i dngos bo ci zhig yod /
translated: what is the nature of the thing that is the modification?

original: mngon par gsal ba dang mi gsal ba tsam ste /
analyzed: mngon par gsal ba dang mi gsal ba tsam ste /
translated: It is merely the manifest and the unmanifest.

original: mngon par gsal ba'i rnam par 'gyur ba yin la mi gsal ba'i ni rang bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: mngon par gsal ba'i rnam par 'gyur ba yin la mi gsal ba'i ni rang bzhin no zhe na /
translated: The manifest is the modification and the unmanifest is the nature.

original: mngon par gsal ba zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yin la mi gsal ba yang ci zhig yin /
analyzed: mngon par gsal ba zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yin la mi gsal ba yang ci zhig yin /
translated: What is this so-called manifest? What is the unmanifest?

original: gsal ba ni mngon par gsal ba yin la /
analyzed: gsal ba ni mngon par gsal ba yin la /
translated: The manifest is the manifest,

original: de med pa ni mi gsal ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de med pa ni mi gsal ba yin no zhe na /
translated: and the absence of that is the unmanifest.

original: gsal ba 'di ci zhig mthong ba'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: gsal ba 'di ci zhig mthong ba'i bdag nyid do //
translated: What is this manifest? It is the nature of what is seen.

original: de med pa'i mi dmigs pa ni mi gsal ba'o //
analyzed: de med pa'i mi dmigs pa ni mi gsal ba'o //
translated: Non-apprehension of that which does not exist is not clear.

original: tshad mas rang gi ngo bo grub pa na /
analyzed: tshad mas rang gi ngo bo grub pa na /
translated: When the nature of something is established by a valid cognition,

original: de dmigs zhes bya bar nus pa yin gyi grub na ni med pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: de dmigs zhes bya bar nus pa yin gyi grub na ni med pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: it is possible to say that it is apprehended. But if it is established, is it not nonexistent?

original: des na snga na med pa yin pa'i phyir gtso bo mi 'grub bo//
analyzed: des na snga na med pa yin pa'i phyir gtso bo mi 'grub bo//
translated: Therefore, since it does not exist previously, the primal substance is not established.

original: gal te bum pa la sogs pa sngar de ltar yod pa nyid ma dmigs pa yin na yang na gtso bo rgyur brtag pas ci bya /
analyzed: gal te bum pa la sogs pa sngar de ltar yod pa nyid ma dmigs pa yin na yang na gtso bo rgyur brtag pas ci bya /
translated: If a pot, etc., is not apprehended as existing in that way previously, then what is the use of postulating the primal substance as a cause?

original: de dag gi bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid gtso bo yin no zhe na ma yin te //
analyzed: de dag gi bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid gtso bo yin no zhe na ma yin te //
translated: If the nature of pleasure, etc., is the primal substance, no.

original: bde sog pa'i rang bzhin las tha dad par gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde sog pa'i rang bzhin las tha dad par gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because pleasure, etc., are apprehended as different from the nature of pleasure, etc.

original: tha dad par snang ba can gyi gzung ba tha dad pa ma yin par yang ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: tha dad par snang ba can gyi gzung ba tha dad pa ma yin par yang ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: How can that which appears as different be apprehended as not different?üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / phyi de khyad par yod na ni yang //
analyzed: gzhan yang / phyi de khyad par yod na ni yang //
translated: If there is a difference in the external,üîΩthen there is no difference in the internal.

original: goms pa yi ni khyad par las //
analyzed: goms pa yi ni khyad par las //
translated: From the difference in cultivation,

original: blo la dga' yang yongs su gdung //
analyzed: blo la dga' yang yongs su gdung //
translated: the mind is tormented, even though it is pleased.

original: khyad par du ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par du ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: There is no difference.

original: gal te bde ba la sogs pa sngon po la sogs pa phyi rol gyi rang bzhin nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te bde ba la sogs pa sngon po la sogs pa phyi rol gyi rang bzhin nyid yin na /
translated: If pleasure, etc. were external objects by nature, like blue, etc.,

original: 'o na ni sngon po la sogs pa nyid bzhin du bsgoms pa'i khyad par las dga' ba dang gdung ba la sogs pa khyad par du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni sngon po la sogs pa nyid bzhin du bsgoms pa'i khyad par las dga' ba dang gdung ba la sogs pa khyad par du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then, just like blue, etc., they would not be distinguished as pleasant, unpleasant, etc. by the power of meditation.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du snang ba ni /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du snang ba ni /
translated: The appearance as the nature of blue, etc.

original: bsgoms pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par du 'gyur bar ma dmigs so //
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par du 'gyur bar ma dmigs so //
translated: is not observed to be distinguished by the power of meditation.

original: de lta yin no zhe na ni nang dang phyi rol mtha' dag goms pa'i rjes su 'gro ba can yin pa de'i phyir 'gro ba mtha' dag ni goms pa'i stobs las skyes pas de kho na ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin no zhe na ni nang dang phyi rol mtha' dag goms pa'i rjes su 'gro ba can yin pa de'i phyir 'gro ba mtha' dag ni goms pa'i stobs las skyes pas de kho na ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then since the entire external and internal world is subject to the power of meditation, the entire world would not be reality, because it is born from the power of meditation.

original: gal te bde ba la sogs pa phyi rol yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te bde ba la sogs pa phyi rol yin na ni /
translated: If pleasure, etc. were external,

original: phyi rol gyi rang bzhin du snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rang bzhin du snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: they would appear as external objects.

original: de ni 'khrul pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'khrul pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that is an error, no.

original: 'khrul pa'i rgyu ma mthong ba'i phyir dang / gnod pa med @300b pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te blo yang bde sogs kyi //üîΩbdag nyid yin pas mi 'gal na //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rgyu ma mthong ba'i phyir dang / gnod pa med @300b pa'i phyir ro // gal te blo yang bde sogs kyi // bdag nyid yin pas mi 'gal na //
translated: because the cause of error is not seen, and because there is no refutation of it.üîΩIf you say that there is no contradiction

original: de ni phyi de bde sogs kyi //
analyzed: de ni phyi de bde sogs kyi //
translated: because the cognition is of the nature of pleasure, etc.,

original: bdag nyid yin zhes ci ltar rtogs //
analyzed: bdag nyid yin zhes ci ltar rtogs //
translated: how do you know that it isüîΩof the nature of external pleasure, etc.?

original: bsam pa 'di yin par 'gyur te ci ltar sgra la sogs pa gtso bo yongs su gyur pa'i rang bzhin yin pa de bzhin du blo yang yin no //
analyzed: bsam pa 'di yin par 'gyur te ci ltar sgra la sogs pa gtso bo yongs su gyur pa'i rang bzhin yin pa de bzhin du blo yang yin no //
translated: The idea is as follows: Just as sound, etc. is of the nature of the transformation of primal matter, so is cognition.

original: des na bdag gi blo'i rang bzhin gyi bde ba la sogs pa rig pa nges pa kho nar phyi rol ma yin pa'i rang bzhin du rig pa yin la /
analyzed: des na bdag gi blo'i rang bzhin gyi bde ba la sogs pa rig pa nges pa kho nar phyi rol ma yin pa'i rang bzhin du rig pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is certain that the cognition of pleasure, etc. which is of the nature of the self is known to be of the nature of the non-external.

original: bsgoms pa'i khyad par gyis blo khyad par du gyur pa na /
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i khyad par gyis blo khyad par du gyur pa na /
translated: When the cognition is transformed by the transformation of meditation,

original: de'i bdag nyid can gyi bde ba la sogs pa yang khyad par du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid can gyi bde ba la sogs pa yang khyad par du 'gyur ro //
translated: the pleasure, etc. which is of its nature is also transformed.

original: bsgoms pa zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal dang yid kyi 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgoms pa zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal dang yid kyi 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Meditation is the activity of the self and the mind.

original: nga rgyal de yang blo la nga'o snyam pa yin zhing yid kyang kun du rtog pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nga rgyal de yang blo la nga'o snyam pa yin zhing yid kyang kun du rtog pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, that pride is the mind thinking ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù and the mind is the nature of imagination.

original: yid kyi kun du rtog pa yang nas yang du gyur pa nyid bsgoms pa yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi kun du rtog pa yang nas yang du gyur pa nyid bsgoms pa yin te /
translated: The imagination of the mind is repeatedly transformed through meditation.

original: des na snying stobs las byung ba'i bdag nyid nga rgyal la rag las pa'i blo bde ba'i bdag nyid rtogs pa ni de ltar gsal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: des na snying stobs las byung ba'i bdag nyid nga rgyal la rag las pa'i blo bde ba'i bdag nyid rtogs pa ni de ltar gsal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the mind, which is the nature of bliss, is dependent on the pride that is the nature of sattva, and thus it becomes clear.

original: gal te de lta na bde ba la sogs pa'i phyi rol gyi ngo bo yin no zhes ji ltar rtogs pa'i phyi rol sgra la sogs pa yang gtso bo yongs su gyur pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yang lan du 'brel pa ma yinüîΩte / sgra sogs gtso ba'i yongs gyur las //
analyzed: gal te de lta na bde ba la sogs pa'i phyi rol gyi ngo bo yin no zhes ji ltar rtogs pa'i phyi rol sgra la sogs pa yang gtso bo yongs su gyur pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yang lan du 'brel pa ma yin te / sgra sogs gtso ba'i yongs gyur las //
translated: If that is so, then it is not tenable to reply, ‚ÄúThe nature of external things such as pleasure is known,‚Äù because external things such as sound are the nature of the transformation of the primal matter.üîΩHow do you know that sound and so on

original: byung ba de nyid ga las shes //üîΩ'di dag de yi rang bzhin gyi //
analyzed: byung ba de nyid ga las shes // 'di dag de yi rang bzhin gyi //
translated: arise from the transformation of the primal?üîΩYou do not know that they are

original: rjes su 'gro bar rtogs ma yin //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro bar rtogs ma yin //
translated: the nature of that through inference.

original: gal te blo bzhin du dgra la sogs pa la yang bde ba la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro bar tshad mas nges pa yin na de'i tshe 'bras bu rgyu'i rjes su 'gro ba can yin pas na 'gro ba la gnas pa'i skye bos de lta bu'i rgyus bskyed
analyzed: gal te blo bzhin du dgra la sogs pa la yang bde ba la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro bar tshad mas nges pa yin na de'i tshe 'bras bu rgyu'i rjes su 'gro ba can yin pas na 'gro ba la gnas pa'i skye bos de lta bu'i rgyus bskyed
translated: If it were ascertained by valid knowledge that pleasure and so on follow after enemies and so on just as they do after the mind, then at that time, since the effect would follow after the cause, beings who are abiding in the world would be produced by such a cause.üîΩ

original: pa yin par shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa yin par shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is ascertained by a valid cognition that pleasure and so on follow from enemies and so forth just as they do from friends, then at that time, since the effect follows from the cause, the beings who abide in the world would know that it is produced by such a cause.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi gtso bo'i yongs su gyur pa yin pa nyid kyis de ltar nges so zhe na /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi gtso bo'i yongs su gyur pa yin pa nyid kyis de ltar nges so zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is ascertained in that way because it is a transformation of the primary nature that has the nature of pleasure and so on,

original: 'di ni phan tshun brten pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ni phan tshun brten pa nyid de /
translated: then this is mutual dependence.

original: 'di ltar / 'di ni gtso bo'i yongs gyur nyid //üîΩyin par shes na bde sogs nyid //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'di ni gtso bo'i yongs gyur nyid // yin par shes na bde sogs nyid //
translated: Thus if it is known that it is a transformation of the primary nature,üîΩthen pleasure and so on are known.

original: bde sogs nyid du shes pas kyang //
analyzed: bde sogs nyid du shes pas kyang //
translated: And if pleasure and so on are known,

original: sgra sogs de nyid yin par nges //
analyzed: sgra sogs de nyid yin par nges //
translated: then sound and so on are ascertained to be that.

original: sgra la sogs pa gtso bo'i yongs su gyur pa yin na bde ba la sogs pa rjes su 'gro ba yin la /
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa gtso bo'i yongs su gyur pa yin na bde ba la sogs pa rjes su 'gro ba yin la /
translated: If sound and so on are a transformation of the primary nature, then they follow from pleasure and so on.

original: bde ba la sogs pa rjes su 'gro bar nges pa yang gtso bo yongs su gyur pa'i rang bzhin nyid du 'gyur bas /üîΩgcig ma grub na gnyi ga @301a * //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa rjes su 'gro bar nges pa yang gtso bo yongs su gyur pa'i rang bzhin nyid du 'gyur bas / gcig ma grub na gnyi ga @301a * //
translated: Also, the certainty of pleasure and so on following is the nature of the transformation of the primal substance.

original: yang mi 'grub bo /
analyzed: yang mi 'grub bo /
translated: If one is not established, both are not established.

original: gzhan yang / gal te du ba me yongs su gyur pa'i rang bzhin yin pa de lta mod kyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te du ba me yongs su gyur pa'i rang bzhin yin pa de lta mod kyi /
translated: Moreover, if smoke is the nature of the transformation of fire,

original: de 'bar ba nyid yin par 'grub bam //
analyzed: de 'bar ba nyid yin par 'grub bam //
translated: is it established as blazing?

original: cig mngon sum gyis gnod pa'i phyir de lta ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: cig mngon sum gyis gnod pa'i phyir de lta ma yin no zhe na /
translated: No, because it is undermined by direct perception.

original: sgra la sogs pa la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa la yang mtshungs so //
translated: Sound and so on are similar.

original: 'di snyam du gal te sgra la sogs pa bde ba'i rang bzhin ma yin na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te sgra la sogs pa bde ba'i rang bzhin ma yin na /
translated: If you think that if sound and so on are not by nature pleasure,

original: blo de dag gis 'dzin par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: blo de dag gis 'dzin par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: they would not be apprehended by those cognitions,

original: rigs tha dad pa gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rigs tha dad pa gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it is not tenable that different types are the object apprehended and the apprehender.

original: 'di la bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa /
translated: The response to that is this:

original: gal te rigs ni tha dad ngag / gzung 'dzin min na skyes bu ni //
analyzed: gal te rigs ni tha dad ngag / gzung 'dzin min na skyes bu ni //
translated: If different types are not the object apprehended and the apprehender,

original: kun gyi 'dzin byed mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: kun gyi 'dzin byed mi 'gyur te //
translated: then the person would not be the apprehender of all.

original: des na za ba po nyid nyams //
analyzed: des na za ba po nyid nyams //
translated: Therefore, the person would not be an experiencer.

original: skyes bu ni sgra la sogs pa dang rigs mthun pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu ni sgra la sogs pa dang rigs mthun pa ma yin te /
translated: The person is not of the same class as sound, etc.

original: de gtso bo'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dang / bde ba la sogs pa ni bzlog pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde 'dzin par byed pa ma yin du zad mod ce na ma yin te /
analyzed: de gtso bo'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dang / bde ba la sogs pa ni bzlog pa'i phyir ro // de 'dzin par byed pa ma yin du zad mod ce na ma yin te /
translated: because it is not of the nature of the primary elements, and because pleasure, etc., are the opposite of that.üîΩBut it is the experiencer because it is the appropriator of the aggregates.

original: za ba po nyid ma yin par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: za ba po nyid ma yin par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because it would follow, absurdly, that the person would not be an experiencer.

original: skyes bu ni za ba por 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu ni za ba por 'dod pa yin no //
translated: The person is asserted to be an experiencer.

original: nyams su myong bar byed pa las gzhan pa'i za ba po nyid ni med do //
analyzed: nyams su myong bar byed pa las gzhan pa'i za ba po nyid ni med do //
translated: There is no experiencer other than the one who experiences.

original: 'dis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu bsal //
analyzed: 'dis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu bsal //
translated: This refutes cause and effect.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: blo dang sgra la sogs pa'i bde ba dag ni rgyu dang 'bras bu gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid kyi dngos po kho na las yin no //
analyzed: blo dang sgra la sogs pa'i bde ba dag ni rgyu dang 'bras bu gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid kyi dngos po kho na las yin no //
translated: Because pleasure, etc., are the cause and effect of the mind, etc., and of the entities that are the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: gang gi phyir sngon po la sogs pa rang gi rnam par gtod pas blo skye bar byed pa nyid kyis gzung ba yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sngon po la sogs pa rang gi rnam par gtod pas blo skye bar byed pa nyid kyis gzung ba yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: Because the mind arises by being directed toward blue, etc., it is the apprehended object, not anything else.

original: gzung ba nyid ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid las yin te /
analyzed: gzung ba nyid ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid las yin te /
translated: The object is established as the entity of cause and effect.

original: des na gzung pa nyid kyis rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du 'grub bo //
analyzed: des na gzung pa nyid kyis rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du 'grub bo //
translated: Therefore, the object is established as cause and effect.

original: gzung ba nyid de yang rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba nyid de yang rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, the object is the basis of positing.

original: skyes bu yang sgra la sogs pa 'dzin par byed pa yin pas de yang de dag gi 'bras bu nyid du 'gyur na /
analyzed: skyes bu yang sgra la sogs pa 'dzin par byed pa yin pas de yang de dag gi 'bras bu nyid du 'gyur na /
translated: Since a person is the apprehender of sound, etc., it would be the effect of those.

original: de lta na yang ma yin pa de'i phyir ma nges so //
analyzed: de lta na yang ma yin pa de'i phyir ma nges so //
translated: But that is not so. Therefore, it is not established.

original: yang na / 'dis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu bsal //
analyzed: yang na / 'dis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu bsal //
translated: Or, this refutes cause and effect.

original: ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not established.

original: zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: This is explained as follows:

original: blo dang bde ba rgyu dang 'bras bu gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid kyi dngos po las min //
analyzed: blo dang bde ba rgyu dang 'bras bu gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid kyi dngos po las min //
translated: The mind and pleasure are not the entity of cause and effect or the object and subject.

original: gang la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po yod ba der rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bor 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po yod ba der rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bor 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Where there is the entity of object and subject, there is not the nature of cause and effect,

original: skyes bu dang sgra la sogs pa'i bde ba bzhin no /
analyzed: skyes bu dang sgra la sogs pa'i bde ba bzhin no /
translated: like the pleasure of a person and sound, etc.

original: 'on te blo dang skyes bu la sogs pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po nyid las rgyu dang 'bras bu ngo bor 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'on te blo dang skyes bu la sogs pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po nyid las rgyu dang 'bras bu ngo bor 'gyur na /
translated: But if the mind, person, etc. were the cause and effect of the entities of the apprehended and apprehender,

original: 'o na ni de nyid @301b las de rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni de nyid @301b las de rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid bzhin no //
translated: then they would be the cause and effect of just that.

original: de lta yin dang / skyes bu yang 'bras bu nyid du thal bar mi 'dod par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de lta yin dang / skyes bu yang 'bras bu nyid du thal bar mi 'dod par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If that were so, it would follow that the person would not be accepted as the effect,

original: de nyid kyis ma nges par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: de nyid kyis ma nges par 'gyur ro /
translated: or it would be uncertain.

original: yang na blo dang bde ba rgyu dang 'bras bu ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na blo dang bde ba rgyu dang 'bras bu ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, the mind and pleasure are not cause and effect,

original: gzung dang 'dzin pa nyid med phyir //
analyzed: gzung dang 'dzin pa nyid med phyir //
translated: because they do not have the nature of the apprehended and apprehender.

original: yod na'ang de ni gzhan la'ang 'gyur //
analyzed: yod na'ang de ni gzhan la'ang 'gyur //
translated: Even if they did, that would apply to other things as well.

original: de phyir de ni nang nyid dang // myong bya nyid phyir sems yin no //
analyzed: de phyir de ni nang nyid dang // myong bya nyid phyir sems yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is the mind because it is internal and because it is the experience.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang rig rang bzhin myong ba yin //
analyzed: rang rig rang bzhin myong ba yin //
translated: Because it is the experience of the nature of reflexive awareness.

original: de ni de yi myong ba yin //
analyzed: de ni de yi myong ba yin //
translated: That is the experience of that.

original: phyi rol nyid la tshad ma med pa'i phyir dang / nang nyid du myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol nyid la tshad ma med pa'i phyir dang / nang nyid du myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no valid knowledge in relation to external things and because it is experienced internally.

original: dngos gang ci ltar rig gyur pa //
analyzed: dngos gang ci ltar rig gyur pa //
translated: Whatever thing is cognized

original: de ni de bzhin nyid yin rtogs //üîΩmyong ba med par dngos po rnams //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin nyid yin rtogs // myong ba med par dngos po rnams //
translated: That is suchness, understood.üîΩThings are not established as existent

original: yod par gtan la phebs ma yin //
analyzed: yod par gtan la phebs ma yin //
translated: without experience.

original: gang gi phyir rig par byed pa ma yin pa de ni de'i rig par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rig par byed pa ma yin pa de ni de'i rig par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it is not a cognizer, it is not the cognizer of that.

original: bde ba la sogs pa yang phyi rol gyi rang bzhin dang rjes su mthun par rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa yang phyi rol gyi rang bzhin dang rjes su mthun par rig pa ma yin no //
translated: And pleasure, etc. are not cognized in accordance with their external nature.

original: myong ba yang gzhan la dngos po yang gzhan no zhes bya bar ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: myong ba yang gzhan la dngos po yang gzhan no zhes bya bar ni mi 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable to say that the experience is one thing and the entity another.

original: sngon po rig par byed pa ni ser po yin no zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sngon po rig par byed pa ni ser po yin no zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not possible to say that the cognizer of blue is yellow.

original: de ltar rig pa rang rig pa'i rang bzhin du 'jug pa ni rang rig pa'i rang bzhin nyid gsal bar byed kyi /
analyzed: de ltar rig pa rang rig pa'i rang bzhin du 'jug pa ni rang rig pa'i rang bzhin nyid gsal bar byed kyi /
translated: Thus, the engagement of cognition in the nature of self-awareness is the very nature of self-awareness that illuminates.

original: bde ba la sogs pa gzhan gyis rtogs par bya par rig pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa gzhan gyis rtogs par bya par rig pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that cognition is cognized by another, such as pleasure, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni mig la sogs pas 'jug pa rig pa yin pa'i phyir rang rig pa'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni mig la sogs pas 'jug pa rig pa yin pa'i phyir rang rig pa'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
translated: Form, etc. are not of the nature of self-awareness because their engagement is by the eye, etc.

original: yang na bde ba la sogs pa rnam pa med pas 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na bde ba la sogs pa rnam pa med pas 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: Or, since pleasure and so on are not apprehended as having aspects,

original: des na bde ba'i rnam pa nyid kyis rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: des na bde ba'i rnam pa nyid kyis rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir na /
translated: because they are known by the aspect of pleasure itself,

original: rnam par shes pa yang bde ba'i rnam pa nyid du grub pas de'i nang du chud pa'i bde ba rtogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid do zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang bde ba'i rnam pa nyid du grub pas de'i nang du chud pa'i bde ba rtogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid do zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: consciousness is established as having the aspect of pleasure itself. Therefore, it is established that pleasure is the nature of the cognition that apprehends it.

original: 'o na bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa yang phyi rol du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa yang phyi rol du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Well, then, like pots and so on, pleasure and so on would be external.

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: That is illogical.

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba yin yang gzhan nye bar gnas pas skye ba yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba yin yang gzhan nye bar gnas pas skye ba yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Although the aspects of pots and so on are the nature of consciousness, they arise from the presence of something else,

original: de la sogs pa'i byed pa rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la sogs pa'i byed pa rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the existence of such things as pots is not realized.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni goms pa'i stobs kyis khyad par du 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni goms pa'i stobs kyis khyad par du 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The aspects of pleasure and so on are distinguished by the power of habituation.

original: gzhan nye bar gnas pa la rag las pa nyid du ma yin no //üîΩgal te goms pa la rag las pa nyid yin yang bde ba la @302a * //
analyzed: gzhan nye bar gnas pa la rag las pa nyid du ma yin no // gal te goms pa la rag las pa nyid yin yang bde ba la @302a * //
translated: It is not dependent on the presence of something else.

original: sogs pa myong ba'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: sogs pa myong ba'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: Even if it is dependent on habituation, it is not the nature of the experience of pleasure, etc.

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin du gyur pa ma yin pa'i myong bas rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin du gyur pa ma yin pa'i myong bas rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not experienced as a natural state.

original: bde ba la sogs pa ni goms pa la 'phel bar 'gyur ba yin yang myong ba'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa ni goms pa la 'phel bar 'gyur ba yin yang myong ba'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Even if pleasure, etc., increase through habituation, they are not the nature of experience.

original: 'di la bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: gal te de rang bzhin min ba //
analyzed: gal te de rang bzhin min ba //
translated: If it is not the nature of that,

original: myong bas blo gnas de rig na //
analyzed: myong bas blo gnas de rig na //
translated: and it is known through experience,

original: bde ba la sogs pa rang rig pa yin na rtogs pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa rang rig pa yin na rtogs pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur gyi /
translated: If pleasure, etc., are reflexive awareness, they would be the nature of realization.

original: de'i rnam pa can ma yin pa bdag gzhan du gyur pa rig pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa can ma yin pa bdag gzhan du gyur pa rig pas ni ma yin no //
translated: But they are not known through the awareness of something else that does not have their aspects.

original: des na skyes bu 'bras bu nyid du 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: des na skyes bu 'bras bu nyid du 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, a person would not become the effect of that.

original: de'i rnam par skye ba nyid kyis na de 'bras bur gyur pa yin na de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i rnam par skye ba nyid kyis na de 'bras bur gyur pa yin na de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But if it is the result of that, it does not exist,

original: de de'i rnam pa can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de de'i rnam pa can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not have the form of that.

original: de'i rang bzhin du gyur pa ma yin pa nyid kyi myong bas blo'i nang du zhugs pa'i bde ba la sogs pa rig par byed pa'am /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin du gyur pa ma yin pa nyid kyi myong bas blo'i nang du zhugs pa'i bde ba la sogs pa rig par byed pa'am /
translated: It is not the nature of that, because it is not experienced as such.

original: de dang 'du ba yin no //
analyzed: de dang 'du ba yin no //
translated: Or, it is associated with that.

original: des na 'du bas 'brel pa'i phyir myong ba dang blo gcig tu mngon par rlom pa yin no zhe na /üîΩmngon sum dran pa'i rnam pa can //
analyzed: des na 'du bas 'brel pa'i phyir myong ba dang blo gcig tu mngon par rlom pa yin no zhe na / mngon sum dran pa'i rnam pa can //
translated: Therefore, because of the association, you assume that experience and cognition are one.

original: myong ba ma gtogs 'di blo gang //
analyzed: myong ba ma gtogs 'di blo gang //
translated: Cognition is not different from experience,üîΩbecause it has the aspect of memory of perception.

original: blo zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig lhag par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: blo zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig lhag par zhen pa'o //
translated: What is this so-called cognition? It is a special kind of awareness.

original: rig pa de gang yin na gnyis su myong ba'o //
analyzed: rig pa de gang yin na gnyis su myong ba'o //
translated: What is this awareness? It is the experience of duality.

original: tha dad pa la tshad ma yod na de skad brjod par bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: tha dad pa la tshad ma yod na de skad brjod par bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: If it is valid knowledge with regard to something different, then it should be expressed in that way.

original: lhag par zhen pa dang nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs tsam du zad do //
analyzed: lhag par zhen pa dang nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs tsam du zad do //
translated: ‚ÄúSpecial kind of awareness‚Äù and ‚Äúexperience‚Äù are mere synonyms.

original: yul gyi rnam pa myong ba ma yin pa'i bdag nyid ni blo yin la /
analyzed: yul gyi rnam pa myong ba ma yin pa'i bdag nyid ni blo yin la /
translated: The self is the cognition that does not experience the aspect of the object.

original: rnam pa med pa'i myong ba ni rtogs pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa med pa'i myong ba ni rtogs pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhe na /
translated: The experience without an aspect is the nature of the realization.

original: rnam pa med pa'i myong ba zhes bya ba 'di la tshad ma med do //
analyzed: rnam pa med pa'i myong ba zhes bya ba 'di la tshad ma med do //
translated: There is no valid cognition in this so-called experience without an aspect.

original: mngon sum gyis rig pa ma yin pa des na tshad ma med do zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis rig pa ma yin pa des na tshad ma med do zhe na ma yin te /
translated: It is not a cognition by direct perception, and therefore there is no valid cognition.

original: khas len pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khas len pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not so, because there is no reason to accept it.

original: mngon sum med pa la ni rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum med pa la ni rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin te /
translated: There is no inference without direct perception.

original: des na khas blang ba nyid du mi rigs so //
analyzed: des na khas blang ba nyid du mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to accept it.

original: 'on te myong ba gzhan med na bde ba la sogs pa myong ba med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te myong ba gzhan med na bde ba la sogs pa myong ba med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if there is no other experience, it follows that there is no experience of pleasure, etc.

original: rang rig pa nyid kyis myong na ci 'gal tha snyad ni de tsam gyis yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir na gzhan ni don med do //
analyzed: rang rig pa nyid kyis myong na ci 'gal tha snyad ni de tsam gyis yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir na gzhan ni don med do //
translated: If it is experienced by self-awareness, what is the contradiction? The conventional is completely fulfilled by that alone, so another is pointless.

original: ci ste yang /
analyzed: ci ste yang /
translated: But if you say,

original: gal te myong gzhan mi 'dod na //
analyzed: gal te myong gzhan mi 'dod na //
translated: If you do not accept another experience,

original: de'i tshe thar pa'i gnas skabs na //
analyzed: de'i tshe thar pa'i gnas skabs na //
translated: then at the time of liberation

original: bde dang sdug bsngal des grol ba //
analyzed: bde dang sdug bsngal des grol ba //
translated: And is liberated from pleasure and pain.üîΩ

original: med pa ci ltar thar bar 'gyur //
analyzed: med pa ci ltar thar bar 'gyur //
translated: How can that which is non-existent be liberated from pleasure and pain?

original: rang bzhin yongs su 'dor na ni //
analyzed: rang bzhin yongs su 'dor na ni //
translated: If it is the intrinsic nature that is relinquished,

original: chos can med par thal bar @302b 'gyur ;
analyzed: chos can med par thal bar @302b 'gyur ;
translated: then it follows that the entity does not exist.

original: / rang gi bdag nyid ni spang par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: / rang gi bdag nyid ni spang par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: One cannot relinquish one‚Äôs own intrinsic nature.

original: bde ba la sogs pa tha dad par ni /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa tha dad par ni /
translated: If you say that pleasure, etc., are different,

original: gal te da lta'i gnas skabs na tha dad pa med pa rtogs pa de lta na yang tha dad par lhag par nges pa'i spyod yul du byas pas spang bar nus pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te da lta'i gnas skabs na tha dad pa med pa rtogs pa de lta na yang tha dad par lhag par nges pa'i spyod yul du byas pas spang bar nus pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: even though they are not perceived to be different in the present moment, still they can be relinquished because they are taken as objects of the ascertainment of difference.

original: gal te 'di 'dod pa de lta na yang tshad mas ma grub pa ni mi 'grub po /
analyzed: gal te 'di 'dod pa de lta na yang tshad mas ma grub pa ni mi 'grub po /
translated: If you accept this, then what is not established by a valid cognition cannot be established.

original: bdag gi 'dod pa mi 'grub pa'i don yod do zhes bya bas ni tshad ma med pa'i don grub pa'i yul du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag gi 'dod pa mi 'grub pa'i don yod do zhes bya bas ni tshad ma med pa'i don grub pa'i yul du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: The meaning of ‚ÄúI do not establish my own thesis‚Äù is not the object that is established by a valid cognition.

original: rgyu rnams ni rgyu med pa'i ni 'dod pa rjes su 'jug pa ma yin la /
analyzed: rgyu rnams ni rgyu med pa'i ni 'dod pa rjes su 'jug pa ma yin la /
translated: Causes do not follow the desire for causes.

original: don la rgyu yod do zhes bya ba 'di la tshad ma yang cung zad med de sgom pa da ltar nyid bsgom pa la gnas pa na cha yod par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don la rgyu yod do zhes bya ba 'di la tshad ma yang cung zad med de sgom pa da ltar nyid bsgom pa la gnas pa na cha yod par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In fact, there is not the slightest valid cognition to prove that there is a cause, because when the present meditation is established, it is seen to have parts.

original: rdzogs pa de nyid kyi tshe nyon mongs pa spong bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzogs pa de nyid kyi tshe nyon mongs pa spong bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And at the time of completion, it is seen to abandon afflictions.

original: da ltar ni de lta bur gyur pa'i myong ba gzhan nyid skye ba yin gyi /
analyzed: da ltar ni de lta bur gyur pa'i myong ba gzhan nyid skye ba yin gyi /
translated: Now, the arising of a different experience of that kind occurs.

original: bde ba la sogs pa myong ba las tha dad par rtogs pa ni med do //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa myong ba las tha dad par rtogs pa ni med do //
translated: But there is no cognition separate from the experience of pleasure, etc.

original: thar pa'i gnas skabs su yang de bzhin du yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: thar pa'i gnas skabs su yang de bzhin du yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
translated: And because it is the same in the state of liberation, there is no contradiction.üîΩTherefore:

original: de'i phyir / de dang de don la brten nas //
analyzed: de'i phyir / de dang de don la brten nas //
translated: Based on that and that object,

original: bde dang sdug bsngal sogs myong ba //
analyzed: bde dang sdug bsngal sogs myong ba //
translated: the experience of pleasure, pain, etc.

original: gcig nyid 'byung bar 'gyur mthong gi / bar du gzhan ni ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: gcig nyid 'byung bar 'gyur mthong gi / bar du gzhan ni ma mthong ngo //
translated: Is seen to arise as one, but in between, another is not seen.

original: gal te blo dang bde ba la sogs pa zhes tha dad pas tha dad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te blo dang bde ba la sogs pa zhes tha dad pas tha dad pa ma yin nam /
translated: If cognition and pleasure, etc. are different, are they not different?

original: de lta ma yin na don tha dad pa med par brjod pa tha dad par ci ltar 'gyur zhen /üîΩma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na don tha dad pa med par brjod pa tha dad par ci ltar 'gyur zhen / ma yin te /
translated: Otherwise, how could there be different expressions without different referents?

original: 'di ni dga' ba dang zhum ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa du ma can gcig nyid 'byung bar mthong ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dga' ba dang zhum ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa du ma can gcig nyid 'byung bar mthong ste /
translated: No, because it is seen that a single thing can have many aspects, such as being delightful or disheartening.

original: de la ming ci ltar 'dod par gdags la rag go //
analyzed: de la ming ci ltar 'dod par gdags la rag go //
translated: So it is up to you what name to give it.

original: brjod pa tha dad par ni gnas skabs kyi khyad par bstan pa'i don du yin te /üîΩdper na sa bon dang myu gu dang / 'dod pa ma dang chu'i brjod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: brjod pa tha dad par ni gnas skabs kyi khyad par bstan pa'i don du yin te / dper na sa bon dang myu gu dang / 'dod pa ma dang chu'i brjod pa bzhin no //
translated: Different expressions are used to indicate different states,

original: lcags gong dang ni me bzhin du //
analyzed: lcags gong dang ni me bzhin du //
translated: just as seed, sprout, and so on are expressed, and desire, water, and so on are expressed.

original: 'dres pa rnam dbyer med ce na //
analyzed: 'dres pa rnam dbyer med ce na //
translated: If you say that the mixed are inseparable,üîΩlike a lump of iron and fire,

original: de lta yin na dngos kun la //üîΩtha dad tha dad min bzhag nyams //
analyzed: de lta yin na dngos kun la // tha dad tha dad min bzhag nyams //
translated: then all thingsüîΩare undermined in being posited as different or not different.

original: gal te dpe yod pa tsam gyis tshad ma med par 'di ni gnyis 'dres pa yin no zhes brtags pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te dpe yod pa tsam gyis tshad ma med par 'di ni gnyis 'dres pa yin no zhes brtags pa yin na /
translated: If you posit the inseparability of the two truths as a mere analogy,

original: de lta yin na ni ka ba la sogs pa rnam pa gcig tu rtogs pa thams cad la gcig ba nyid du mi 'grub po //
analyzed: de lta yin na ni ka ba la sogs pa rnam pa gcig tu rtogs pa thams cad la gcig ba nyid du mi 'grub po //
translated: If that were so, then all the cognitions of a single aspect, such as a pillar, would not be established as a single entity.

original: gcig ma grub na ni de 'dus pa'i rang bzhin du yang mi 'grub pas na dngos po'i rnam par gzhag pa mtha' dag 'jig par 'gyur te /üîΩgcig @303a * //
analyzed: gcig ma grub na ni de 'dus pa'i rang bzhin du yang mi 'grub pas na dngos po'i rnam par gzhag pa mtha' dag 'jig par 'gyur te / gcig @303a * //
translated: If a single entity is not established, then a nature that is a collection of those is also not established. Therefore, the entire system of entities would be destroyed.

original: dang du ma las ma gtogs pa'i dngos po mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang du ma las ma gtogs pa'i dngos po mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because an entity that is neither a single unit nor a plurality is impossible.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / tha dad med myong gcig yin na //
analyzed: 'di ltar / tha dad med myong gcig yin na //
translated: If there is a single experience without difference,

original: de ltar gang yin de tha dad //
analyzed: de ltar gang yin de tha dad //
translated: then whatever is like that is established as having difference.

original: can 'grub 'di sgrub byed yin na //
analyzed: can 'grub 'di sgrub byed yin na //
translated: If this is the proof of that,

original: tha dad grub byed 'grub ma yin //
analyzed: tha dad grub byed 'grub ma yin //
translated: then the proof of difference is not established.

original: de'i phyir gcig ma grub na gnyi ga yang mi grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig ma grub na gnyi ga yang mi grub bo //
translated: Therefore, if a single unit is not established, then both are not established.

original: de bas na tha dad pa med par rig pa ni gcig yin la de las bzlog pas ni du ma yin no zhes rigs so //
analyzed: de bas na tha dad pa med par rig pa ni gcig yin la de las bzlog pas ni du ma yin no zhes rigs so //
translated: Thus it is logical that the absence of difference is a single unit and the opposite of that is a plurality.

original: grangs can gyi ltar na ni //üîΩsdug bsngal dkar sogs tha dad snang //
analyzed: grangs can gyi ltar na ni // sdug bsngal dkar sogs tha dad snang //
translated: But according to the SƒÅ·πÉkhya,üîΩsuffering and so on appear as different.

original: tha dad snang yin blo myong ni //
analyzed: tha dad snang yin blo myong ni //
translated: If they appear as different, the experience of cognition

original: tha dad med snang tha dad na //
analyzed: tha dad med snang tha dad na //
translated: If they appear as nondifferent, but are different,

original: tha dad tha dad med rten ci //
analyzed: tha dad tha dad med rten ci //
translated: then difference and nondifference would be mutually dependent.

original: zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad ba'o //
translated: This is an intermediate verse.

original: 'on te yang ci ltar tshor ba dang / sems pa la sogs pa sems las byung bas chen po la sogs pa rnams phan tshun tha dad par mi rtog la /
analyzed: 'on te yang ci ltar tshor ba dang / sems pa la sogs pa sems las byung bas chen po la sogs pa rnams phan tshun tha dad par mi rtog la /
translated: But if, like the mental factors such as feeling and conceptualization, the great elements and so on are not conceived as different,üîΩand even though they are not conceived as different, they are still asserted to be different, then why not assert the same for cognition and experience?

original: mi rtog pa de lta na yang tha dad par 'dod pa de bzhin du blo dang myong ba yang ci ste mi 'dod tha dad pa med par rig pa gcig nyid do zhes bya ba ni sems kyi 'khor du gyur pa sems las byung ba dag gis ma
analyzed: mi rtog pa de lta na yang tha dad par 'dod pa de bzhin du blo dang myong ba yang ci ste mi 'dod tha dad pa med par rig pa gcig nyid do zhes bya ba ni sems kyi 'khor du gyur pa sems las byung ba dag gis ma
translated: The cognition is not ascertained as a single entity by the mental factors that are part of the mind.

original: nges so zhe na 'dir 'di skad brjod do //
analyzed: nges so zhe na 'dir 'di skad brjod do //
translated: If you say this, then we reply as follows:

original: gcig tshe bsal bas bsgribs na yang /
analyzed: gcig tshe bsal bas bsgribs na yang /
translated: Even if the mind is obscured by the obstruction of one object,

original: sems kyi khyad par rgyun dgal /üîΩtha dad par ni mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems kyi khyad par rgyun dgal / tha dad par ni mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: the stream of the mind‚Äôs specific statesüîΩis seen to be different.

original: tha dad rnam gzhan grub pa yin /
analyzed: tha dad rnam gzhan grub pa yin /
translated: Therefore, difference is established by other means.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba dag tha dad pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa'i phyir de ltar khas len pa ni ma yin mod kyi khas blangs nas kyang lan 'debs pa ni gal te tshor ba la sogs pa shin tu gsal bar 'jug pa gcig gis sems
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba dag tha dad pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa'i phyir de ltar khas len pa ni ma yin mod kyi khas blangs nas kyang lan 'debs pa ni gal te tshor ba la sogs pa shin tu gsal bar 'jug pa gcig gis sems
translated: But we do not accept that, because it is explained that mind and mental factors are not different.üîΩEven if you accept that, we reply: If feeling and so on are very clear mental processes, then they are not obscured by other mental factors and they are the very clear objects of mind.

original: pa la sogs pa bsgribs pas shin tu gsal ba'i yul du gyur pa ma yin pa de lta na yang gzhan gyi tshe dmigs pa'i yul du 'gyur bas na tshor ba dang sems pa la sogs pa ni tha dad pa kho na'o //
analyzed: pa la sogs pa bsgribs pas shin tu gsal ba'i yul du gyur pa ma yin pa de lta na yang gzhan gyi tshe dmigs pa'i yul du 'gyur bas na tshor ba dang sems pa la sogs pa ni tha dad pa kho na'o //
translated: Even if that is so, at other times they become the focal object of mind, and therefore feeling, discernment and so on are definitely different.

original: dus gzhan du rang gi ngo bos dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dus gzhan du rang gi ngo bos dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are observed by their intrinsic nature at other times.

original: nyi ma'i 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis rang nyid gsal ba'i nus pa bzlog pa'i skar ma'i tshogs de'i tshe med pa'i ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: nyi ma'i 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis rang nyid gsal ba'i nus pa bzlog pa'i skar ma'i tshogs de'i tshe med pa'i ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: The multitude of stars are not nonexistent when the multitude of sunrays that illuminate themselves are blocked.

original: blo dang myong ba dag ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: blo dang myong ba dag ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so for mind and experience.

original: nam gyi tshe yang tha dad par gsal bar mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam gyi tshe yang tha dad par gsal bar mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are never clearly observed to be different.

original: sems las byung ba dag ni res 'ga' zhig gsal bar gyur pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems las byung ba dag ni res 'ga' zhig gsal bar gyur pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because sometimes mental factors are clearly apprehended.

original: gal te mtshan mar 'dzin pa la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa nyid yin par rtogs pa ma yin nam rnam par mi rtog pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mtshan mar 'dzin pa la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa nyid yin par rtogs pa ma yin nam rnam par mi rtog pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you think that the apprehension of signs and so on is conceptualization and not nonconceptualization,

original: ma @303b yin te /
analyzed: ma @303b yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: de la yang sems las byung ba yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de la yang sems las byung ba yod pa yin no //
translated: Because mental factors exist even in that state.

original: 'di ltar res 'ga' ni nyams su myong ba'i de ma thag tu mtshan ma'i rnam par rtogs pa'i yid la res 'ga' ni 'di bya'i snyam pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar res 'ga' ni nyams su myong ba'i de ma thag tu mtshan ma'i rnam par rtogs pa'i yid la res 'ga' ni 'di bya'i snyam pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin te /
translated: Sometimes, immediately after experience, the mind conceptualizes signs, and sometimes it conceptualizes ‚ÄúI will do this‚Äù and so on.

original: des na nyams su myong ba dag rjes su 'brang ba'i rnam par rtog pa las rnam par rtog pa med pa la yang sems las byung ba yod do zhes nges pa yin no //
analyzed: des na nyams su myong ba dag rjes su 'brang ba'i rnam par rtog pa las rnam par rtog pa med pa la yang sems las byung ba yod do zhes nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is certain that mental factors exist even in nonconceptual states that follow experience.

original: des na de dag gi tha dad pa la ni rig pa'i cha yang yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: des na de dag gi tha dad pa la ni rig pa'i cha yang yod pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, there is also a part of cognition that distinguishes those.

original: blo dang myong ba dag ni 'di yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'o //
analyzed: blo dang myong ba dag ni 'di yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'o //
translated: The ultimate is that the mind and experience do not exist.

original: rnal 'byor shes pa sngar bshad pa //
analyzed: rnal 'byor shes pa sngar bshad pa //
translated: The knowledge of the yogi has been explained above.

original: de dag gal te bsgoms byung yin //
analyzed: de dag gal te bsgoms byung yin //
translated: If it arises from meditation,

original: rtog pa'i dra ba rnam bsal nas //
analyzed: rtog pa'i dra ba rnam bsal nas //
translated: it is free from the net of conceptualization,

original: gsal ba nyid du snang ba yin //
analyzed: gsal ba nyid du snang ba yin //
translated: and it appears as clear.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i yul can rnal 'byor ba rnams kyi shes pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i yul can rnal 'byor ba rnams kyi shes pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: The knowledge of the yogi who has the four noble truths as his object has been explained.

original: de rgyu gang las 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: de rgyu gang las 'byung zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of that knowledge?

original: bshad pa / bsgoms byung yin te bsgoms pa'i rgyu can no //
analyzed: bshad pa / bsgoms byung yin te bsgoms pa'i rgyu can no //
translated: It is said: It arises from meditation, it is born from meditation.
